story:
Apologies:

I live in Ukraine and never studied a foreign language. I ask you to forgive me for errors. But I know, who believes in God, who calls to God will hear an appeal for help in any language.


                        

History:

I will tell a story to you, and you will understand why I ask for help. Six months back, my mother had a blow, and I blundered upon the problem of treatment and rehabilitation. And this case has place me on my knees. There is war in Ukraine, a country destroyed and robbed, salary $ 95-100, that social insurance for a 55-6o $ health of pensioners insurance in our country is not done. To find a medical staff and invalid tender, and there is no way this situation the same for all. It is my history, but she the same for everything, who such problem is. And we run into the task of investments of find, to create the normal terms of life for elderly people, whoever has no money, and he intends to live.


                                       


                                       


Project:

Several people with a big heart and a desire to unite a group of volunteers and raising money to buy a house that is suitable for "home for the elderly." We can not do it alone, and this project is to collect starting capital!



I bought this house on their savings, but need a lot of money and labor to make this house a suitable and comfortable accommodation for old people!


    • Let's do it together and succeed:

    Please help us raise money to save the life of the ages, that in the last days these people as seamless as possible and that they should not worry about how they will pay for care and medication.

    We will not stop, but it is difficult to raise funds in the country, which is itself in need of help. So I turned to you for help, and I hope that this is not just empty words. Let you saves God!

    Thank U!

  •      

  •

story:
Hello, dear sir or madam! 

 My name is Anna Litvinova and I'm 20, from Odessa! If I had only one word to describe myself, I'd say: "I'm an artist". I've been painting since I was 10 and cannot imagine myself without art. I graduated form art school and now I'm studying at a university. I also had two personal art exhibitions in my city. You can see my pictures on my website and leave your comments. Every day of my life I dedicate to painting and people’s fun is the best reward for me.

 But it's only one side of me, the other one is a serious genetic disease. My diagnosis is spinal-muscular atrophy (SMA). My muscles are too weak. I could never stand and walk. Also, I can’t seat and even lift my hands without help. My muscles can’t support my spine. Because of it the scoliosis is developing every single day. My spine presses on my internal organs; first on my heart and then lungs. It is very dangerous. Moreover, now I can’t seat more than an hour a day without having awful pain in the back, which does not stop during the day. That’s why I can't paint as much as I want and my dream is getting far from me.

 But nothing can stop me as well as my dream. I love my life very much and don't pay attention to the difficulties. Every day I ask my parents to help me with painting. They give me brushes and colors, help me to seat. When I'm tired and feel pain I continue to paint lying flat on my back. When I can't pick my hand high enough I turn the canvas upside down. In any case, I will find the way out!

 Of course art is not all what I do. I'm also fond of foreign languages. Now I'm studying English, Chineese and Italian. So I can speak 5 languages including my native ones: Russian and Ukrainian. Also I have a lot of friends and acquaintances with whom I spend my free time by speaking and walking. But art is my lifetime project. And it is really difficult to study and to paint when pain and constrained movements bother me all the time.

 I need a surgery for correction of my spine. Doctors claim that I need it urgently. After this surgery the special titanium construction will support my spine instead of weak muscles, the scoliosis will stop developing, and I won't feel pain any more. It is possible to have a surgery in Finland’s hospital ORTON. The surgery costs 42 000 euros. Unfortunately, my family hasn’t got such money. My parents’ salary isn't big. Because of the political situation in Ukraine it's getting more difficult to earn money in my country. We’ve been getting money for one year and a half and now we have only collected a tiny part of it. So, we are in despair.

 This surgery is the expansion my freedom’s limits. After this surgery I will live without any fear and pain, also I will be able to do what I like more.

 So, I am a desperate girl who has hope which costs too much.

 I'm begging you for supporting my effort to have enough money for my surgery. You can help me not only with money; you can pass this link to other people or retell my story to your friends. I would be very grateful to everyone who can help me!!! Thank you in advance!

story:
Short Summary

Integr8ed Health, a division of NU Frontier Communications, is in the midst of building and customizing a patient portal for Canadians affected by cancer, and we need your help.

My name is Andrew Wyllie, and I am the CTO & Founder of NU Frontier Communications. My wife Mahta Sattar has stage IV breast cancer, and my mother in law Ashie Karab has pancreatic cancer. This project is dedicated to their health, as well as the health of many other Canadians affected by Cancer.

In Canada, our medicare system is "aging badly", and "major renovation" is due, according to the recently released Naylor report. In recent years, both the Quebec and Ontario governments have spent a combined $2.6 billion on the development of an Electronic Health Record system, resulting, unfortunately, in a minimally viable product.

It is time for an organization to take the lead and use a grassroots approach in order to help those affected by cancer; that is why my organization is developing this portal. The goal is to develop a one-stop location containing all of the patients' medical data, available and clearly explained, to assist them along their journey. The solution is one that is patient-centered, allowing the patients to fully understand their historic information, vital signs, lab results, etc., and empower them to make a decision with the input of their chosen specialists.

NU Frontier has built a partnership with a leading e-health application development organization that has an install base of over 20 million users across the States. We need your help to properly tailor this portal. The funding from this campaign will enable us to 

  • properly set up a pilot project for selected cancer patients and care givers
  • customize the portal based on feedback
  • license the technology framework from our supplier
  • Ensure that the portal adheres to all privacy and security acts such as PEPIDA
  • Work with other software vendors to provide open data access to provide truly patient centered solutions
  • Begin our marketing campaign to spread the good word to Canadians affected by Cancer across the country 

What We Need & What You Get

NU Frontier is looking to raise $50K in order to fund the above mentioned activities. This solution to be compliant with PIPEDA (Canadian version of HIPAA) so we will be working with a top security expert and ensure that all the data is secure and resides in Canada. 

Some of the perks for your help include:

- integr8edhealth.ca t-shirt and social media shoutout.

- integr8edhealth.ca t-shirt + ballcap and social media shoutout

- one year subscription to integr8edhealth.ca for cancer patient of your choosing.

- Activité Pop + Personal Training Evaluation

Activité Pop is a unique and sportive watch that tracks all of your activities during the day from sleeping, to running to swimming. 

- Shearling Coats - European made and stylish that will keep you warm in the winter

- Advisory Committee - assist our team from a strategic capacity to help cancer patients throughout Canada. We also offer a surprise gift with this perk.

Even if we don't reach our goal we plan to continue on our mission to assist in promoting open standards based patient portal solutions throughout Canada. We still intend on going live with integr8edhealth.ca however we recognize that it might take longer to make it available for Cancer patients at large throughout Canada.

The Impact

Currently the system is set up in such a way that it is not patient friendly. If my wife has a CT Scan in a private hospital that is not directly connected to the public network significant delays occur with obtaining results. This leads to unnecessary anxiety for the patient. I firmly believe that the healthcare professionals are doing the best job they possibly can, however the tools especially from a technology and workflow perspective are truly outdated. 
How great would it be to have all of your physician notes in a central location? What about your blood tests? How about a graph that plotted your weight over the course of time? 
All of this is possible with technology based solutions. Unfortunately the lack of open standards promoted by government, lack of collaboration between technology solution providers within the industry, has lead to disjointed and siloed solutions.  The end result is the patients' data is scattered and not centralized, leading to tremendous difficulty to proactively monitor the patients' health. You however can help make a change for the better.

Risks & Challenges

Integr8ed Health is focused on privacy and security of all the patient data and will ensure that the PIPEDA standards are followed. We will engage a top security specialist if we can successfully meet our goal. 

There are many IT organizations that currently work with public and private healthcare facilities. We are going to need to work in collaboration with these organizations in order to integrate data into the patient portal solution for cancer patients. We do anticipate some resistance but we fully believe we can reach agreements and demonstrate that it is for the benefit of the patient.

Unlike the US, there currently isn't any adoption of standards in Canada to develop an open architecture framework for data. The US has an incentive based program called meaningful use to promote collaboration amongst solution providers for the benefit of the patients. Integr8ed Health will actively work with like minded Canadian organization to promote meaningful use standards across Canada and encourage the Federal Government to provide leading and direction by implementing recommendations tabled by Naylor report.

Other Ways You Can Help

We love any kind of help no matter what. Even if you aren't in a position to contribute financially, we would greatly appreciated if you could help spread the word to friends, family, colleagues. 
There are a number of share tools through Facebook, LinkedIn Twitter, etc. that can make the difference.

story:
Greetings!
My name is Maxine Iharosy and I'm shaking-in-my-boots excited about receiving an acceptance call to Shakti Initiation: an all female 500 hour Women's Leadership & Yoga Training, which takes place officially beginning in September with weekly calls to discuss assignments and readings prior to the immersion. The month-long training immersion itself takes place in Bali in February of 2016. The program is facilitated by the incredibly skilled teaching team of Jovinna Chan & Grace Jull, both of whom were guiding lights for me during my initial 200 hour Yoga Teacher Training at Kripalu, in Massachusetts. Jovinna for her enthusiasm for moving through the world with awareness and awe, and Grace for her ever-flowing insights in anatomy, science, and the great mysteries of it all.


Who Am I, Really?
I've been living in the Owen Sound area all my life and now I feel it's time for me to give back. By taking this training I will be equipped to reach out to women-at-risk and unite women within the community by facilitating programs intended to develop independence, self-esteem, and empathy for one another. I've been teaching Yoga here for over four years, and my passion for teaching the art of skillful living through Yoga, and studying the origins, philosophy, and modern applicability is a never ending quest for me.

 I grow herbs and vegetables to sustain a small market garden, I walk with awareness along forest trails, I have a deep reverence for Mother Nature and by doing so, I advocate for supporting the Divine Feminine (Shakti). It's my vision to participate fully in my community on behalf of celebrating our human lineage in a kind, gentle, giving-back-to-the-land kind of way, recognizing with humbleness the power we have at our disposal. I believe starting with the compassionate study of ourselves, our morals, our way of living, comes first. But how does one get to that place of compassionate self-study?
Practice, practice, practice.

The Work I Do.
And Why I need the Financial Support.
I teach Yoga (and grow vegetables) because I can’t imagine anything I’d rather do. I love eating well, working hard, collaborating with others, being outside, being in my body, supporting the inward journey of others & feeling alive. I don’t even mind swimming against the current- I’ve don’t it all my life. It might seem like more work sometimes, but in all truth it’s much easier to find real nourishment if you’re facing upstream. I wish to recognize fully the trauma that is the result of our way of living in our world while still being capable of having an active force in healing and reconciliation between human, and environment. To me this has a great deal to do with supporting equality for all and embracing a shift of perspective in  recognizing our ancestral ties to the natural world as necessary for our holistic survival .That is why I teach, that is why I grow food. That is why for me they are united ways of being.
In the end it is all worth it for me.

I have my financial goal set at $5,500- I'm not set on receiving that (though of course that would  be extremely generous support and amazing). I want to reassure that anything I receive is support enough, that I am grateful for whatever it is that comes my way.
......
So I’m asking for support to do this training because I need the help so I can continue to do what I do and deepen my studies. I’m reaching out and you don’t have to reach back, but if you do I’m eternally grateful. Even if all you can extend is a smile, and to pass this along to anyone you think may be interested in investing in the support. For those who know me, they know of me as being one who works very hard, who is generous with my time and input to the causes of others.



PERKS!!!
I’ve included perks associated with donations. Some have limits as to how many can be collected. Some are open ended! It is not necessary to claim a ‘perk’ if you do not wish to. Everyone who donates will receive a personal thankyou.

The Program Costs:
The tuition for the program is $4,200 US.  That’s not considering the flight, resources, and Visa into the country. Any little bit helps!

Commitment to Studies
I hold certifications in the following:
200 hour Kripalu Yoga Teacher Training
100 Hour Advanced Anatomy Training with Devatree
50 Hour Advanced Asana Training with Devatree
50 Hour Subtle Energy Body Training with Devatree
50 Hour Art of Assisting Yoga Postures Training with Devatree

Upcoming Certifications
-100 hour Prenatal Yoga Teacher Training with Devatree (October)

-500 hour Women’s Leadership and Yoga Training (will be completed end of March 2016).

So much grace, light, and love to you for reading.
May you step softly and sweetly ever closer to your inner truth. .

story:
The National Kidney Foundation of Maryland continues its mission of early detection and early intervention through free KEY (Kidneys: Evaluate Yours) health screenings. KEY screenings, held throughout our service area, identify early markers for high blood pressure, diabetes and kidney disease. Funds raised will help to further our mission to raise awareness to prevent disease, thus improving the health and well-being of individuals and families affected by these diseases and increasing the availability of all organs for transplantation. 

You can make a difference today by donating to support kidney patients in Maryland. 

Mission Story Highlight: Awareness. Prevention and Treatment are key to ensuring positive outcomes for individuals. 

Rick first discovered he had Renal Cell Cancer (RCC) at the end of 2012 when it was discovered that there was blood in his urine. Following a right nephrectomy in January 2013, he also learned that the other kidney was only functioning at about 25%, due to long-term diabetes and hypertension, as well as years of using ibuprofen. His wife had planned on being a “paired donor” for a transplant. However, Rick’s cancer returned and metastasized to both lungs just short of the one year requirement of being cancer free to get on the list, now making that impossible. In addition to taking a targeted therapy drug for the RCC, Rick made drastic diet changes, trying to ward off dialysis as long as possible. But in January 2015 Rick started training for home hemodialysis. Due to a number of issues, he switched to Peritoneal Dialysis in March 2015 and uses a cycler nightly at home. All of this was overwhelming – physically and emotionally - and meant having to make a lot of decisions. The couple regularly attends the renal support group, gaining insight from other patients, as well as accurate and reliable information from medical members, the National Kidney Foundation of Maryland and other resources. In gratitude and in an effort to raise public awareness and funds for kidney disease, Rick and his wife have already participated in three Kidney Walks and plan on being active for many more in the future.

For more information about the National Kidney Foundation of Maryland and our services, visit www.kidneymd.org.

being cancer free to get on the list, now making that impossible. In addition
to taking a targeted therapy drug for the RCC, Rick made drastic diet changes,
trying to ward off dialysis as long as possible. But in January 2015 Rick
started training for home hemodialysis. Due to a number of issues, he switched
to Peritoneal Dialysis in March 2015 and uses a cycler nightly at home. All of this
was overwhelming – physically and emotionally - and meant having to make a lot
of decisions. The couple regularly attends the renal support group, gaining
insight from other patients, as well as accurate and reliable information from
medical members, the National Kidney Foundation of Maryland and other resources. In gratitude and in an effort to
raise public awareness and funds for kidney disease, Rick and his wife have
already participated in three Kidney Walks and plan on being
active for many more in the future.For more information about the National Kidney Foundation of Maryland and our services, visit www.kidneymd.org.

story:
You have a busy life!

So do I and I can't wait to use Rambly myself!   As the lead of a top notch Website Development team, mother of three, and serial entrepreneur,  my day is literally all over the map!  I need more than just a list of appointments.  I need a smart tool that knows where I am, where I am going, when I am going to be late, and what would be helpful for me to know is in the area.  The Rambly app will do all of these things and more.

How Rambly Works

Rambly will pull in your e-calendar to plot your day's appointments onto a colorful map, draw a line to trace your optimal route, and then help you navigate through the day, keep you in contact with people you are meeting, and will allow small local business owners to invite you in to their shops if you are passing by.  You can drop a pin onto the map to add an appointment, and keep a running to do list that is location based.


Help me complete the development of Rambly!  Your smart phone will manage your time, and when Rambly is integrated with onboard GPS systems, when you get in, your car will already know where you are going!


Your Super Power Assistant!

Rambly will manage your calendar, make suggestions based on the content of your calendar, and act as a personal assistant.  It will know when you have down time and can squeeze in a few to do's, or show you perks at local shops that you can drop in and accept.  It will know if you are running late and cue up a call, and let you know if you havent had a hair cut in a while.  The Rambly Reminders are all written by you, our Rambly community.  Our algorithm is hand crafted!

Supporting  Locally Owned Businesses and artisans!

We love hand crafted goods, locally sourced foods, and home grown mom and pop shops.  We are passionate about supporting the small businesses that strengthen local economies and employ a majority of workers.  Our roots are in small-town USA and we developed a unique model to help small shops reach their community.  Businesses that offer perks must also show how far the owner lives from the business.


We are challenging the Groupon and steep discount model that can actually hurt a small business.  Rather than getting offer takers who who may never return, shops can reach folks who are actually in the area, and reward them for stopping in, giving both the customer and the business the opportunity to build a relationship.  Additionally shops will know generally when a customer plans to come in, rather than have an unknown time period of two months, making it very difficult to plan what supplies or resources are needed.  Rather than offering discounts, which we certainly all needed during the economic downturn, businesses can instead offer perks and gifts, such as an extra donut or a bottle of champagne with dinner!


Our hand-crafted algorithm will only show offers on your daily map that are near by, or that make sense based on your schedule.  You can receive spontaneous offerings from neighborhood shops who will be enticing you to "ramble on in".  



--The beautiful studios of  Blink Inc. in Corte Madera, CA


Do you drive kids around all day? 

Since school busses have gone the way of the dinosaur, parents find themselves driving all day long taking their kids to and from schools and events. We will pause our regular program, and present this song for your entertainment.  I stopped into a music store to buy a guitar pick for my son and walked out with a ukelele.  Pretty good sales people at Bananas At Large in San Rafael, CA, especially considering I havent played an instrument since fifth grade.   Consequently I had to come up with a song, and this is what happened.  


To succeed in life, you need three things:  
a wishbone, a backbone, and a funny bone."     
 Reba McEntire 





Why support Rambly?

"Mr. Wonderful" of Shark Tank recently learned that all of the businesses he had invested in that were profitable are led by women. He was shocked! We aren't. Nope! Because women in general have to be extremely resourceful with their time and resources due to family management responsibilities.  We  typically tackle only problems that we feel confident we can solve, and when we go for it, we are all in. That is me. Every minute I am spending on Rambly I am NOT spending time with my kids, and I intend to not let that lost time with them go to waste. I intend to bring Rambly to market, and to introduce a woman's solution to time management, and a more relationship and reward-based promotional alternative to connect locally owned businesses with their community.


Cool SWAG you can get

Support girls in tech!  $25

Rambly is woman founded, owned, and invented.    The number of women in tech is dwindling.  It's no wonder!  I have been asked many times who my technical lead is.  "uh...I am" I reply.  A techie doesn't need to be a 20 something guy in slouchy jeans. A Techie can be a mom with a ukelele and a mini-van! We need young women to jump in, and to bring the world their amazing ideas that will change our future!  You can make a difference!  Help fund Rambly, and at the same time support emerging women and girls in technology around the globe.  We have created this super cool version of our beanie to represent our dedication to getting more girls in tech and also to be their inventive selves. If you choose this beanie perk, we will donate $2 to Girls Who Code (https://www.girlswhocode.com/) plus send you this cool beanie!

Buy this cool beanie for $25


Rambly T-shirts with rusty icon - $25

To me the word rambly evokes the feeling of a warm summer wind blowing in through the window of an old rusty pick-up truck meandering down a dirt road in rural Minnesota where I grew up. It is the sound of tires on a bumpy road, the passing of time as a natural rhythm, waiting for the corn to grow and the cows to come home. Pausing for a moment to look over a vast field of prairie grass waving in the wind feels very similar to standing and looking out at the ocean as the waves roll in, one after the other. This rusty pin icon represents that time of waiting, of giving up control and allowing ourselves to become a part of our surroundings rather than trying to change them.

Black Beanies with "hand crafted" pin- $25


Business Owners!  Have our map pin decorated with your brand! - $200




Give a gift to your favorite local businesses!

If you make any contribution, you can gift a year of the Rambly Ultimate Perks Premium  Account to three of your favorite local businesses (a $5,000 value).  We will provide them with free premium offer publishing for an entire year!  Standard perks accounts will be just $100 per month.  We are committed to leveling the playing field for small businesses.  We want to support businesses owned by individuals and families. 


Rambly's Impact

Rambly will be a game changer in the possibilities it will open in mobile apps, and you can be a part of that.  We will use the funds raised to build Rambly and to promote it to the wider public.  Using a map to navigate through our schedules will open up endless possibilities.  You will be able to search through your calendar for photos geographically, or set up a romantic date with someone crossing your path while accepting a perk from a local restaurant such as a candle lit private table.  Airlines will recognize that you need a flight, and can compete for your purchase.  You can subscribe to public calendars and see that your favorite band is having a concert when you look at your map for the weekend.  We know that you also will also be coming up with amazing ways to use Rambly and we want to make those ideas come to life!

A Mother Venture

"By now we have all heard how hard it is for woman-led ventures to acquire funding.  You can help me beat the odds, and be a part of the launching of a disruptive technology that turns our phones into true personal assistants, and our cars into polite, intuitive chauffeurs."

Wendy

 

Our Team

We live in the Bay Area, and have been surrounded by the start-up environment for a long time.  Our team is comprised of senior level tech professionals.   Rambly is the concept of our founder, Wendy Louise Nog, MSTM, a serial entrepreneur, adventurer, and proud mom of three.  Her vision is to use Rambly not only for day-to-day navigation and planning, but also for planning weekend trips such as a Farm Tasting tour in the countryside.  Wendy has more than 15 years of experience working in the online and mobile environment.  She knows what it is like to juggle schedules, and to try to find an address buried in an e-mail while driving down the freeway.  Wendy is passionate about supporting the small business community that she loves. 

A message from Wendy:

"Our brains can only focus on one thing at a time.  We are never really multi-tasking, we are just switching rapidly from one thought or task to the next.  Our brains do not enjoy or improve when we do this.  In fact, studies have shown that it actually reduces our ability to focus.  Anyone who runs a business, a household, or even a busy personal life knows how challenging it can be to wade through the basic tasks required to function in our fast moving world.  So many of these tasks can be automated.

We all have generally the same basic needs: sleep, eat, school, work, go to the dentist, doctor, barber or salon, and myriad common errands.  If you are a parent, you are also managing all of these for multiple people.  Why not build an assistant who already knows this, and can manage these tasks for us?  As a community you will help us write and automate those practical reminders that will keep us functioning, healthy, safe, and joyful."

We are excited about bringing Rambly to the world, and the ease that it will bring to our lives, especially those who are juggling families or busy travel schedules.  We would love your help!

For further information and investment inquiries, contact:

​Wendy Louise Nog, MSTM
Principal, Founder, Interactive Producer
Future Bright Enterprise LLC, Mill Valley, CA
p: (415) 275-0970 | wirewendy@gmail.com 
www.future-bright.com | linkedin.com/in/wendylouise

story:
OAasSis Integrative Health Center

OAasSIS is a one-stop, comprehensive online service for holistic health and life care.  

We are an integrative healthcare ecosystem, providing information uniquely tailored to each person's needs. 

Our members benefit from deeply researched, reliable, and personally relevant information guided by professional health advisers. 

 We make holistic approaches to healthcare accessible and more importantly, affordable, for everyone.



Mission

Statistics show the world population is sicker than ever before, which partly means the way we are approaching health isn't working.  OAasSIS empowers its members to make the appropriate holistic lifestyle choices proven to improve overall health. 

We want to bring this type of care to as many people globally as possible, by making it easy to access from anywhere, and affordable to everyone.

Approach

We consider various health care paths when we guide members —assigning only natural and achievable health regimens.  We draw from the best of Naturopathy, Chinese Medicine, Ayurveda, Psychotherapy, Yoga, Chi Gong, Homeopathy, Chiropractic, Dentistry, and Allopathy. 
OAasSIS is built using proprietary Artificial Intelligence knowledge developed by the founder, who has 30+ years of research and holds a PhD in Pattern Recognition. 
Membership is Free, as is our 10-minute Health Profile questionnaire,  which will give you instant feedback on the areas of health that may need your attention.

Personalized recommendations are available starting at a mere $1.99 and go up to $249 for an hour long, video conference with a Sr. health facilitator.  Most holistic care practitioners charge upwards of $350/consultation, and rarely spend and hour with a patient.

We focus on the most practical and effective solutions based on each person's current health status and lifestyle, because if a recommendation isn't attainable, it's useless. 

This is the future of health care...to understand and act upon the knowing that each of us is a whole, complex system of cooperative actions and reactions, and that symptoms call attention to an malfunction that may or may not be physically based... that healing via natural, holistic methods is not only highly effective, but prevents a host of negative side effects and further health issues.

Spiritual Health

Our team is humanitarian driven—allowing each individual to find their own spiritual path.  While not mandatory, OAasSIS will encourage the use of meditation, as a scientific and non-religious practice - as it has proven clinical benefits. Meditation is a core element in the OAasSIS approach.

Your Donations

  • Your donation will enable us to extend our online availability to 24x7
  • Allow us to donate 20% of net cash flow to needed research in integrative healthcare and life-care -- to substantiate the anecdotal claims of supplements and health foods 
  • Translate our site into 6 major languages to reach as many people as possible


Team

Sean S. Subas Ph.D.
Founder/CEO

Dr. Sean Subas brings over 30 years of research into various holistic health modalities to OAasSIS, using the statistical knowledge gained in his Ph.D. program in Pattern Recognition and Artificial Intelligence. He uses this expertise, and his own personal experience and practice of many of the health care modalities listed here, to integrate the knowledge within all disciplines: Naturopathy; Traditional Chinese Medicine; Ayurveda; Psychotherapy; Yoga; Chi Gong; Homeopathy; Meditation; and Allopathy (mainly from a Functional Medicine viewpoint).

Ashok Kumar, MD, CCP, CHC, AADP
Advisor

Dr. Kumar serves on the OAasSIS Medical Advisory Board. He is a board certified Perfusionist (CCP), practicing cardiovascular perfusion since early 90s in open heart surgery, in various New York hospitals. He is currently with the Beth Israel Medical Center in New York. Dr. Kumar received his certification in Functional Medicine from Functional Diagnostic Medicine University. He is certified as a Health Coach by the Institute for Integrative Nutrition.

Andrew Mazzeo

OAS Lead Facilitator

Andy creates facilitator study guides, and conducts training sessions. Andy also functions as a Senior Facilitator, resolving complex healthy-lifestyle-coaching issues.

Andy brings over 30 years of research and personal experience into wellness and functional health. He utilizes his expertise to help individuals immerse themselves in integrative health. He has been using juicing and natural supplementation as alternatives to improve health since 1974 and started therapies in Naturopathic medicine in the early 1990s. Melding Eastern and Western medicine; he balances spiritual, physical, and mental needs to allow the body to optimize healing. Using this approach, he has overcome personal challenges with autoimmune disease. He is certified as a Health Minister by Hallelujah Acres; specializing in maintenance and recovery programs using a plant-based diet -- addressing nutritional deficiencies, reducing toxicity and thereby improving overall health. He received his Master of Arts from Central Michigan University.

Naureen Khan, M.D.(Pakistan)
Health Care Analyst

Dr. Khan reviews medical research for OAasSIS. Dr. Khan holds an MBBS (Bachelor of Medicine & Bachelor of Surgery - the British equivalent of the M.D. in the USA), and has practiced in Obstetrics and Gynecology. She has also worked for a major pharmaceutical company -- initiating clinical studies and investigator-driven trials, to support marketing of key products.

Weihaur Ralph Lau
OAS Lead Facilitator and a member of the OAS Circle of Practitioners

Weihaur Lau has over 15 years of experience in life coaching that includes counseling, yoga, nutritional cleansing, complementary medicine, mindfulness training and health management. He has successfully coached people with chronic physical pains, HIV, stroke, auto-immune disease and stress – helping them achieve optimal health.

No matter where you are today, OAasSIS will get you to a better place tomorrow.

story:
HONEYBEE WRAPS ™

Honeybee Wrap is here to stay. No more plastic wrap.

We have created an organic safe and reusable natural alternative to plastic wrap.

No chemicals, only local bees wax from the farm, certified organic cotton, jojoba oil, tree resin and love. 

Ideal for wrapping fruit and veggies, covering a bowl and wrapping lunches, this unique formula seals in the goodness, keeping your food fresh for longer. No more limp celery and shallots, just beautifully kept fresh crisp veggies and herbs. Can also  be used for storing bread and as a fermenter's friend it's perfect for covering Kombucha,  Kefir and fermented foods .

Use the warmth of your hands to mold and shape your wrap over food and dishes. The wrap will stick to itself when you press firmly over a bowl or plate. When stored in the fridge the beeswax will harden, helping retain the shape. With due care your Honeybee wrap will last up to one year and at the end of its life you can give it back to the earth.  Yes it's compostable!

Bees wax has been used for centuries for its persevering properties, along with jojoba oil which has known antibacterial and anti-fungal properties. Together they create a beautiful preserving infusion.

Eco-friendly, sustainable, waste free food storage .

Honeybee wrap the natural alternative.

WE WANT YOU TO BE PART OF THIS .

Your contributions will be used for:

*  Sourcing design and printing our own GOTS certified organic cotton range,

    Printing in bulk reduces the cost of manufacturing. Help us get the wraps out on a    global scale so every household can afford to have some. $30,000 minim print          run.

*  To upgrade our waxing equipment and tools $2,000

* Packaging  die cut boxes designed printed and cut for Shop counter displays              $4000

* Relocate to a commercial space to enable the production of the wraps on a global    scale $4,000

The impact of a reusable Beeswax wrap.

  • using a beeswax wrap instead of plastic wrap will have a huge impact on our earth. It is estimated Australians send 1 million tonnes of plastic waste to landfill each year. Do your part to make a change. 
  • Why use something for a few seconds that is going to spend the rest of your life trying to break down in landfill? We really need to change our habits.

  • Plastic waste can take more than 1,000 years to degrade and it is estimated that 10% of the plastic produced worldwide each year ends up in our oceans.
  • Schools worldwide are implementing programmes such as Nude your food and  Plastic free Tuesdays. 
  •  Educating children on the importance of this is a must for the future.


We want you to be part of the movement to eliminate plastic from our kitchens.

Why use toxic plastic wrap and create more landfill, when there is a safer natural way for the future?

Bee part of the reusable movement - reuse, recycle, rethink.

Honeybee wrap would like to offer all our supporters a special edition print to mark the day you were part of the movement to remove plastic from our kitchens.


Honeybee wrap vs plastic wrap!

Cling Film 

Out of all the kitchen wrapping products in your kitchen arsenal, none are used more than cling film. The catering industry alone uses thousands of tonnes of the product when transporting tasty treats across town, and to preserve food in the fridge or freezer. So surely, if this product is used in most kitchens, it can't be all that bad, can it? 

Plastics, poisons and pollution
The mining, transporting and distilling of crude oil for the manufacture of plastic products comes with a heavy environmental price tag, including soil, water and air pollution. Plastic wrap has mostly been made from polyvinylidene chloride (PVDC) or polyvinyl chloride (PVC) - both products of crude oil. These chemicals are dangerously poisonous during production, use and incineration. Many of these toxic liquids, solids and gases escape into the environment, causing severe disruptions to natural systems. 

Furthermore, both PVDC and PVC plastics are fairly rigid, so manufacturers generally add in softening chemicals called phthalates, which are known to cause hormonal disruption and developmental problems, and have been found to drift into food and the environment. These are just some of the health implications.

Disposal
Most plastic wraps are not recyclable, so they get sent to the landfill or incinerator, where toxins from the plastics can leach into soil and water, disrupting ecosystem health. When burnt, poisonous gases are released into the air. 


THE HONEYBEE WRAP - NATURE'S WAY IN OUR MODERN DAY! 

ORGANIC COTTON.

Many people consider cotton to be one of the purest fibres on earth. When in fact, traditional chemical cotton cultivation inflicts a heavy toll on the environment. The good news is, there are now some 50 countries commercially farming cotton organically including India, Turkey, The USA, Australia, Peru and China, amongst others.

Organic farming means using ancient cotton farming knowledge combined with modern technology to create a sustainable and healthy crop. Farmers replace chemical use with methods approved by organic certifying bodies, such as SKAL (Holland), BFA Australia, AGRECO (Germany) & IMO China. These certified methods minimise the impact on the soil and water supplies and preserve the Earth for future generations.

These methods include things like:

  • Eliminating the use of synthetic fertilizers and using animal manures instead.
  • Eliminating the use of chemical pesticides and herbicides from every step of the farming process and using cow urine as an insecticide which is harmless to the environment.
  • Hand weeding
  • Introducing good bugs to eat up the bad ones.
  • Organic cotton farming uses 50% less water than chemical farming.
  • Allowing the plant to defoliate naturally whilst the farmers have a holiday instead of using nasty chemical defoliants.
  • Letting the soil recover naturally after harvest.
BEESWAX  - A natural gift from the bees - natures best.
For thousands of years, beeswax has had a wide variety of applications. It has been found in the tombs of Egypt, in wrecked Viking ships, and in Roman ruins. Beeswax never goes bad and can be heated and reused. Beeswax also has  antibiotic and thermo-storing properties.
JOJOBA -  Liquid produced in the seed of the Simmondsia chinensis (jojoba  plant) a shrub which is native to southern Arizona, southern California, and northwestern Mexico. Jojoba oil has anti-fungal properties.
TREE RESIN - Natural safe and non toxic sap from the tree.
These three ingredients create the perfect blend to infuse the cotton, resulting in a flexible, malleable product that can be molded around your food.


Risks & Challenges

Since we began selling the Honeybee Wrap at the local markets, cafés and health food stores, the response has been amazing. Positive feedback from happy customers talking about us on social media and sharing  photos of their wraps in use, only goes to show they are really loving our concept. 

The Kitchen Starter Pack, a pack of 3 mixed sizes and the Kitchen Collection Pack, a set of 4 mixed sizes, and a range of single sizes are available.

Keeping up the demand in the initial stages of production will prove to be challenging, but with the right equipment and correct facility we will endeavour to do this as quickly as possible. We are expecting a rapid growth and worldwide demand for the Honeybee Wrap™

DELIVERY... It is estimated it will take up to three months to implement the designing and printing of our organically certified fabric. We will endeavour to deliver our Honeybee Wrap packs to our Indigogo supporters by the 1st of October 2015. 


A big thank you from my family and we hope you travel this journey with us!

It's our job to look after the planet for the future of our children and the next generations to come. If you can't contribute right now, there are a lot of other ways you can help us.

Tell your friends about us and what we are trying to achieve for this planet.

  • please share our post from Facebook or and Instragram.
  • Use the Indigogo share tools.
  • Spread the word and help create a change .
  • Bee part of the movement to remove plastic from our environment.
  • Let people know about our website: honeybeewrap.com
story_txt:
HONEYBEE WRAPS ™ Honeybee Wrap is here to stay. No more plastic wrap.
We have created an organic safe and reusable natural alternative to plastic wrap.
No chemicals, only local bees wax from the farm, certified organic cotton, jojoba oil, tree resin and love. 
Ideal for wrapping fruit and veggies, covering a bowl and wrapping lunches, this unique formula seals in the goodness, keeping your food fresh for longer. No more limp celery and shallots, just beautifully kept fresh crisp veggies and herbs. Can also  be used for storing bread and as a fermenter's friend it's perfect for covering Kombucha,  Kefir and fermented foods .
Use the warmth of your hands to mold and shape your wrap over food and dishes. The wrap will stick to itself when you press firmly over a bowl or plate. story: Hi I'm Rose. I'm a young female in my twenties and I'm currently fighting Cancer naturally. I'm a social psychology major, I love life and I love filling it with laughter. I'm just a girl that wants to grow old enough to finish my studies, get married one day, have kids, and well, just live a long healthy life. I've been fighting for almost 2yrs and surviving. I let cancer consume me and almost gave up, I hid my situation from the world, I recently came out to the world about my battles. You can check out my story on YouTube @ 'Journey de AbenaRose' where I tell all. It hasn't been easy. I chose not to do chemo due to the harsh affects of it and my already weakened immune system and kidneys. Chemo would only have hurt me moreso. I've surpassed the lifespan doctors gave me. They told me that I only had a few months to live, currently, I'm almost 2yrs in. Treating myself naturally has not been easy, I spend about $1000 a month only on organic food and non-gmo supplements that I take. That's not to mention the herbs I buy and the traveling to natural healers that i'd like to partake in but I can't afford. Unfortunately me and my loved ones are facing many complications financially to keep me going. My dad was in a bad car accident in Africa right after my diagnosis. This caused him to be hospitalized for 6months. Within that time frame my family and loved ones had to cover extensive costs for him to be kept in the hospital and properly taken care of. This cost the family almost $200 a day. His condition and mine were just a very heavy load. Gratefully he's doing better now, the only focus now is my health, which I know kills my family inside everyday. Gratefully my friends have been trying to gain funds for me, but do to economical hardships of many, it's hard to do so. So I decided to setup this page. I'm currently looking to get a surgery done to remove a baseball sized tumour out of my body, however, due to my refusal of chemo, oncologists will not refer me to a surgeon, I am looking into surgeons out of country, if I can afford it, I'll do it. Please check my diagnosis story on YouTube as well as my instagram if it'll better help you understand my situation. My instagram name is Abenarose. I'm honestly just at my wits end and a friend suggested this page to me, so I thought i'd try it. If you can help me financially in anyway, it'd be a great blessing! I was told that i'd need more than 15 grand by my herbalist due to everything I'm doing and need to do. However, I figure it's a start. Thank you for reading this and thank you for your help, any help at all.

story:
"What is the use of living, if it not be to strive for noble causes and to make this muddled world a better place for those who will live in it after we are gone?”
— Winston Churchill (speech in Dundee, 1908)

Migraine and Cluster Headache are two of the most painful and debilitating conditions known to medical science, yet there are no effective preventive medications specifically for these disorders that strike down so many on a daily basis. In fact, severe headache disorders account for $Billions in lost productivity worldwide. According to the Migraine Research Foundation (source: 2015, http://www.migraineresearchfoundation.org/frequ... )

"About 36 million Americans - roughly 10% of the total population - suffer from migraine. American employers lose more than $13 billion each year as a result of 113 million lost work days due to headache or migraine. Around 14 million people suffer from chronic daily headache, when attacks come nealy daily and treatment is extremely difficult and costly. Chronic headache sufferers are part of the legions of Americans with chronic pain who consume an enormous amount of healthcare services, with an estimated annual cost of $50 billion. And socially, in addition to the attack-related disability itself, many sufferers live in fear, knowing that at any time an attack could disrupt their ability to work or go to school, care for their families or enjoy social activities."

Please help us raise awareness by wearing our t-shirt, donating toward research and awareness efforts, or at least sharing our link. At a minimum, we ask that patients take the time to donate at least 21 days of your data while benefiting from our FREE app. Your personal data is completely private in accordance with international healthcare privacy laws. The data you donate will be used only as aggregated statistical information to help turn anecdotal data into real research information that can make a difference. At the same time, you get a great app for your phone, tablet, or computer to keep up with your condition, treatments, and current research activities, for free! This is truly Patient-driven Headache Research. As we continue to grow our information, researchers are able to identify correlations and trends that drive new questions and new research targets. In other words, Spiral Reseach, continuing spiraling toward better, more effective and affordable treatments, and ultimately, a CURE. This is a true win-win for both patients and researchers alike.

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down:

  • If you are a sufferer, use our Spiral Research Patient Portal app. You can enter to win a free FitBit Charge HR directly through our website at http://chsg.org  Note: It is essential that you initially launch the app from our website to be considered for the sweepstakes. No purchase or donation is necessary, but it does help! Find the site directly at http://spiralresearch.org or http://chsg.org You get 3 stars for entering your background data and give us at least 21 days of your headache symptom logging to win. We highly recommend logging how you feel multiple times a day, both good and bad. You will get a daily email reminder. No purchase or donation is necessary to win the FitBit Charge HR.
  • If you are not a sufferer or would prefer to simply donate to the cause, you can donate right here by clicking PERKS or DONATE or by donating directly at one of our websites: http://spiralresearch.org or http://chsg.org

Turn the daily conversation into both Personal Health History and Research Data, it's a true win-win proposition!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • SHARE the Links! on whatever your social network of choice may be
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.


CHSG, Inc. is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization ( http://1.usa.gov/1GHeWdz ) dedicated to improving the lives of Migraine and Cluster Headache sufferers through Research, Education, Fact-based Information, and Compassionate Support. All donations are tax deductible and 100% of funds go toward our objectives.

Find us!
Our website: http://chsg.org


Our 2015 Objectives:

  • Continued research on ketamine infusion therapy with Jefferson Headache Center and potentially 2 more centers, publish outcomes ongoing
  • New research initiatives regarding TRP Channels as new target areas; specifically leveraging biopharm and phase IIB clinical study TRP V1, A1, and M8 antagonists the specifically address hypersensitivity to known triggers for both migraine and cluster headache and related trigeminal autonomic cephalgias. These triggers include the perception of moderate temperature and atmospheric pressure changes, noxious chemicals, vallinoid-based scents, and bright light sensitivity. There are several candidates already in the pipeline showing positive results, however, not yet indicated for headache.
  • Actively identify and pursue new research targets through patient-driven information capture and presentation, coupled with business-case driven opportunity identification for researchers and bio-pharma.
  • Deliver a Spiral Research Portal focused on ongoing data collection and reporting while also providing helpful data logging and doctor's office patient visit summary reports that will ease consistency in data capture, reporting, and turning anecdotal evidence into an aggregate information database for research and reporting.
  • Continued Awareness and Advocacy efforts with special focus in partnering with Healthcare and the Biopharma/Pharmaceutical industry as well as major headache research and healthcare centers.
  • Patient and Healthcare educational and training materials
  • Triple our patient reach in 2015, further reducing the number who currently suffer alone and without current and complete information regarding options, both approved and not yet approved physical and mental health treatments, financial and career support programs, and compassionate support for those in need.
  • Establish a Patient Registry of cluster headache sufferers. This will greatly assist future research.

Our 2014 Objectives include (completed):

  • Continued research on ketamine infusion therapy with Jefferson Headache Center and potentially 2 more centers, publish outcomes ongoing
  • Establish Rare Disorder status for cluster headache in the NORD registry (https://www.rarediseases.org/rare-disease-information/rare-diseases/byID/720/viewAbstract)
  • Engage directly with the pharmaceutical industry to educate and identify opportunities
  • Continued awareness efforts with a focus on expanded public, healthcare, and patient information and tools
  • Continued rapid growth in reaching cluster headache sufferers to provide direct support, accurate and trustworthy information, and opportunities to contribute to others
  • Continue to provide patient medical supplies, specifically O2PTIMASKS and related materials at a reduced cost to patients
  • Extend reach to include educational magazine rack inserts for doctors offices

This is of course not all we do, but it's our focus.

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down:

  • If you are a sufferer, use our Spiral Research Patient Portal app. You can enter to win a free FitBit Charge HR directly through our website at http://chsg.org or using the app at http://spiralresearch.org Note: It is essential that you initially launch the app from our website to be considered for the sweepstakes. No purchase or donation is necessary, but it does help! Find the site directly at http://spiralresearch.org or http://chsg.org You 3 stars for entering your background data and give us at least 21 days of your headache symptom logging to win. We highly recommend logging how you feel multiple times a day, both good and bad. You will get a daily email reminder. No purchase or donation is necessary to win the FitBit Charge HR.
  • If you are not a sufferer or would prefer to simply donate to the cause, you can donate right here by clicking DONATE or by donating directly at on of our websites: http://spiralresearch.org or http://chsg.org

Turn the conversation into both Personal Health History and Research Data

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • SHARE the Links! on whatever your social network of choice may be
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

trigeminal autonomic cephalgias. These triggers include the perception 
of moderate temperature and atmospheric pressure changes, noxious 
chemicals, vallinoid-based scents, and bright light sensitivity. There 
are several candidates already in the pipeline showing positive results,
 however, not yet indicated for headache.
Actively identify and pursue new research targets through patient-driven information capture and presentation, coupled with business-case driven opportunity identification for researchers and bio-pharma.

Deliver a Spiral Research Portal focused on ongoing data collection 
and reporting while also providing helpful data logging and doctor's 
office patient visit summary reports that will ease consistency in data 
capture, reporting, and turning anecdotal evidence into an aggregate 
information database for research and reporting.
Continued Awareness and Advocacy efforts with special focus in 
partnering with Healthcare and the Biopharma/Pharmaceutical industry as 
well as major headache research and healthcare centers.
Patient and Healthcare educational and training materials
Triple our patient reach in 2015, further reducing the number who 
currently suffer alone and without current and complete information 
regarding options, both approved and not yet approved physical and 
mental health treatments, financial and career support programs, and 
compassionate support for those in need.
Establish a Patient Registry of cluster headache sufferers. This will greatly assist future research.


Our 2014 Objectives include (completed):

Continued research on ketamine infusion therapy with Jefferson 
Headache Center and potentially 2 more centers, publish outcomes ongoing
Establish Rare Disorder status for cluster headache in the NORD registry (https://www.rarediseases.org/rare-disease-information/rare-diseases/byID/720/viewAbstract)
Engage directly with the pharmaceutical industry to educate and identify opportunities
Continued awareness efforts with a focus on expanded public, healthcare, and patient information and tools
Continued rapid growth in reaching cluster headache sufferers to 
provide direct support, accurate and trustworthy information, and 
opportunities to contribute to others
Continue to provide patient medical supplies, specifically O2PTIMASKS and related materials at a reduced cost to patients
Extend reach to include educational magazine rack inserts for doctors offices

This is of course not all we do, but it's our focus.
   What We Need & What You Get Breaking it down:  If you are a sufferer, use our Spiral Research Patient Portal app. You can enter to win a free FitBit Charge HR directly through our website at http://chsg.org or using the app at http://spiralresearch.org Note: It is essential that you initially launch the app from our website to be considered for the sweepstakes. No purchase or donation is necessary, but it does help! Find the site directly at http://spiralresearch.org or http://chsg.org You 3 stars for entering your background data and give us at least 21 days of your headache symptom logging to win. We highly recommend logging how you feel multiple times a day, both good and bad. You will get a daily email reminder. No purchase or donation is necessary to win the FitBit Charge HR.  If you are not a sufferer or would prefer to simply donate to the cause, you can donate right here by clicking DONATE or by donating directly at on of our websites: http://spiralresearch.org or http://chsg.org


Turn the conversation into both Personal Health History and Research Data
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. SHARE the Links! on whatever your social network of choice may be
Use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
MyHomeGyneExamBed will save lives by making access to pelvic examinations widely available, enabling early detection and treatment of Cervical Cancer.

Early Diagnosis and treatment Stage 0 =93% survival rate

I am a nurse practitioner with 18 years experience.  I have been practicing in  house calls  programs whereby healthcare is brought into the individual or client's home since 2006  . Time and time again I have had to turn down my female patients' requests for a pelvic examination,either because they were having symptoms and needed to be checked or plain old " I have not have had a pelvic examination for years".  A few of my patients stated they have not had a pelvic examination in 30 years. These were generally female clients that are still in relationships or marriages.

Exposure to HPV -18 million adult females carry HPV -high risk forms can lead to precancerous cells and cancer in cervical tissue. 90% of cervical cancer are caused by HPV. This is why early detection and treatment is key to saving women's lives from cervical cancer.

"My home gyne exam bed" (CAPGED) (Patent Pending) was born out of this constant unfulfilled need that I observed among my female patients. I decided to invent a device that would enable female patients to have pelvic examinations, right in the comfort of their own home on a surface such as their own bed, without having to wait for weeks for an appointment to do so and to make the required periodic and episodic examinations more homely and comfortable for the female patient.

It is recommended per guidedlines that females by age 21 get a pelvic examination every 3 years or earlier if sexually active. During a pelvic exam ,a swab of the cervix is done to rule out cervical cancer or dysplasia in the cervix.  Many young and older women even when sexually active forgo this examination or ignore any symptoms they may be having in their reproductive organ system until it is too late. HPV which is rampant among most sexually active adults in the US goes undetected for years until  cervical cancer results. If more young sexually active females were compliant with regular pelvic examinations as per guidelines, early detecton and treatment of cervical cancer would save lives. My Home Gyne Exam Bed can make this a reality by making pelvic exams possible in the home and increasing females' access  to providers who can perform this exam at home.

This is where supporters such as yourself come in to make it possible for this device to become a reality and available to every female patient and provider.

Spread the word and #JOINUSINTHEMOVEMENT...

"YOU HAVE NO EXCUSE.GetItDone!" 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $100,000 initial funding to achieve the bringing of this device to market. The cost to produce one has been quoted to be $10,000

Project began in 2012 and patent filed April, 2013

  1. We are estimating that $50,000 will be needed to refine and produce the device that will allow leveraging Economics Of Scale to bring down the cost of production of each one.  The cost of identifying, locating and working with a manufacturer that would meet US regulatory standards is included.

  2. The device will be put through a field study with 2 NP consultant providers and 1 MD consultant provider over a period OF 5 WEEKS. The device will need to pass through regulatory compliance and examination.  We are estimating these two steps  will cost $50,000

  3. Estimated completion of the process is in December 15, 2015

This is where you come IN. PLEASE HELP US TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN.

By joining us in the movement; "YOU HAVE NO EXCUSE.GetItDone!"

We Are very appreciative and want to thank you with some perks.

"Myhomegyneexambed" cannot be a reality without your contributions.


$5000

50% off cost + Certificate listing you as a CHAIR of the movement plus collaborator on our future campaigns with cancer societies & other non-profits

Email us your choice of black, blue, green, pink

 Purchase of exam bed is optional

AUTOGRAPHED COLORFUL STORY BROCHURE OF THE PRODUCT FROM BIRTH TO MARKET+ Certificate listing you as a Member II of the Movement

#2000

certificate of “I MADE IT HAPPEN”

+ Certificate listing you as a Member Level I of the movement

#2000

$50

LISTED ON GALLERY OF SUPPORTERS ON PRODUCT WEBSITE

#3000

$25

You get a thank you postcard and an update on the product

#3000

$10

YOU GET A SHOUT ON TWITTER and FACEBOOK ABOUT YOUR SUPPORT

#3000

$5

Thank you for your contribution and supporting the movement to promote ease of access to PELVIC EXAMS FOR women

#5000


WITH YOUR SUPPORT WE HOPE TO ACHIEVE OUR GOAL TO MAKE THIS A REALITY. YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS EVEN IF LESS THAN THE GOAL WILL STILL BE PUT TOWARD THE FIRST STEP OF REFINING, MANUFACTURING AND ACHIEVING ECONOMICS OF SCALE TO MAKE THIS DEVICE WIDELY AVAILABLE TO WOMEN AND THEIR PROVIDERS AT A LOWER COST.


The Impact

Women are having to manage a professional life in addition to being the primary care giver in their households. Often times, getting regular pelvic exams falls in their priority even when they are experiencing symptoms or are overdue for recommended routine preventative  visits with their doctors. 

Myhomegyneexambed  will make it possible to  perform pelvic examinations in an adult female’s home which is comfortable and relaxing for her; More women are then likely to comply with preventative examinations , resulting in early detection & treatment of  precancerous and cancerous cervical cells.

Survival rates increase to 93% with early detection and treatment of cervical cancer and dysplasia. It can also allow the saving of women’s lives across the globe and in remote rural areas. 

Making pelvic examinations easily accessible in patients’ homes will also promote quicker treatment of STDs, reducing the long term effects when left untreated, including infertility.

Myhomegyneexambed can also lead the pathway in adding telemedicine to women’s healthcare , thereby augmenting women’s access to healthcare wherever they are in the US and the world.

Imagine how eventually a woman can perform her own exam and wirelessly send a picture of her cervix to be examined remotely. Not too far off eventually as our lives get busier.

Your Support and Contributions are highly needed to make this happen for women in the US and the world.

Risks & Challenges

Economics of scale is very important in making “Myhomegyneexambed” widely available. EOS reduces the cost of each one. The more we make, the cost of each one goes down. 

This is where your generous contributions can make this happen in not only further refining the design, but producing it in a large enough quantity in order to bring down the cost of each one.  It will have to pass through regulatory examination.

Since it is invented by a healthcare provider and two more consultant providers will be brought on with your contributions , it is expected that with available experience and expertise these hurdles will be successfully overcome. Your contributions will go a long way in making this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out to others on your facebook, twitter and google pages and ask them to join us in the movement: "YOU HAVE NO EXCUSE. GetItDone!"

Ask them to contribute to make it happen.

Remember to use your Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Project DOVE

We seek your support for Project DOVE 2015, an overseas medical mission trip that is organized annually by Duke-NUS medical students to improve lives beyond Singapore. This year, we will be heading to Cambodia, in partnership with One-2-One CAMBODIA, a Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO), to provide health screening, medical treatment and health education to the villagers.

Our team of about 20 medical students and 4 doctors, who have volunteered for this upcoming Project DOVE, will be setting up a mobile clinic in Kampong Spue, Cambodia, to provide health screening and medical care to the sick and underprivileged. We will be providing health screening and medical advice to 400-600 adults and children in the villages. During our five-day trip, from 26 Apr to 1 May 2015, we will be seeing common medical problems such as wound and skin infections, malnutrition, chronic diseases, infectious diseases and musculoskeletal pain from heavy labour that the local villagers are suffering from. Our team will also be visiting the local primary schools to educate about 500 students and 30 teachers on personal hygiene and basic first aid skills. We will also be carrying out deworming, as well as hair lice and scabies therapy for the villagers. In total, we will be serving more than 1000 villagers during our trip. 

Cambodia faces many common health problems in their local villages, such as malnutrition and infectious diseases, especially within the underprivileged and rural communities. As such, there is a need for more international aid to improve the health status of its population. By working with a local NGO with vast experience in providing medical and dental services to these communities, we are assured that our efforts and resources are sustainable.

We are appealing to you to help us fund Project DOVE by helping us raise $3,000, which will be used to provide health screening services, medical treatment, free medications as well as health education to more than 1000 villagers in Cambodia.

story:
Hi Everyone !

I would like to first thank you for taking the time out to read my page.   I am Rowe and I am a 26 year old professional nanny studying to become a Birth Worker

For as long as I can remember...

 I've always been a nurturer and had a strong interest in the birthing world as whole. As a child I remember sitting in front of the TV stuck on the Discovery channel watching birth stories and just wanting jump into the TV and hold the hand of the screaming woman. I've always heard stories of how painful and uncomfortable birth was,but in my heart I knew better..I felt it was better. I have no clue exactly where my passion for natural birth/ birthing period has come from I just know its strong and it grows stronger with the more I learn and the more I grow. It wasn't until my mid 20s did i realize there was something I could do to fulfill my passion of aiding and supporting soon to be moms in and on their journey to (re)birth. As a woman that has never given birth before I've always believed in the magic of it.,. of our bodies.

My mission as community birth worker.

  As a community birth worker I plan on aiding in decreasing infant and maternal mortality rates in the African American communities. I strive to help women experience pregnancy, birth and motherhood in an empowering ,healthy, and self-determining way. These services should always be afforded to all new mothers, but there is a growing need within communities that typically do not represent the “traditional family.”My plan is to provide services to all women but the heart of my services will be dedicated to low income families, queer families ,gender non-conforming,LGBT and families of color. Mothers of color are at risk of higher rates of unnessesary c-section, premature births and maternal and fetal death. I want to aide women in body confidence and help them to connect with their bodies and blooming seeds on a deeper level.” Birth is a naturally beautiful thing and I believe ALL women should have this experience, education and support.


With your generous help .

I can attend a full doula training at ICTC in Portland, Oregon in June.

http://ictcmidwives.org/full-circle-doula-training-description

A 29 hour, 3.5 day Full Circle Doula intensive training weekend at The International Center for Tradtional Childbearing (ICTC) -$800

Round-trip plane ticket to Portland, Oregon

Housing  during my stay in Portland 

Books for required reading .

Aromatherapy Course with Birth Art International

http://www.birtharts.net/

Business development

Business Cards

Midwifery Assistant Program at The Farm ($1,245)

http://midwiferyworkshops.org/midwifery_assistant.html

A 6 day training and housing accommodations at The Farm Midwifery Center in Summertown,Tennessee in November.
