Sample Excerpt

Chapter
1: Welcome to the World of Medical Marijuana (partial)
Note: Space on this page doesn't allow me to share this entire chapter, so I'm excerpting only part of it here.


When I first
became a medical marijuana patient, I was shocked at how effective it was at quelling
symptoms that I’ve suffered with for years. The results I experienced, from the
very first day I took it, were dramatic. I’d heard lots of great things about medical
marijuana over the years but I really didn’t expect it to be that beneficial. 

As medical
cannabis quickly became my lifeline to greater well-being, I realized that I had
been stuck in stereotypes fostered by decades of slanted and incorrect ideas
about this gift from Nature – and I started to see it as the miracle herb that
so many people have long proclaimed it to be.I was curious
about why it was so effective for me and disappointed that I hadn’t tried it
sooner – so I began to research this much maligned herb. The more I learned
about marijuana, the more complex – and fascinating and unique – it was. I
found myself navigating a confusing maze that was filled with unfamiliar
terminology, numerous types of cannabis products to choose from, and very
little specific direction on the best options for me. 
Marijuana has been
called a sacred herb, a super-herb, a Goddess herb, a master herb. Nature made
it unique among all of her offerings. As with other herbs and plants, it is
imbued with compounds that work together synergistically. However, it is
distinguished in the world of botanicals because no other plant seems to have
so many wide-ranging, health-promoting qualities. Hundreds of studies around
the world, many of them within the last two decades, confirm a huge number of
beneficial effects that marijuana has on the body and, in some cases, also the
mind. 
Among
the many things I learned is that most of the medicinal strains of cannabis are
very different from the strains that recreational users prefer. And that makes
sense. The recreational user’s goal is generally to achieve the psychoactive
“high” or “stoned feeling” that most people associate with it, while – for many
medicinal cannabis patients – the “high” is an unwanted side effect. 

My Experience Becoming a Medical Marijuana Patient
As a resident of
California with verified medical needs, I could have qualified as a medical
marijuana patient when it first became legal in the state in 1996. But, like
many others, I didn’t pursue it because the federal government continued to
wage a war on this amazing herb. Over those years, many Californians learned
the hard way that their state law didn’t protect them from seizure and
prosecution by the federal government. Many growers, dispensary owners, patients,
and parents of patients who are minors ended up in prison, with a criminal
record for the rest of their lives. News reports of those incidents scared many
potential patients – like me – away from even trying this herb. As of this
writing, news stories of these “crackdowns,” including seizures and arrests,
still occur throughout the world, although not nearly as often. Thankfully, the
situation is improving and cannabis is now available to many patients who have
not had access to it in the past.
As I continued to
study cannabis as a medicine, I was shocked to learn so much that I didn’t know
– but felt I should have known. I
have written on holistic health and complementary modalities off and on for
several decades and I thought I actually knew quite a bit about these topics,
including the subject of herbal medicine. My personal health choices have
always veered away from pharmaceutical drugs as much as possible, preferring
the most natural and holistic treatments to the potential negative side effects
that are part and parcel of most pharmaceuticals. At one point in time, I
didn’t even have a pain reliever like aspirin in my house because I didn’t want
to take pharmaceutical drugs unless I felt it was needed as a last resort. Then
I came to understand that – just as the side effects of a drug are a stress on
the body – so is pain. Over time, as my health condition became much more challenging,
I took over-the-counter pain medications to help me sleep at night and always
got up during the night to take more when the drugs wore off. I alternated from
one type to another to minimize the potential for negative side effects and my
doctor frequently did blood tests since some of these drugs can cause serious
liver problems. I had become much less judgmental about pharmaceuticals, but
continued to be cautious, always preferring the natural route when possible. 
One day, in
desperation to feel better, I finally decided to ask my beloved doctor if she
felt medical marijuana might help me. Over a year earlier, she had prescribed a
pharmaceutical drug to help me sleep at night and I acquiesced because the
constant pain and exhaustion were unrelenting. Eventually, over time, she added
two more drugs to my nightly regimen, all with the goal of a good night’s
sleep. Combined, the sleeping pill, painkiller, and muscle relaxant led to
better sleep than I had experienced in a long, long time. I knew that she was
focused on resolving the problems that caused my need for these drugs – always
seeing them as a short-term solution while she also treated me for sleep apnea
and with trigger point injections for muscle spasms. Nevertheless, my doctor
and I were both concerned about the addictive qualities of these pharmaceutical
drugs.
At the time of
this appointment with my doctor, which was about a year after she had first
prescribed the three drugs, I had been taking all of them much longer than she
had planned. But every attempt I made to go off even one of them would make
sleep more elusive. In addition, over time, my body had become tolerant to them
so they had stopped giving me the results I so desperately needed. Most nights
I woke up after about three hours and needed to take more pills. Then I would
be awake for an hour or two in the middle of the night while I waited for the
new round of drugs to kick in so I could get a bit more sleep before morning.
Knowing that I had
been on these drugs much longer than my doctor wanted, I gently treaded onto
the topic of medical marijuana with her. I greatly respect her for many reasons,
including her integrative approach of combining Western medicine with
alternative modalities and treatments. But I did not have any idea how she’d
answer this question and was surprised at her immediate and positive response,
almost as if it was she who brought up the subject of medical marijuana instead
of me.  
My doctor smiled
and told me she liked the idea and thought it might help. She then told me that
she had a patient who was having excellent results with cannabis. She asked if
I knew it was available in capsules? No, I didn’t. But that was intriguing and
I really liked the idea because smoking a joint didn’t appeal to me. Taking a
capsule, now that’s easy! My doctor then gave me a referral to another doctor
from whom I got the official state medical marijuana recommendation, opening
the door to this whole new world and, most importantly, opening the door to
less pain and better sleep the very first night I tried it. 
I was thrilled
that I was able to replace three pharmaceutical drugs with one little capsule
of cannabis extract. And that one little capsule worked better than the drugs. The more I studied cannabis, the more I
realized that in order to really understand it, I would have to set aside all
of the old negative stereotypes that I had heard all of my life. I searched
books and numerous websites and queried people who might be in the “know” for
the specific information that would help me understand how it works and why it
appears to be so much more efficacious in healing than hundreds of other
botanicals that are used around the planet. As I share some rather
extraordinary facts about this healing herb, I suggest that you rethink it too.
Even if you know a lot about marijuana, so much is changing that there’s a good
chance that you’ll find many new-to-you facts on these pages.
I learned that the
naturally-produced chemical compounds in cannabis bring balance and harmony to
all of the body’s systems. (I’ll discuss these chemicals in greater depth in
Chapter 7.) However, there’s no guarantee that two people with the same
diagnosis and the same symptoms will find the same cannabis product to be
equally efficacious. Each strain has a different chemical profile based on its
own unique genetics and the conditions in which it was grown – a different ratio
or proportion of the hundreds of the chemicals that are naturally produced by
the plant. The two most prominent chemicals are THC, the chemical that causes
the psychoactive “trip” or “high,” and CBD, which is considered to have many additional
healing benefits. Another variable that impacts the efficacy from individual to
individual is the fact that each body’s chemistry is different. Two people who
have the same diagnosis and the same symptoms may find that the same strain of
cannabis medicine is efficacious for both of them – or they may find greater
benefit from two very different strains. 
About 18 months
into my medical cannabis adventure, I learned firsthand how different strains
can deliver quite different healing benefits. Up until that time, I was very
grateful for the benefits that I had received from a product that is high in
THC, the chemical that causes the psychoactive “trip” or “high” that many
associate with cannabis. Because this product helped to quell the pain
associated with muscle spasms, it also improved my sleep. And I fully expected
that, over time, I would experience more symptom relief and a greater level of
healing overall. 
While many
pharmaceutical drugs focus only on
symptom relief, a medicinal herb sometimes goes beyond symptom relief as it heals
the body on a deeper level. This deep-healing potential can take time – but
most of us are willing to be patient as we welcome the trajectory of feeling
better and better over time. However, sometimes herbs surprise us by delivering
fast results. And, from my perspective, there’s another factor behind all
healing. Beyond the realm of medicines and treatments, as a spiritual counselor
I want to point out that, from a mind-body-spirit perspective, healing doesn’t
have to take time. Like me, you have probably heard stories of healings that
have no explanation other than miraculous. I simply ask you to consider the
possibility that if one person can tap into a miraculous healing, you can too.
When I heard media
reports of the amazing healing benefits that some patients experienced with newly available strains that are extremely
low in THC and high in CBD, I wanted to try one of them. I was primarily
interested because extremely-high CBD products do not cause psychoactivity like
THC does. The lack of psychoactivity can be helpful for any patient who finds
that the high or stoned feeling from THC makes it difficult to fully function
during the day. But for me there was another factor as well. My legs are a bit
wobbly due to the condition I’ve been diagnosed with – and THC makes them more
wobbly. So, up until that time, symptom relief during the day had eluded me –
and, with rare exceptions, I took cannabis at bedtime only. 
Most people find
that their body builds a tolerance to the psychoactive effects of THC when they
continually take it over a period of time – so they don’t get as high as in the
past. However, I’m one of the rare individuals who has achieved very little
tolerance to the THC in cannabis. Even after a couple of years, more than a
tiny amount of THC makes me too wobbly to feel safe using it in the daytime. 
I
didn’t really expect anything miraculous from this new cannabis product; I just
wanted a product that would help quell symptoms during the day. What happened
was a big surprise. The day after I started taking the high-CBD, extremely
low-THC product, I didn’t cough. In addition to other symptoms, a chronic
debilitating cough had plagued me for 25 years – but that day I woke up and didn’t cough at all. A number of doctors
had attempted to treat this cough over the years; however, without any success.
Eventually, I found a nutritional supplement that lessened the frequency of the
cough by about fifty percent; however, it was still a daily problem. 
Since
the two different products – made from different strains of cannabis, and manufactured
by different companies – helped me in different ways, I started taking both on
a daily basis. At that point, I had already written the first draft of this
book and had done a ton of research. I had also seen dramatic reports on
television documentaries of very sick children getting absolutely no relief
from medical cannabis – until they
were given a very specific strain that proved to be almost miraculous from the
very first dose onward. I knew – at least I knew intellectually – that each strain has different healing benefit.
The new high-CBD
capsule product didn’t help with muscle spasms and pain – so using it as my
only cannabis medicine wasn’t an option. But the fast and dramatic improvement
in the cough astounded me. Clearly, the particular chemical profile of that
cannabis product gave me a different set of benefits from the high-THC product.
That experience really opened my eyes and helped me understand how important it
is to experiment with different forms and types of cannabis even if you think
you are already being helped as much as possible. Remember, different strains
have different benefits. That’s why it is helpful to consult with doctors and
other experts who are knowledgeable about cannabis, try new strains and new
products, and experiment with dosage in order to get the most healing benefit
possible. 
Much more
recently, I have been able to obtain capsules that contain raw cannabis oil
that does not cause any psychoactivity for me, so I can take them any time of
the day or night without feeling groggy, wobbly, or at all high. This raw
cannabis oil is the best product yet for me for symptom relief. It is
considered “raw” because it is manufactured through a cold processing method –
which means that it is non-psychoactive, except in rare cases. That’s because
almost all of the THC that it would normally contain is present in a different
chemical form called tetrahydrocannabinolic acid
or THCa, a biosynthetic precursor to
THC. Note that the “a” at the end of
THCa stands for “acid.” When cannabis is exposed to heat, a process called
decarboxylation converts the THCa to THC. But, as long as it is raw, it
contains THCa, which has its own set of healing and symptom relief benefits,
different from those of THC, giving any raw cannabis product additional
advantages. Raw cannabis also contains a precursor form of CBD called CBDa,
which provides different benefits from those of CBD. (Please note that most raw
cannabis products DO contain small amounts
of THC and CBD, but they are often so small that they may not be quantifiable.)
Some months ago I
asked a greatly respected medical marijuana expert what he recommended for the
condition I have been diagnosed with. He suggested a 2:1 ratio of CBD to THC –
and my hunt ensued. While there are many medical cannabis products on the
market, at the time I wasn’t able to locate any that were a 2:1 CBD to THC. In that
situation, the only option is to try products that come closest. At the time, the
closest I found was a 3:1 product – but it didn’t provide symptom relief. In the world of medical marijuana, a lack of
success doesn’t necessarily mean the recommendation is wrong; it may mean that
you need to give the product more time and/or tweak your protocol. Or it’s
possible that it’s not the best product for you and it’s best to look for a
different one.
As you’ll learn in
more detail in later chapters, two different products that contain the exact same ratio of CBD and THC may give you very
different results. That’s because, in addition to the CBD and THC, there are
many other factors involved in any one product’s efficacy, including its
potency, the dosage taken, and the hundreds of other chemicals in the plant which
are present in smaller amounts – and in different ratios in each strain. 
I was delighted
when I obtained the raw cannabis oil capsules that I mentioned above, which is
a 3:1 CBDa to THCa product. This product gives me the most symptom relief
during the daytime of any products I have yet tried. Even though it’s not in
the 2:1 CBD to THC ratio that was recommended to me, it is the closest I have obtained
so far in a product that actually helps me.
I appreciate the benefits that I am getting from this raw oil product – no psychoactivity
and CBDa and THCa, which bring their
own unique benefits. Like many patients, I have also learned to “tweak” my
protocol by combining products. For example, a small amount of a high-THC
product along with the 3:1 CBDa to THCa product is closer to the recommended
2:1 CBD to THC ratio than either product on its own. That combination seems to
provide a bit more symptom relief and, I find that when I take a small amount
of THC along with high-CBD product, the
psychoactivity is lessened. 
I continue to take
a high-THC product at nighttime since, otherwise, muscle spasms and pain tend
to keep me awake most of the night.
  
Your Brain Produces Its Own Marijuana
I’ve written about
holistic health for over three decades and thought I knew a few things on the
subject. However, I was in for a surprise when I learned one of the main
reasons that scientists believe that cannabis is so healing: In the 1990s, researchers discovered that
there are natural chemical compounds in cannabis that match receptors in the
cells of our own bodies – referred to as “Your Brain’s Own Marijuana” in the
title of a Scientific American article. Many believe that it is this link
between the chemicals in the plant and those in the cells of our own bodies
that makes cannabis so unique, so good at quelling symptoms and, in some cases,
also bringing healing to health problems in the body and mind. In fact, the
cells in the body that are a match for the cannabinoids
in the cannabis plant were named endocannabinoids. ...A
healthy immune system supports the body’s individual cells as they repair themselves or replace themselves when
they are damaged. Receptors, which are structures located on the surface
of a cell or inside a cell – such as enzymes, neurotransmitters, or viruses –
are a vital part of this “repair or replace” process. They act like receivers
and give instructions to the cells to take a specific action, such as dividing,
dying and replacing themselves, or allowing a specific substance into the cell
or out of the cell. All of these actions occur constantly in the body as a
process of normal cell functions.
Different strains
of cannabis target different receptors in the body. Receptor sites on the
surface of cells can lock onto certain molecules when they come along,
basically working like locks and keys. Just like the front door of your home, a
receptor can only be unlocked by a key that fits into that specific type of
lock. In this “lock and key” system, a key that “matches” a lock then carries a
signal through the cell’s wall. Let’s look at the example of a receptor on the
surface of a cell that can act as a messenger for the sensation of pain. There
is a unique place on the surface of the cell where this receptor can dock. When
the pain receptor docks on the cell, it’s like a key that fits into the lock
and it then activates the pain signal. However, if the receptor is blocked, the
pain signal does not get through. Without the receptor, there’s no key to unlock
the door, so the sensation of pain does not occur because the “door” remains
locked. Many pharmaceutical drugs work by blocking specific receptors. For
example, when a person takes a pain-relieving drug, the drug stops the pain
receptor from activating and the person no longer feels the pain. ... 
Until recently,
cannabis was the only plant in which receptors that match our internal
endocannabinoids had been found, making this herb incredibly unique and special.
However, it didn’t make sense to me that there would be only one plant on this
vast planet that was a match for our human endocannabinoid receptors. So I
wasn’t surprised to find new research that indicates that chemicals from plants
other than cannabis also directly
interact with CB1 and/or CB2 receptors or have a chemical profile that is
similar to the cannabinoids in cannabis. While research on this subject is in
its infancy, the herb Echinacea has been found to be a match for some CB1 and
CB2 receptors, with other plants also being investigated for their roles in
promoting wellness via the human endocannabinoid system.  Meanwhile, some new
products combine cannabis and other healing botanicals such as Echinacea to
increase the effects and curative properties of both herbs. 
In Chapter 4 we
will look at the connection between these receptors in the cells and the
healing properties of cannabis that make it so powerful in healing bodily
conditions.

The Role of Cannabis in Promoting Homeostasis
There’s a lot
going on in your body simultaneously; it is set up for balance and harmony,
with a goal of promoting maximum wellness. The body’s constant effort to
maintain equilibrium among all of its internal processes and systems is called homeostasis, which the Merriam Webster Dictionary defines as “the
maintenance of relatively stable internal physiological conditions (as body
temperature or the pH of blood) in higher animals under fluctuating
environmental conditions.” Early on in my research I learned that
cannabis has some pretty awesome healing properties that promote this important
function in the body.
As the body pursues
optimal harmony and balance through homeostasis, it is constantly in the
process of compensating. When one process or system is out of balance, another
process or system compensates for the system that is not fully functioning. One
example is the body’s ability to regulate temperature. As the body gets too hot
or too cold, it will compensate to deal with the change in temperature. That’s
why you sweat on a hot day; it’s the body’s way of cooling down. 
The “repair and
replace” mechanism within all of the cells in your body is also part of
homeostasis. In fact, in the second that it took you to read this sentence,
thousands of your cells have been automatically repaired or replaced with new
cells. The body’s intelligence is mind-blowing and its ability to prioritize is
what homeostasis is all about.
Imbalances in any
of your body’s systems throw it off balance and out of whack and require
compensating systems to restore balance. For most of us, these compensating
mechanisms kick in automatically and keep us healthy, especially when we are
young. If we get a cold or flu, our immune system goes to work and we are soon
well again. If there is a toxin in the air, the body compensates, handles it,
and we don’t even know about it because the body is programmed for wellness. It
automatically compensates over and over to insure survival with the very best
outcome. That is, unless it is overwhelmed and unable to handle the challenges
that come its way, including infections, parasites, and environmental toxins.
And, in addition to the tangible challenges that we deal with in the physical
world, emotional traumas and negative thinking can also impact the body
chemistry in negative ways and impact our health.
So how does
homeostasis fit into the scheme of things when the subject is cannabis? Well,
anything that helps the body deal with its imbalances will help it get back
into homeostasis. While the ratios of the chemical compounds in cannabis vary
from strain to strain, scientists have discovered a wide range of positive
effects from these healing chemicals, including effects that are anti-proliferative, anti-inflammatory, anti-epileptic,
anti-ischemic, anti-diabetic, anti-psychotic, anti-nausea, anti-spasmodic,
antibiotic, anti-anxiety, anti-depressant, and anti-neoplastic (inhibiting
development of malignant cells).
Even knowing all
of this, it took a while for me to understand why cannabis is so significant
and powerful – and why its healing properties are utilized by our bodies to
such an amazing extent. Cannabis truly has a special and unique place in the
world of botanicals. I frequently refer to it as a sacred healing herb because
of the reverence I have for this gift from Nature. I will share lots more in
these chapters about why and you will
understand the reasons many doctors and other health professionals are now
recommending cannabis to patients.  
Most medicinal
herbs give us results over a period of time; their action is usually not very
fast and we might not feel the beneficial effects for days, weeks, or even
months. That is why it is important to give medicinal herbs time to do their
work and not give up on them too soon. It is okay that it takes time because we
understand that medicinal herbs heal on a causal basis. One of my mentors
recently used the term “softer” to describe the healing we receive from herbs
and many other holistic modalities. I liked that terminology because I believe
herbs heal on a deeper level than pharmaceuticals – and that does feel softer
to me. When we take a medicinal herb that benefits our body, it does so by
getting to the root of problems and restoring balance. 
Cannabis is
considered to be a superhero in the world of medicinal herbs because of the
positive side benefits that many patients experience. While it can take time
for a major health issue to be resolved, most patients feel some of the
beneficial effects of cannabis almost immediately, especially if they are
astute in noticing their body’s responses. For example, you might immediately
notice deeper, more relaxed breathing, and more relaxation in the muscles and
skeletal system, which can result in better sleep, fewer bathroom visits during
the night, improved lung function, and/or greater endurance and stamina.
Cannabis can also quickly boost a patient’s mental attitude and it is known for
giving quick relief to those suffering from nausea or lack of appetite. 

Contradictory and Confusing Perspectives from the
Powers That Be 
Like so many
others before me, once I had the official paper in my hand in which my state
government sanctioned my right to use an ancient healing herb – without too
much concern at that point in time of being arrested – I entered the maze. I
was a stranger in a strange land. I had many questions: Where do I get the
marijuana; what form of marijuana should I take (including smoking, vaporizing,
capsules, edibles, suppositories, creams, salves, and other forms); what strain
or type should I chose; what potency is right for me; and how often should I
take it? Unless we have a knowledgeable physician or other ally, these are
among the questions that we must all answer for ourselves. In most cases, we
are expected to figure out a lot of details in this new and somewhat strange
world and decide what is right for us as individuals. In fact, as of this
writing, doctors in some jurisdictions are not allowed to tell you anything
about it.
One has to be
discerning and at least somewhat knowledgeable in order to sift through the
mounds of dated, inaccurate, and biased information about cannabis that is
presented as truth in books and on the Internet. One of the reasons for this
glut of outdated, incorrect, and obviously skewed data was presented by Dr.
Gupta on his CNN special, Weed. He
reported that there have been over 20,000 studies on cannabis in the last
couple of decades; however almost all of them – 94 percent – were focused on
studying the deleterious effects and harm caused by marijuana, while only six
percent of the studies were focused on the benefits.  
The
biggest shock in the U.S. “war” against cannabis is that one branch of the
government says cannabis has no medicinal
value while, at the same time, a different branch of the U.S. federal
government patented the cannabinoid CBD for
its medicinal value. Clearly, there is a huge amount of evidence that
cannabis has great medicinal value for an untold number of illnesses and
conditions. But, as of this writing, the government still controls cannabis
research in the U.S. and has allowed an extremely limited amount to be done,
with most of it focused on disproving
the medicinal value of marijuana. As a result, most doctors still refuse to
recommend it due to the lack of “clinical trials.” It’s a Catch-22. The federal
government does not allow clinical trials and, at the same time, argues that
only clinical trials can establish proof of a medicinal value. As a result, to
date, very few medical cannabis patients have a professional healthcare
provider alongside them on their medical marijuana journey.
Anyone who knows
how scientific studies are set up understands that it can be challenging to set
up a totally unbiased study. If you want to study “deleterious effects and harm
from marijuana,” that is what you are looking for – and it is likely that you
will set up your research to focus on that. On the other hand, if you want to
study “benefits from marijuana,” you will set up a study to give you data that
proves the benefits of the herb. Unfortunately, for most of the last century,
the U.S. government rarely looked for anything good about marijuana. The
majority of the studies were done by the National Institute of Drug Abuse, a
branch of the government that was focused almost exclusively on funding studies
that would continue to demonize cannabis as a dangerous drug. Interestingly,
some of the very top medical doctors who now promote cannabis as an important
medicine were originally involved in research to debunk its medical benefits
and were converted to when their studies proved its great merits. Within these
chapters you will read about a couple of them. 
Most of us have
been brainwashed about the evils of “weed” all of our lives. Governments
branded it as dangerous and made it illegal. In the U.S., the Justice
Department put it on Schedule I of the Controlled
Substances Act, which means it has no
medicinal value and it is one of the most dangerous drugs available. The
irony is that while some government agencies continue to view cannabis as a
dangerous, illegal drug, other government agencies are well aware of its
medicinal value. While people were still being thrown into prison for
distributing or using marijuana for medicinal purposes, the government
continued to run its own medical marijuana program out of the University of
Mississippi. That program, which began in 1976, provides free cannabis each
month to the patients who are enrolled in it. All these years later, patients
who were originally part of this program are still receiving free cannabis from the United States government. 
In
addition to the government’s own contradictory marijuana giveaway program, the
craziness continued when the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
obtained a patent on cannabinoids for their antioxidant and neuroprotective
properties. Does this make sense – one government agency tells us that cannabis
is a dangerous and illegal Schedule I drug, with no medicinal value, while another
government agency not only acknowledges its medicinal value but also obtains a
patent for it? Now how is that possible, you might ask? Isn’t it impossible to
patent a plant? Apparently the U.S. federal government can do the impossible.
The abstract of
U.S. Patent 6630507, entitled “Cannabinoids as Antioxidants and
Neuroprotectants,” tells us exactly what the U.S. Department
of Health and Human Services believes to be true about cannabis and its
chemical compounds, cannabinoids. It says, in part:  
"Cannabinoids
have been found to have antioxidant properties…. This new found property makes
cannabinoids useful in the treatment and prophylaxis of a wide variety of
oxidation associated diseases, such as ischemic, age-related, inflammatory and
autoimmune diseases. The cannabinoids are found to have particular application
as neuroprotectants, for example in limiting neurological damage following ischemic
insults, such as stroke and trauma, or in the treatment of neurodegenerative
diseases, such as Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease and HIV dementia." 
I am also
fascinated by the section in the patent entitled “Detailed Description of Some
Specific Embodiments,” which discusses more of what this “invention” – in this
case, “compounds” found in the herb cannabis – provide to the body:  
"This
invention provides antioxidant compounds and compositions, such as
pharmaceutical compositions, that include cannabinoids that act as free radical
scavengers for use in prophylaxis and treatment of disease. The invention also
includes methods for using the antioxidants in prevention and treatment of
pathological conditions such as ischemia (tissue hypoxia), and in subjects who
have been exposed to oxidant inducing agents such as cancer chemotherapy,
toxins, radiation, or other sources of oxidative stress. The compositions and
methods described herein are also used for preventing oxidative damage in
transplanted organs, for inhibiting reoxygenation injury following reperfusion
of ischemic tissues (for example in heart disease), and for any other condition
that is mediated by oxidative or free radical mechanisms of injury. In
particular embodiments of the invention, the compounds and compositions are
used in the treatment of ischemic cardiovascular and neurovascular conditions,
and neurodegenerative diseases. However the present invention can also be used
as an antioxidant treatment in non-neurological diseases."
In addition to
this patent, a number of other patents have been granted by the U.S. government
for the medicinal value of cannabis, including:

U.S. Patent 20130059018: PhytoCannabinoids in the treatment of cancer
U.S. Patent 5,538,993:
Compounds according to the
present invention are characterized by various beneficial properties such as
analgesic, anti-emetic, sedative, anti-inflammatory, anti-glaucoma, and
neuroprotective activities
U.S. Patent 6,448,288: Use of
Cannabinoid compounds for inhibiting, inducing
U.S. Patent 4,876,276: Special use in cases of acute and of chronic pain
U.S. Patent 7,179,800: Useful for therapy, especially in the treatment of pain, inflammation
and autoimmune disease 



Clearly the U.S.
government knows that cannabis is actually a safe, effective, and inexpensive
medicine; not a dangerous drug with no medicinal value, as the Drug Enforcement
Administration has classified it for so long. 

A New Look at Old Stereotypes
Now let’s look at
a couple of the stereotypes about cannabis. The stereotype that cannabis causes
the “munchies” and leads to overeating may be true for some people when they
take some cannabis products. But –
again – it depends on the strain and the individual. Some people who are
overweight lose weight with no effort on medical cannabis – while those who are
underweight are often successful in gaining weight. 
I have been
overweight for most of my life. Even though I had dropped quite a bit of weight
a few years earlier using a nutritional supplement and doing emotional healing
work, at the point in time that I started taking cannabis, I was still
overweight and had been stuck on a plateau for a couple of years. For the first
six months or so that I took cannabis, I didn’t gain or lose weight. But then,
after I started taking a high-potency cannabis
oil product, which is now manufactured under the name Natur-Oil, I started
losing weight with no effort at all at the rate of one to three pounds a month
until I had lost about 30 pounds. I know that cannabis can help to balance the
blood sugar and I assume that is one of the many ways it has helped in my body.
Instead of getting the “munchies” and overeating, cannabis curbed my appetite
and my desire for sweets and carbs. I didn’t diet, eliminate or limit any
foods, or exercise more. I ate whatever I wanted and enjoyed every bite of
everything I chose to eat, including sweets and carbs, finding that my body
only wanted small amounts of them. That made weight loss easy. I was still
rather shocked on those occasions when I didn’t even want a small serving of a
yummy-looking dessert that was offered to me – but the fact that I didn’t WANT
it and passed on it for that reason felt really good. I have continued on this
trajectory – and I now feel that I’m “eating to live,” rather than “living to
eat.”  
Another stereotype
that’s prevalent among the public is that anyone who uses medical cannabis is a
slacker who “just wants to get stoned.” I’m okay with people getting stoned if
that is their choice, as long as they are responsible about it, but that is not
my desire. My experience is that getting high is NOT the preference of most
medical marijuana patients. Our goal is not to get high; our goal is to heal.
Thankfully, as I mentioned above, for those of us for whom the high is
undesirable, newer strains and forms of non-psychoactive cannabis are now
available. 

[As I mentioned earlier, Indiegogo doesn't provide enough space on this page to include all of Chapter 1.  I hope you have found the sections I have included informative.]

story:
Our Mission

We believe that education is not only a fundamental right but also a key element in building and maintaining healthy, self-sufficient communities. Our aim is to empower young people through education by supporting schools across Australia.

Our funds will help schools run programs that provide their students with better tools, supplies and facilities, affording them access to the same learning opportunities as their peers, thereby helping them gain valuable knowledge and skills that will improve their lives.

Our business model gives the gift that keeps on giving! 

Our Story

We want to take an everyday product that is routinely bought and consumed in large quantities, and leverage it to meet an important social need by channelling 100% of the profits back to schools in the Australian communities.

Bottled water is a $100 billion global business and it is expected to grow. In Australia is worth approximately $400 million per year.

We will bottle water with the brand name SCH2OOL, a combination of SCHOOL and H2O. All the profits will go to benefit schools around Australia.

SCH2OOL is a not-for-profit brand of bottled water that gives back to the community by helping schools raise money to fund education related projects. SCH2OOL is an exciting new concept that harnesses kids' natural enthusiasm and channels it to buy extra equipment for schools, nourishing Australia's future and helping to grow strong communities that thrive.

There is always more demand for equipment in Australian schools than educational budgets can meet. Yet Australians annually spend millions of dollars on essential items such as water, and that money is then lost to the community.

SCH2OOL brings together a need and an opportunity, turning the purchase of bottled water into a mechanism through which anyone can help raise money easily to directly benefit local schools.

SCH2OOL water is special, because it does more than simply nourish healthy children; by supporting their education it contributes to strong families and strong communities.

How It works

SCH2OOL branded bottles are sold through local outlets in the same way as normal bottled water. But each bottle of SCH2OOL l has a unique code, which allows the buyer to log in to the SCH2OOL website and nominate a school to receive the profit generated by its sale and the profits are awarded to each school in real time.

The more bottles nominated to a particular school, the more money it receives.

Every School Can Participate

All a school has to do is register on the SCH2OOL website, and decide what sort of equipment it wants to buy. iPads, a smart board, new sports equipment…each school can use its money to buy whatever its pupils need. The equipment selected is included in the school's public profile on the website, providing a clear target for that school's children to aim for.

By fostering a collective spirit of pulling together to reach the reward, SCH2OOL also teaches children the important life lessons of cooperating to attain a common goal, and of setting targets and working towards them.

Marketing Strategy

To be marketed successfully SCH2OOL needs to generate demand from the public and to build a network of outlets to satisfy that demand. ScH2Ool meets these two challenges using the enthusiasm of kids and positive endorsement from the community to generate a self-propelling momentum that requires little additional expenditure.

SCH2OOL gains brand awareness by harnessing kids' boundless energy to spread the word in their local communities, turning them into enthusiastic brand advocates.

SCH2OOL is therefore an attractive brand for retailers to stock, because local kids who want their school to take part ask for it by name. Any retailer who fails to offer SCH2OOL risks losing business to those who do.

This effect is reinforced by the SCH2OOL website showing visitors which retailers stock SCH2OOL water in their local area. The website also actively encourages consumers to support these local retailers.

By being associated with positive themes of encouraging education and supporting schools and communities, SCH2OOL gains endorsement from schools and community leaders, further helping its spread.

Add in that the money from SCH2OOL sales is helping local schools, and supporting SCH2OOL quickly becomes synonymous with supporting the local community. If retailers refuse to take part they not only lose business but also local credibility.

SCH2OOL recycling bins located at schools serve a dual purpose of raising brand awareness and reinforcing the socially responsible nature of the brand.

Local press also publicise the brand when schools announce the purchase of equipment or completion of projects funded by SCH2OOL, and competitions, fundraisers and social media initiatives provide a further stimulus.

Appealing to young peoples' competitive instincts, the SCH2OOL website allows viewers to compare the progress local schools are making towards their respective targets, encouraging friendly rivalry and acting as spur to recruit further local buyers and retailers. 

Benefits of the  SCH2OOL Program

SCH2OOL provides a host of important benefits to children, parents, schools, retailers and the wider community.

Benefits for Students

SCH2OOL teaches important life lessons and develops skills that will be of use  to students in the working world, such as creativity, the ability to work in teams, selling skills, and the experience of setting targets and working to achieve them. It also underlines the important life lesson that if you want something, you have to work to get it.  

SCH2OOL also develops responsible social values, underlining the fact that young people are part of the community and have a responsibility to contribute to it, including supporting charity work. At the same time it teaches young people that helping the community can be rewarding emotionally, and can generate positive approval that helps develop their self-esteem.

Benefits for Parents

SCH2OOL benefits parents by giving them a chance to take a more active role in their children's lives. Parents can discuss their children's plans and goals, offer help and suggestions, and engage with them through updates and status reports.

SCH2OOL also offers indirect benefits to parents in the form of better facilities and equipment at school, leading to better opportunities for their children and better results.

Benefits for Schools

SCH2OOL raises funds that schools can use to buy much needed equipment or facilities that will improve their pupils' education. Schools are free to choose what they buy, letting them set their own priorities and focus on their most pressing needs.

Schools also benefit from the sense of team spirit that the program fosters, improving students' emotional commitment to the school and giving them a greater feeling of involvement.

A further and significant benefit to schools is the improved performance that comes from better-equipped students.

Benefits for Retailers

Retailers who register as  SCH2OOL vendors see improved customer loyalty, especially from students, who are keen to buy only from shops that take part in the program and therefore enable them to progress towards their school's target.

Retailers also get free publicity by featuring on the SCH2OOL site, and gain credibility and approval by being seen as supporting the local community. 

Benefits for the Community

Education is a vital resource that nourishes the community and strengthens its fabric. The community therefore benefits by having better equipped schools producing better-educated students, with stronger life skills and more robust communal values.

Your Impact

100% of the $15,000 will enable us to bottle the first batch of water that would be used to: 

  • Promote our concept and publicise our cause. 
  • Developing more sustainable financial support and community partnership programs allowing us to continue to increase the number of schools served.
  • Expanding to every state and recruiting every school to help every student.

Risks & Challenges

All of H2O 2 EDU financial and in-kind resources come from generous people moved by our mission and cause. Our challenge is to secure the initial required investment to pay for the initial production of the water bottles. Regardless, we are committed to this project and with the generous help and support, we are confident that we will be successful with our mission.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may have difficulty contributing financially. This doesn't mean you can't contribute in some other way. You can help by sharing this campaign with everyone you know.
story_txt:
Our Mission
We believe that education is not only a fundamental right but also a key element in building and maintaining healthy, self-sufficient communities. Our aim is to empower young people through education by supporting schools across Australia.
Our funds will help schools run programs that provide their students with better tools, supplies and facilities, affording them access to the same learning opportunities as their peers, thereby helping them gain valuable knowledge and skills that will improve their lives.
Our business model gives the gift that keeps on giving! 
Our Story 


We want to
take an everyday product that is routinely bought and consumed in large
quantities, and leverage it to meet an important social need by
channelling 100% of the profits back to schools in the Australian communities.
Bottled
water is a $100 billion global business and it is expected to grow. In
Australia is worth approximately $400 million per year.
We will
bottle water with the brand name SCH2OOL, a combination of SCHOOL
and H2O. All the profits will go to benefit schools around
Australia.

helping schools raise money to fund education related projects. SCH2OOL
is an exciting new concept that harnesses kids' natural enthusiasm and channels
it to buy extra equipment for schools, nourishing Australia's future and
helping to grow strong communities that thrive.
There is
always more demand for equipment in Australian schools than educational budgets
can meet. Yet Australians annually spend millions of dollars on essential items
such as water, and that money is then lost to the community.
SCH2OOL brings together a need and an
opportunity, turning the purchase of bottled water into a mechanism through
which anyone can help raise money easily to directly benefit local schools.

water is special, because it does more than simply nourish healthy children; by

communities.How It worksSCH2OOL branded bottles are sold

unique code, which allows the buyer to log in to the SCH2OOL website and nominate a

advocates.

to offer SCH2OOL risks losing business to
those who do. 
This effect is reinforced by the SCH2OOL website showing visitors which retailers stock SCH2OOL water in their local area. The website also actively encourages consumers
to support these local retailers.

its spread.

retailers refuse to take part they not only lose business but also local

further stimulus.

story:
A FITNESS PRODUCT FOR EVERYONE!

A FORCE OF NATURE:

The Body Crank is a completely new twist on the world’s oldest piece of fitness equipment called the “jump rope.”  The jump rope has virtually gone unchanged since its discovery in 1600 A.D. Egypt.  That is until now…!  The rope is replaced by a curved rotating arm which creates a natural resistance called centripetal force.

The science behind centripetal force is simply high speed spinning.  In order to get the Body Crank “Cranking,” you must generate the force from your entire body, legs, and core while stabilizing the upper body which creates the strength needed to turn the curved arm.  The amazing thing about the Body Crank is that it weighs just under 6.5 Lbs.  It generates a force of well over 35 plus pounds without the use of added weights.

The Core Crank was originally designed for obese and overweight people. Its simplicity makes it the perfect workout to any fitness level. The Crank is  challenging, effective and easily adaptable. With its unique asymmetrical loading feature any athlete can improve their fluidity, increase their strength and enhance his or her balance, while sharpening coordination skills. It is an apparatus that integrates foundational movements that will lead to impeccable performance and durability.

Great workout tool for: Golfers, Quarterbacks & Receivers, Pitchers, Boxers and so many other sports

THE PROBLEM:

 

The fitness market is saturated with workout products that are designed for people who are around 10 to 20 lbs overweight, but I was 200+ plus pounds.  Where do I start?  What could I use? …the perfect push-up or the latest Ab Roller, hell if I got on the floor my workout was getting back up!!

Today's fitness products are designed for a semi-fit market. The Core Crank can be used at any level of fitness: obese, overweight, semi-fit and athletic. 

THE SOLUTION:

The Core Crank became the answer, co-invented by Erik Thompson, a personal trainer and Army veteran of the 82nd Airborne; he understood the problem! It had to be low impact, yet challenging enough to work for an individual of 300 lbs or 120 lbs

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Lets Break it down:

  • $60000 is the goal folks! To cover tooling & material cost as well as logistics and distribution.
  • The "PERKS" first come, first served.  The Core Crank retails for $89.99 but on Indiegogo get one of (300 units) for $40.00 / 2nd (500) @ $50.00 a unit / 3rd (500) @ $60.00 a unit / 4th (500) @ $70.00 a unit / 5th $80.00 a units until they are sold out.  Contributions of $30, $20 & $10 get matching coupon (30%, 20% & 10% off) for their Core Cranks after the campaign has ended, they can purchase their Core Crank at our website (coupons are good for 3 months)  All $5 donations go to the Leukemia Research Foundation.
  • We're running a fixed campaign, if unable to reach our goal funding by contributors will be return by the end of the campaign, except for $5 donation.   

The Impact

With every venture there is risk but we have taken the necessary steps to limit these risks so that we may bring you a truly unique fitness product.   

  • Manufacturing has been secured along with distribution and fulfillment.
  • The Core Crank has been tested and used on numerous clients with much success.  My 20 years as a personal trainer has given me great insight into developing a product that is truly needed and proven. 
  • The Core Crank was created to save a friend's life, so with every contribution 5% will be donated to the Leukemia Research Foundation.  

Risks & Challenges

My team has done a great job! A small but uniquely experienced group of thinkers, makers and marketing guys.  Ready to take on any risk and challenges

  • Lead Inventor Guy, Erik Thompson: Army veteran, 82nd Airborne infantry. Personal trainer for over 20 years and and inventor since birth. 
  • Marketing Guy, Danard Bailey: Self made marketing guru and tech guy
  • 3D Rendering & Graphics Guy, Gregg Darby: Associate Professor of product design at The Center of Creative Studies in Detroit, Michigan.
  • Business Know-How Guy, Craig Askin: Owner of Lanegainer and developer of the Bullet Belt, has been designing and selling fitness products nationwide. 
Steps have been taken to minimize any unforeseen risk, All contributors will be updated on any issue or problems during this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

We have sign on with the Leukemia Research Foundation (LRF) to raise funding for a disease that needs to be cured.  A contribution of just $5 helps to find that cure.

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Get the word out about our Core Crank campaign as well as the LRF. 

God bless and thank you for your support.

story:
My name is Peta Morton and I am a Reiki healer and teacher. My intention is to help bridge the gap between science and spirituality and bring energy medicine into the mainstream. 

For the past few years I have been captivated by the idea that we might somehow be able to visualise Reiki energy, which is usually unseen and silent. I'm sure that some of you will have heard of the new science of cymatics, the study of sound and vibration made visible.  This is my chosen method of studying, and hopefully scientifically validating, Reiki energy.

                 

By analysing the sounds and vibrations of online Reiki sessions with the help and support of acoustic physics pioneer, John Stuart Reid, and the team at Cymascope, we have been able to obtain cymatic images and videos of Reiki in action.

In the following short video you will see me sending Reiki to a client via Skype during which the Reiki energies manifest as sound and were then made visible with a CymaScope instrument. In the clip the surface of the CymaScope’s sensitive water membrane is imprinted with a sound frequency, rendering the sound visible.   In the same way, the sound from a Reiki session is inputted to a CymaScope, creating complex geometric patterns that are filmed for study.

  

It is worth bearing in mind that between a significant proportion of the molecules in the human body are water, so studying Reiki by a method that involves water could lead to important insights into the relationship between life, water and Reiki energy.

Gaining a better understanding of Reiki could radically transform many of our approaches to modern medicine. By studying the mechanics of these energies we may also gain a better understanding of the links between our conscious thought, our emotions and our physical health.  

By making sound visible the hidden geometry within is revealed, providing a powerful visual platform from which to study the sound. It has been said that a picture speaks a thousand words and this is never truer than when applied to cymatics. Sound’s almost magical ability to create form from formlessness is an important key in understanding how Reiki energy heals.

The sounds occur during online Reiki sessions conducted via wi-fi on Skype.

"The sounds start as soon as I start sharing Reiki, and stop when I consciously end the energy transmission, making it obvious that my consciousness is involved in the process of generating the sounds. I have recorded many hours of online sessions with people all around the world and have discovered that the sounds and rhythms are as varied as the people I have worked with."

- Peta Morton

Here are some audio extracts from the online Reiki sessions:

Skype Reiki Audio 1   Skype Reiki Audio 2   Skype Reiki Audio 3   Skype Reiki Audio 4

Skype Reiki Audio 5   Skype Reiki Audio 6  Skype Reiki Audio 7   Skype Reiki Audio 8

To explore this further and to bring this research to the attention of the wider scientific community I need to raise £17,586 so that I can acquire the necessary equipment, fund an intensive research program and promote this work worldwide.

      


These are just a few of the questions that I have:

  • What changes occur in the geometry of Reiki sounds under different conditions?

    -  During sessions in which clients have experienced a healing or transformation

    -  During an energy transmission such as Reiju/attunement

  • Are there common themes associated with certain medical conditions?

  • What happens when the focus is placed upon specific parts of the physical body?

  • What happens when the focus is placed upon different parts of the ‘vital energy body’ (e.g. meridians, acupuncture points, the chakra system)?

  • Do different emotions influence the geometry?

  • How consistent are the results when different people operate the equipment?

  • How does focused intention affect the geometry of Reiki sounds?

  • What happens to the geometry of Reiki sounds during sessions in which

    -  there is visible light or colour

    -  there is little or no audible sound, or very high frequency sound?

  • Do cosmic events such as solar flares, a full moon or geomagnetic storms influence the results?

  • Why do the sounds occur on Skype and not on other platforms?

  • Is there a way to reliably record the Reiki sounds without using Skype?

  • Are there common frequencies and rhythms during these sessions?

  • What happens to the geometry of Reiki sounds when a group of people exchange Reiki?

  • What is happening to the brainwaves and heart activity of the sender and recipient during these sessions?

These are just some of the questions I am planning to investigate with this equipment.

I need your help, please. Are you ready to help revolutionise the way energy medicine and consciousness are viewed and bring their study into the mainstream?




What people are saying about this project:


"As a physicist, I find it very interesting that Peta can consistently and reproducibly produce interference in the sounds of a Skype session using only Reiki. So far, there is no conventional explanation for this effect and, given the popularity of 'energy healing' in the alternative community, in my opinion this deserves further investigation. Peta is taking a questioning and well-reasoned approach to her work and I look forward to the results of her study with interest." 

- Dr Shelly Moram

Equipment to be purchased:

  • A medium frequency CymaScope (costing £5238)
  • A high frequency CymaScope (costing £3274)
  • Two EmWave®2 devices & chargers developed by the HeartMath® Institute (£287)
  • A Lindell audio amplifier (costing £1047)
  • A Drawmer 1973 compressor-limiter (costing £980)
  • A Klark Teknik DN360 graphic equalizer (costing £850)
  • An Allen & Heath ZED60/10 FX audio mixer (costing £262)
  • A 2 MHz function generator by MCM Electronics (costing £141)
  • An Adorama RS-CS920 copy stand (costing £179)
  • A Sci Cool W201AB laboratory refrigerator (costing £471)
  • A BioHit MLine single channel mechanical pipettor 1000-10000uL (costing £240)
  • A BioHit MLine single channel mechanical pipettor 100-10000UL (costing £240)
  • A Canon EOS 7D digital camera (costing £769)
  • A Canon 100mm macro lens (costing £373)
  • Two iMac 2.computers with 2.9 GHz processor (costing £2398)

dedicated full-time to this work.* Plus Indiegogo platform fees of 5% 

If I am unsuccessful in raising sufficient funds to purchase at least the starter model CymaScope and accompanying equipment then all monies raised will be used to purchase laboratory and image-processing time at the CymaScope laboratory.

Learn more about the healing art of Reiki

Learn more about the fascinating science of cymatics

Thank you for your support. Please spread the word and share widely.



*Please note that the equipment selected and prices may vary slightly dependent upon availability; promotions and exchange rate applicable at time of purchase. Price based upon xe.com conversion on 24 September 2015.

energy body’ (e.g. meridians, acupuncture points, the chakra system)?



Do different emotions influence the geometry?



How consistent are the results when different people operate the
equipment?



How does focused intention affect the geometry of Reiki sounds?



What happens to the geometry of Reiki sounds during sessions in which
-  there is visible
light or colour
-  there is little or
no audible sound, or very high frequency sound?



Do cosmic events such as solar flares, a full moon or geomagnetic storms
influence the results?



Why do the sounds occur on Skype and not on other platforms?



Is there a way to reliably record the Reiki sounds without using Skype?



Are there common frequencies and rhythms during these sessions?



What happens to the geometry of Reiki sounds when a group of people
exchange Reiki?



What is happening to the brainwaves
and heart activity of the sender and recipient during these sessions?


These are just some of the questions I am planning to investigate with
this equipment.

I need your help, please. Are you
ready to help revolutionise the way energy medicine and consciousness are
viewed and bring their study into the mainstream?






What people are saying about this project:



"As
a physicist, I find it very interesting that Peta can consistently and
reproducibly produce interference in the sounds of a Skype session using only
Reiki. So far, there is no conventional explanation for this effect and, given
the popularity of 'energy healing' in the alternative community, in my opinion
this deserves further investigation. Peta is taking a questioning and
well-reasoned approach to her work and I look forward to the results of her
study with interest." 



- Dr Shelly Moram
Equipment to be purchased:

A medium
frequency CymaScope (costing £5238)


A high frequency
CymaScope (costing £3274)


Two EmWave®2
devices & chargers developed by the HeartMath® Institute (£287)


A Lindell audio amplifier
(costing £1047)


A Drawmer 1973
compressor-limiter (costing £980)


A Klark Teknik
DN360 graphic equalizer (costing £850)


An Allen &
Heath ZED60/10 FX audio mixer (costing £262)


A 2 MHz function
generator by MCM Electronics (costing £141)


An Adorama
RS-CS920 copy stand (costing £179)


A Sci Cool
W201AB laboratory refrigerator (costing £471)


A BioHit MLine
single channel mechanical pipettor 1000-10000uL (costing £240)


A BioHit MLine single channel mechanical
pipettor 100-10000UL (costing £240)


A Canon EOS 7D
digital camera (costing £769)


A Canon 100mm
macro lens (costing £373)


Two iMac
2.computers with 2.9 GHz processor (costing £2398)

dedicated full-time to this work.* Plus Indiegogo platform fees of 5% If I am unsuccessful in raising sufficient funds to purchase at least the
starter model CymaScope and accompanying equipment then all monies raised will
be used to purchase laboratory and image-processing time at the CymaScope
laboratory.Learn more about the healing art of ReikiLearn more about the fascinating science of cymaticsThank you for your support. Please spread the word and share widely.
*Please note that the equipment selected and prices may vary slightly
dependent upon availability; promotions and exchange rate applicable at time of
purchase. Price based upon xe.com conversion on 24 September 2015.

story:
Wanted: Funding for one of Hawaii’s first Medical Marijuana (MMJ) licenses.

The State of Hawaii finally agrees that Medical Marijuana (MMJ) helps people fight diseases. My name is Keith Hansen; and I am both hearing impaired and have Retinitis Pigmentosa /Ushers Syndrome. This means that I am going blind. Still, I know I can make life easier for others with health challenges if I can get one of Hawaii’s 8 medical marijuana (MMJ) licenses.

I am asking you to help me launch my dream. To be considered for a license, I need to raise a non-refundable application fee of $5,000, dispensary license fee of $75,000 and an escrow account of $1,200,000. This money would be used to establish a dispensary and a greenhouse-based commercial production facility for indoor cannabis cultivation. To keep the startup capital investments low, I would operate out of a leased retail business location.

MMJ has already proven to be an effective alternative treatment for many diseases and their side effects. I want to make it accessible to patients who may greatly benefit from this alternative treatment over traditional methods of prescribed medicine or chemotherapy. I also plan to have staff that can educate folks and separate fact from fiction, as far as how MMJ helps.

Here’s another reason you’ll want to support me and why my project will be different: I’ll use some of the profits to set up a research fund for Retinitis Pigmentosa. While I personally may not benefit from research or advancement in the treatment of this condition, I would feel that I am making a difference in attacking this life changing disease.

I know I’m the little guy up against big competition to get one of these licenses, but I have big plans to make a meaningful difference.  I hope I can count on your help.
