story:
Bespoke Insoles

Made Just for You!

Imprints are customised, 3D-printed insoles designed and made just for you. They use a flexible rubber-like material that cushions using a honeycomb structure. They’re made using measurements of your foot shape and loading, captured from your Smartphone. Software algorithms optimise the insole design, identifying your main loading regions and calculating the stiffness needed in each. The shape of your foot is used to make them fit correctly. You can customise the insoles further, with a choice of colours and patterns. Once you’re happy with the design the insoles are then made at our factory in the UK and shipped straight to your door.   

100% Personalised design 

 

Each insole is completely designed to your individual specification. You’ll receive a scanning kit that allows you to quickly capture the important areas under your feet where they make contact with the ground. These are used to identify the load zones on your feet, as well as giving information about your foot shape. Once you tell the app your weight it calculates the exact stiffness needed in each zone to provide the correct amount of cushioning for your feet. The software then digitally designs your insole, varying the honeycomb density to provide the correct cushioning and contouring the top surface to fit your foot shape. You can then choose from a number of extra options, such as the colour of the insole body, to tailor them further.

Soft and Flexible Cushioning 

Imprints insoles are made using a rubbery material known as TPU. This is flexible and perfectly suited for soft insoles that can absorb and redistribute load. Unlike rigid insoles used for foot correction these insoles are designed for comfort, optimised through our design process to cushion your feet. The foot arch provides support while also remaining pliable and unobtrusive. Once the main insole body has been 3D printed a top cover is added to provide a smooth surface. This is made from other materials commonly used in insole manufacture such as EVA

Effective Pressure Reduction 

 

The insoles are based on patent-pending technology that uses algorithms to calculate the stiffness required to provide just the right amount of cushioning for your feet. Your weight is distributed across your foot when you move, so different stiffnesses are required in the heel and forefoot where the loading is spread across differently sized contact patches. Testing with in-shoe pressure sensors has shown this is effective at reducing pressure when walking, almost twice as effective as semi-customised insoles made from foam materials (17% vs 9%).

Breathable and Lightweight 

Air can circulate freely around your shoes because the insoles are made from an open lattice, rather than closed foam cells. Vents on the top surface of the insole help the airflow reach your feet for maximum comfort. Each insole is made from a thin lattice of rubber material and weighs around 50 - 75 grammes depending on their size. The standard depth is 6mm (5mm chassis plus 1mm top cover), although you can choose to have them slimmer if needed.

 

As Easy as 1-2-3!

Ordering your insoles is easy. We’ll send you a scanning pack and access to our smartphone app. You then scan your feet using your phone, select any customisation options and…..that’s it! 

Your choices are sent digitally to our cloud software which designs your insole exactly to your specification. This creates a print-ready file which is sent to our factory where we 3D print your insole, add a top cover, run some quality checks and ship it straight to your door.

The Imprints Story

Back in 2015 the UK’s National Health Service (NHS) started looking at new ways to prevent the development of foot ulcers in people with diabetes. This is a debilitating and life-threatening condition which affects around 25% of people with diabetes at some point during their lifetime. It results in over 9,000 lower-limb amputations in the UK and 73,000 in the USA, and these numbers continue to rise. It’s a largely preventable condition if the correct treatment is given, such as pressure reducing insoles. Yet custom insoles that can lower foot pressure points require individually designing which means they take a long time to make. They’re bulky and usually require specialist footwear which makes them difficult to wear. They use multiple layers of foam which compresses with use which need replacing frequently, and they’re also very expensive. 

The magnitude of this problem let the NHS to run a competition, via its SBRI Healthcare programme, inviting companies to come up with new ways to tackle this awful condition that affects so many people.

This inspired us to see whether new 3D scanning and 3D printing technology might lead to a solution. We teamed up with experts in manufacturing and biomechanics and developed a concept using a new flexible material to create a personalised yet low-cost insole. Our competition application was successful and we set out to turn this promising idea into a product. 

Over the next 3 years insoles, 3D scanners and 3D printers were designed, algorithms developed, concepts tested and patents filed. The resulting insole was slim enough to fit into everyday footwear yet, when optimised to each individual's foot shape and load profile, reduced high pressure areas on the foot associated with ulcer formation. Clinical testing showed this was twice as effective as with the semi-bespoke insoles provided by podiatrists. By digitising and automating the design process we also found we could make them quickly with minimal manpower, lowering the manufacturing cost by an order of magnitude. Also, unlike insoles machined from solid blocks of foam, 3D printing generates very little waste material.

These medical grade insoles are now being piloted in the NHS to measure how effective they are at reducing foot ulcers.

With the launch of this Indiegogo campaign we’re now making this pressure-reducing insole technology available to everybody who values comfort. If you, or someone you know, get uncomfortable feet, particularly after a long day, then Imprints are the perfect solution. 

Please note that if you are suffering from a medical condition that could affect your feet  you should seek medical advice from a suitably qualified clinician. The product offered through this campaign is designed purely to improve foot comfort and is not intended to address any medical issues.

How we’ll use the funds

We’re running this campaign to help us scale up our production facility so that we can expand and improve our service offering. Our goal is to be able to provide insoles within 48 hours, so we need to ensure we have sufficient capacity in the factory to offer this. With your support we will extend the factory by installing additional printers, as well as improving our process automation software. We have sufficient existing capacity to fulfil the early-bird orders and have staggered the deliver of further batches to fit with the factory scale-up.

For our healthcare customers, such as the NHS, we provide a 3D scanner to capture detailed information about the underside of the foot. As part of this Indiegogo development we will create a new software app that will capture this information remotely, using our scanning pack. This software is relatively straightforward as its only purpose is to capture images of the impressions from the scanning pack, provide customisation options (colour etc.) and shipping information and to transmit this information to us securely. 

Meet the Team

Imprints Insoles have been developed by Cadscan Ltd, based in Chester, UK, that has been creating new 3D scanning, printing and visualisation technologies for the last 8 years. Its main focus has been the healthcare sector, with a focus on orthoses, medical imaging for wound management and several VR/AR applications. We have a 12-strong team which includes software developers, product designers and manufacturing. We also work closely with a number of academic institutions, in particular the biomechanics team at Staffordshire University, to provide specific expertise.

 

Credits: Icons made by Freepik, smalllikeart, Smashicons and kiranshastry from www.flaticon.com

story:
The ladies behind AEM:

 

Our legging:

AEM will take you out on a Sunday stroll, let you hang out on the couch on a rainy Saturday and make you work-out like never before. It can be used for sports activities, but also becomes part of your daily wardrobe, due to it’s comfortable fitting and it’s cool designs.

 

The Prints:

Our first prints are hand designed prints full of colour, which we are really proud of. Take a look at some of our options below.

 

Sustainability:

We work with a manufacturer in Portugal who takes social and environmental standards seriously. Our product is made of a high-quality, sustainable fabric, which is a GOTS certified textile made of recycled fishing nets and other waste that is found in the ocean. We aim to be as transparent as we can about our production process and materials, to create awareness among women about what they are wearing. 

We turn waste into sexy and make it funky and fashionable!

 

 

Some facts about the fabric:

  • RECYCLED PET requires 86% less water than regular polyester
  • RECYCLED PET consumes 70% less energy than regular polyester
  • The CO2 emissions of RECYCLED PET are 75% lower
  • 1 pair of our yoga pants can keep 32 water bottles out of the environment
  • Using RECYCLED PET helps us to not only keep plastic out of the landfills and oceans, but also to save our natural resources.

 

Our Team:

We started by creating a team and finding advisors to help us on our journey.

Where are we at right now:

We finished our first legging sample and are very happy with the fitting. It's ready to be out there in the world and to be worn. We are currently making matching sportsbra's made from the same recycled textile. 

In april 2019 we enrolled in a social responsible accelerator program in Amsterdam (BMC Impact Hub) to focus on our business model, marketing plan and financial planning.

What do we need the money for?

We need your pledge to get our production started to deliver you an amazing pair of sports leggings and start our world domination in sustainable sportswear!

 

The Pledges:

For this Indie gogo project we will sell our leggings for 75 euros instead of 90 euros to give our early adaptors a nice discount.

When we finish our crowdfunding project we will contact you to decide colour, print and size. You can choose from 3 prints, each available in 2 different colours. Regarding the sizes: We will have 2 sizes: S/M (34,36,38) and M/L (38,40,42). 

We expect our first batch to be ready in November 2019. Our website and webshop to be ready in November 2019. 

Risks and challenges:

We depend on the supplier for our fabric from Italy and the manufacturer from Portugal. The risk can be that these are not aligned and we don’t meet the deadline for our first delivery.

It can be used for sports activities, but also becomes part of your daily wardrobe, due to it’s comfortable fitting and it’s cool designs. The Prints:Our first prints are hand designed prints full of colour, which we are really proud of. Take a look at some of our options below. Sustainability:We work with a manufacturer in Portugal who takes social and environmental standards seriously. Our product is made of a high-quality, sustainable fabric, which is a GOTS certified textile made of recycled fishing nets and other waste that is found in the ocean. We aim to be as transparent as we can about our production process and materials, to create awareness among women about what they are wearing. We turn waste into sexy and make it funky and fashionable!  Some facts about the fabric:
RECYCLED PET requires 86% less water than regular polyester
RECYCLED PET consumes 70% less energy than regular polyester
The CO2 emissions of RECYCLED PET are 75% lower
1 pair of our yoga pants can keep 32 water bottles out of the environment
Using RECYCLED PET helps us to not only keep plastic out of the landfills and oceans, but also to save our natural resources.
 Our Team: We started by creating a team and finding advisors to help us on our journey.Where are we at right now:We finished our first legging sample and are very happy with the fitting. It's ready to be out there in the world and to be worn. We are currently making matching sportsbra's made from the same recycled textile. In april 2019 we enrolled in a social responsible accelerator program in Amsterdam (BMC Impact Hub) to focus on our business model, marketing plan and financial planning.What do we need the money for?We need your pledge to get our production started to deliver you an amazing pair of sports leggings and start our world domination in sustainable sportswear! The Pledges:For this Indie gogo project we will sell our leggings for 75 euros instead of 90 euros to give our early adaptors a nice discount.When we finish our crowdfunding project we will contact you to decide colour, print and size. You can choose from 3 prints, each available in 2 different colours. Regarding the sizes: We will have 2 sizes: S/M (34,36,38) and M/L (38,40,42). We expect our first batch to be ready in November 2019. Our website and webshop to be ready in November 2019. Risks and challenges:We depend on the supplier for our fabric from Italy and the manufacturer from Portugal. The risk can be that these are not aligned and we don’t meet the deadline for our first delivery.

story:
Here’s my story

 

Hello,  Judy Cutler-Teeven  here!  I’m the creator of TheraPouf -  a versatile support pillow for those who suffer from back, neck and joint pain.  It’s an American-made product designed to help people in need in more ways than one. My passion is designing exciting products and helping others, and TheraPouf will allow me to do both! But I need help to raise funds to cover production and advertising costs.  I feel so strongly about using my talents to give back and improve the lives of others, and I want you to join me on this journey.  Donate $150 or more and be one of the first to receive a TheraPouf for FREE! Not only will you experience the benefits of a TheraPouf, 10% of your contribution will go directly to local Southwest Florida non-profits I am partnering with.  Check out my short video to learn more and thank you so much for contributing what you can to help!

So, exactly what is TheraPouf? 

Three years ago, everything came to a crashing halt for me when I began to have severe back issues. I couldn’t walk and spent every day managing pain. I underwent three back surgeries and bought every product I could find to support my back, but nothing worked. Leveraging my background in product development, I knew I could come up with something better. That’s when I designed TheraPouf, and it gave me such relief!  I don’t go anywhere without it. At one point I realized there are over 25 million people in America alone that suffer from back pain, and maybe TheraPouf could help them too. So, I created TheraPouf, a patented, trademarked product that provides excellent back support and aids in achieving a neutral spine position. It can also be used for neck and joint pain relief!

How does it work? 

While seated - watching TV, at the office, driving, etc. – align TheraPouf vertically along the spine. The counter pressure that is created in movement shifts support to where it is needed. As TheraPouf contours to the back, you will achieve a neutral spine position, which allows for comfort and pain relief.  Each TheraPouf comes with a gel pack that can be placed in an exterior pocket and used to apply hot or cold therapy.  You simply put the gel pack in the freezer or warm it in the microwave before inserting.  Check out TheraPouf.com for all the ways to TheraPouf.

 

 

What Your Money Goes To 

I’ve used many of my resources to bring TheraPouf to market and need more seed money for production and advertising. I’ll use the funds I raise to get the word out and provide TheraPouf to those who need it. By helping me you can help back pain sufferers who need TheraPouf! 

My Ultimate Dream - The Greater Good 

My dream is to use  my 30+ years of experience in product development to help others. I want to establish an organization called Products of Purpose to do just that. Products of Purpose, a light manufacturing facility based in Fort Myers, FL will provide job training and employ people with special needs to manufacture trendy, eco-friendly products. Check out my blog to learn more about Products of Purpose: http://createbeyondthelines.com/2018/08/creating-products-of-purpose/

story:
Short Summary

My Co-Founder and I are Nigerian tech-enthusiasts working in and around Software Development. We are unashamedly part of the “smartphone generation”, born into an era of fast-moving technological innovation, a fact we are very cognizant of. We are a team of project managers and software engineers who have dealt with deadlines, exams and hectic work periods. Our Present App is a culmination of our understanding of the problems we have to face, and the solution we think will solve them.

In simple terms we want our product to be the final “Productivity Hack”. We hope to build an application that utilizes techniques based on ancient meditation and modern psychotherapy to increase user attentiveness and productivity. Through regular usage, Present users should be able to tackle tasks more efficiently.

What We Need & What You Get

As with all great ideas, ours requires funding to truly kick into life. We aim to raise $25,000 in our first round of fundraising. This amount would facilitate the design and development of our Present App, as well as our marketing campaign. Donations would help bring this dream of ours to life. Donors will receive access to our very first Present App free of charge, with perks lined up across their usage of the app. They get to test out our App, explore its uses and have fun doing so.

The Impact

We are passionate about productivity, and helping people reach their potential through considered productive work which is at the core of Present’s mission. Donors are getting a chance to follow us on a very ambitious journey to attempt to tackle distractions in a world that is constantly churning them out.

We are excited to take on this challenge, carrying along a family of users who will give us honest feedback, and inevitably help us grow. Our hope is that we hear stories of Present users acing final exams, getting that job they studied for, or just being more centered and productive individuals. Present is more than just bells and whistles; we are hoping to deliver, through the use of our app, visible changes in personality and processes.

Risks & Challenges

Staying power is for us the biggest risk factor. Will we have enough time with our users to help them shape their behavioral patterns? Can our software truly help people zone into specific tasks? These are questions that we have poured months of research into, peeling into the thinking of prospective users.

As with most things, these interviews and polls are not a substitute for actual usage of a real application. We intend to meticulously tailor the application building process to our user feedback, guiding the user flow as close to what our research has been able to gather, knowing that designs should take on as much input from user research as is possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are excited about our idea and would love more people to jump on the hype train. Tell a friend or two or twenty! We want to hear what you think about our idea and how we can make it better! Be Present, because now is fleeting.

story:
"Stella Cycles" for all those who are unable to ride.

  • My name is Stella Rose and cycling has changed my life for the better. It has been the catapult that spurred me to transition into a full time career in health/fitness and wellness, and begin an exciting journey as  multi-sport competitive athlete. Just one year ago I was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis, and this again changed my focus, and how I want to be of service to others.
  • The reality is, that I can still ride a bike and that I don't have cancer. I am inspired by the Wellspring Cancer Support Foundation, and this amazing group of people who work directly with patients and families, dealing with cancer. 
  • Your donation goes directly to helping cancer warriors. Wellspring offers free services to help those in need.

Chronic, terminal and disabling illness has become and epidemic. I am on a mission to help in any way I can, while I still can. On September 26th to October 2nd 2015, I will be riding from Toronto to New Orleans in a 24hr cycling relay. "I ride for all those who are unable to ride."

Help me get to New Orleans!

  • I need to raise $10,000 part of which supports my ride and the rest goes directly to fund Wellspring Cancer Support Centres in the GTA

Your donation has a direct impact

  • Wellspring Cancer Support Centres pick up where our medical system and cancer treatments leave off.  In short, they help people live after facing death.
  • This summer I raced 75k coming in 1st lady/3rd overall and raised $1000 for MS research.
  • Everyone deserves to live an awesome life and in my experience people really do want to make a difference. This is a wonderful opportunity to do just that!

Risks & Commitment

You may be wondering what if Stella's MS flares up on the way and she doesn't make it to New Orleans? I have asked myself this many times.

  • During my first and worst MS flare up I ran the Chicago Marathon, finished and lived to tell the tale, so I am confident now that I know what I am dealing with and I am so much stronger and healthier now.
  • Wellspring offers full support for the ride with a medical team by our side the whole way. This also gives me great confidence.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this awesome journey!
  • Donate as little as $5 any amount is a big help :)  

Sharing is caring let's use social media to come together to do something great THANK YOU!!!

story:
What is Cell 411?

Hello, my name is Virgil Vaduva, I am a geek, innovator, liberty lover, journalist and the creator of the Cell 411 platform. I spent half of my life in a Communist country where violence, government abuse and tyranny was a daily occurrence in my life. My life experiences have finally brought me to a point to where I have decided to use technology as a means to offer thousands of people around the world the personal safety and security that they may not be able to receive from their local government resources; that is why I created the Cell 411 platform.

Cell 411 is a mobile app and platform that allows users to manage their own emergencies in a decentralized fashion by only calling upon trustworthy people in times of need. While the app has been a success, now I need your help to take the app to the next level and help it expand even further across the world and help even more people.

Why this project is so important

This app started as very simple personal project for me, but it became more popular than I expected. While I designed the initial app and the user interface, I am not a mobile app or UI designer, which means that the app still has some rough edges and plenty of improvements are needed. Here is why $50,000 will go a long way to help Cell 411 become even a greater success:

  • I would be able to pay two developers to work on the app full time for at least 6 months and provide substantial improvements to the app.
  • Many features and improvements are on the to-do list, however I don't have the time, finances or ability to implement them,
  • A total redesign of the UI would greatly improve usability and intuitiveness of the app.
  • The live video streaming feature is the favorite feature for the users, however I cannot personally continue to cover the bills required to host live-streaming servers; furthermore the video streaming coverage must be improved on all continents to help with performance. This costs quite a bit.

The Impact of Cell 411 is Massive

Cell 411 has become a huge success in several countries and instances where police response and corruption prevent citizens from obtaining the help they need; in less than a month 30,000 users have installed the app on their smart phones and are using it on a daily basis:

  • Cell 411 is extremely popular in South Africa, where violence is out of control and one person is murdered every 25 minutes. South African citizens are using Cell 411 to alert each other in dangerous situations or in case of emergencies.
  • The app is very popular throughout UK, Denmark and the rest of Europe, allowing entire communities to create de-centralized ways to provide mutual aid.
  • Cell 411 is being used in the United States daily by thousands of neighborhood watchers and families in order to keep their communities and families safe.
  • Cell 411 is even being used by small volunteer fire departments that cannot afford full-time dispatchers.
  • The app is used by minorities to maintain awareness of activities, crime and response in their neighborhoods.
  • Activists and neighborhood watchers use Cell 411 almost daily to alert communities and stream live videos in order resolve problems without resorting to violence.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks and challenges in this project, which is why I am asking for your help:

  • There is a lot of work left to do and improve the app based on your feedback, the user feedback.
  • There is no question that the app can be greatly improved, but I need your help and feedback in order to make it better.
  • Hosting costs, development expenses and cost of time associated with work on the app will always be a challenge, but your help will allow me to overcome it.

What users are saying

So far Cell 411 has been received with open arms by users all over the world. Here is what some are saying:
  • "I envisage the Cell 411 program to become almost a compulsory requirement in this country" 
  • "Your app is a god sent because you can’t trust the authorities these days so one has to look after those close to you" - Attila from South Africa
  • "A citizen is murdered every 25 minutes by violent criminals in South Africa - so it will be huge" 
  • "This is genius!" 
  • "This could save lives"
  • "...a revolutionary tool for change in our society" - 
  • "Badass"
Please help me make this app even better. Right now it is up to you to help me make Cell 411 even a greater success.

story:
Hello, 

Hi, my name is Brittany and I am Counter Couture Hair


My vision is to have a salon in a cool, hip environment where everyone feels welcome and can look forward to being themselves without judgment. I want my clients to be able to kick back with a craft beer while listening to good music, all the while getting their hair done.


When I reach my goal, I will have a personalized suite that is fully loaded for all services, providing  a salon culture that promotes being an individual. I cater to everyone, from punk rockers, musicians, artists, business professionals,geeks, students, and soccer moms; I am also  fluent in American Sign Language and am looking forward to being a hairstylist who caters to the Deaf community in the Tampa Bay Area.


I am a certified Pravana colourist who thoroughly believes in continuing education, and I am also a platform artist. I compete in hair competitions, and recently received an award for an avant garde hair performance at the Mainstream Hair Expo in Tampa, Florida.


Total Goal: $5,000

I am asking for $3,000 in order to cover the initial expenses of setting up my space at Salons by JC; that will enable me to get offer the highest level of service to my clients from the first day. It will cover cost of my booth rental, chemicals, and supplies for the salon so that I can create Counter Couture Hair in the way that it is intended: as a professional boutique with a level of service an quality of materials associated with this. I have a particular skill in haircoulour, and  I want to be in the position to offer Pravana and Olaplex because I am a chemistry nerd and I am very interested in maintaining the integrity of my client's hair, as well as making every single client look like a rock star when they walk out the door.
PRAVANA hair care and hair color products are always free of parabens, sulfites, sulfates, cocamide DEA, formaldehyde, phthalates, and many other ingredients commonly used in cosmetic products but known to be harmful to users or the environment. This hybrid approach, which marries time proven botanical extracts and natural proteins with modern elements such as nano-amino acids and micro-polymers, provides hair care that is truly super-natural while also protecting the planet and its people . 
Olaplex is a recently invented salon treatment which is patented to rebuild broken disulfide bonds in the hair, these bonds are naturally broken through flat ironing,brushing, sun exposure, putting hair into ponytails, and then have extreme breakage from bleaching, relaxing, and perming.

Here's a Breakdown of what I anticipate the Expenses to be:

  • Chemicals and Styling Products: $800
  • Shelving and Storage: $900
  • Capes, Towels, Essential Linens: $250
  • Required Ergonomic Salon Essentials: $250
This is why my goal is $3,000 although I would like to raise $5,000 in order to give my salon a personality it deserves. Including: 

  • Beverages for my guests including a Mini Fridge
  • Decorations, Additional Lighting, and a paint job






What If I Don't Reach My Goal? 

I'll be honest. I have been working hard to get a great book of clients, but I am still building as a stylist and am working to build a full book. I would definitely be able to maintain regular my regular expenses, but I just need assistance with startup costs.

On my days off, I maintain a second job. If I am unable to reach my goal, then I am going to have to continue waiting tables and working in a commission salon while I raise funds. I am not after a hand out, my campaign is offering fantastic services at a discount and I intend to deliver this in whatever way I can


Other Ways You Can Help

Like my pages on Facebook and Instagram and share them with your friends who are looking for a new stylist in the Tampa Bay Area! Thank You! 

Or if someone is looking to donate any supplies that I have listed, please let me know! 

BOOK AN APPOINTMENT
1RECS

I am asking for $3,000 in order to cover the initial expenses of setting up my space at Salons by JC; that will enable me to get offer the highest level of service to my clients from the first day. It will cover cost of my booth rental, chemicals, and supplies for the salon so that I can create Counter Couture Hair in the way that it is intended: as a professional boutique with a level of service an quality of materials associated with this. I have a particular skill in haircoulour, and  I want to be in the position to offer Pravana and Olaplex because I am a chemistry nerd and I am very interested in maintaining the integrity of my client's hair, as well as making every single client look like a rock star when they walk out the door.
PRAVANA hair care and hair color products are always free of parabens, sulfites, sulfates, cocamide DEA, formaldehyde, phthalates, and many other ingredients commonly used in cosmetic products but known to be harmful to users or the environment. This hybrid approach, which marries time proven botanical extracts and natural proteins with modern elements such as nano-amino acids and micro-polymers, provides hair care that is truly super-natural while also protecting the planet and its people . 

Olaplex is a recently invented salon treatment which is patented to rebuild broken disulfide bonds in the hair, these bonds are naturally broken through flat ironing,brushing, sun exposure, putting hair into ponytails, and then have extreme breakage from bleaching, relaxing, and perming.



Here's a Breakdown of what I anticipate the Expenses to be:


Chemicals and Styling Products: $800
Shelving and Storage: $900
Capes, Towels, Essential Linens: $250
Required Ergonomic Salon Essentials: $250
This is why my goal is $3,000 although I would like to raise $5,000 in order to give my salon a personality it deserves. Including: 


Beverages for my guests including a Mini Fridge
Decorations, Additional Lighting, and a paint job








What If I Don't Reach My Goal? 


I'll be honest. I have been working hard to get a great book of clients, but I am still building as a stylist and am working to build a full book. I would definitely be able to maintain regular my regular expenses, but I just need assistance with startup costs.
On my days off, I maintain a second job. If I am unable to reach my goal, then I am going to have to continue waiting tables and working in a commission salon while I raise funds. I am not after a hand out, my campaign is offering fantastic services at a discount and I intend to deliver this in whatever way I can


Other Ways You Can Help

 Like my pages on Facebook and Instagram and share them with your friends who are looking for a new stylist in the Tampa Bay Area! Thank You! 
Or if someone is looking to donate any supplies that I have listed, please let me know! 

BOOK AN APPOINTMENT

1RECS

story:
About Us

We started LiquidGoldConcept in 2014 to support and empower mothers by making breastfeeding easier. The name liquid gold comes from colostrum, the first milk that moms produce; it is yellow in color and packed full of nutrients that are absolutely essential to the infant’s health.



The Problem

Many people think that breastfeeding is easy, but actually, it is a skill that requires a lot of practice and support. There are 4 million births each year in the US, and 82% of these babies are not breastfed for the recommended 6 months. (From CDC Breastfeeding Report Card (2011)) 

We know that breastfeeding can be extremely beneficial for both baby & mom.


Unfortunately, mothers can run into dozens of barriers like low milk supply, problems with latch due to nipple shape, breast pain, and breast engorgement. The public health infrastructure in the United States is just not set up to support breastfeeding.

Why does this matter?


Our Solution, the Breast Massage Knowledge Bank

Breast massage can improve, prevent, or alleviate the most common breastfeeding problems, it can even double the amount of milk you can pump in a session! We want to make it as easy as possible for parents and providers to learn about when and how to use breast massage!

That’s where LiquidGoldConcept’s Breast massage Knowledge Bank comes in.

When users sign in to the Knowledge Bank, they receive a customized collection of breast massage videos specific to their breastfeeding needs. But we need your help to make this a reality! 

Shown: "Dancing fingers" is adapted from Bolman M, Saju L, Oganesyan K, Kondrashova T, Witt AM. Recapturing the art of therapeutic breast massage during breastfeeding. J Hum Lact. 2013;29(3):328-331.


Fundraising Goal 

We only need $6000 to collaborate with a development firm to create the first functional breast massage knowledge bank. Please support this goal so we can support and empower mothers everywhere!


Other Ways You Can Help

1.Tell us about your breastfeeding experience!

2. Test the Breast Massage Knowledge Bank and our breast massage videos.

3.Help us create breast massage videos (Northern California Moms).

4.Are you a health provider? We'd love to learn about your experience with breast         massage!

Visit www.liquidgoldconcept.com to learn more!


Disclosures

LiquidGoldConcept is a for-profit company incorporated in the state of Michigan. 

The opinions expressed by LiquidGoldConcept, LLC in no way reflect the opinions of The Department of Health and Human Services, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, the University of California, Davis, or the Merced County Department of Public Health.

Thank you!

The LiquidGoldConcept Team

story:
My name is Michael. I have bartended for over 20 years in New York City and San Francisco. I make great cocktails, but unless you are in San Francisco there is no chance for you to enjoy them.

My solution: I put them in a bottle and sell them across the country. 

Most bottled cocktails are low flavor, low quality, low calorie. It’s high time that everyone had access to handcrafted, inventive cocktails made by an expert.

The craft cocktail movement strives to treat the art of the drink with the same care for taste, quality and presentation that a chef brings to meals. I've been working with professional chefs for decades to improve my own tasting palate, and I've learned the nuances of complex ingredients. I've received many honors for my dedication to the art of the cocktail. My work has been featured by taste-makers in a variety of media. I have presented my cocktails on The Today Show, and I've been chosen by the San Francisco Chronicle as an “SF Bar Star.” I have taught thousands of people how to make better drinks, and how to drink better. I want to bottle that experience and send it out into the world.

With your help I can set up a licensed manufacturing space, and my dream of bottling great cocktails can be your reality of drinking great bottled cocktails in the convenience of your living room.

My company's premiere concoctions will infuse classic cocktails with hand-made ingredients:

Harvest Manhattan

This is a cocktail that begins with roasted pumpkins, pureed and strained with a host of locally-sourced spices to make our own pumpkin liqueur. The final drink adds notes of cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and clove to the classic Manhattan.

The Dark Knight

A thoughtfully-balanced update to the classic Negroni cocktail, the Dark Knight features my own homemade vermouth, perfectly balanced with Campari, Aperol, and gin. The sour of vinegar and pink peppercorn is tempered by the sweetness of brown sugar and bing cherries.

Chamomile Old Fashioned

In a 72-hour process, I infuse bourbon with loose-leaf chamomile tea. This is carefully combined with an assortment of bitters and locally-sourced honey.

Authenticity, Not Artificiality

By focusing on craftsmanship and flavor, I can offer tasty cocktails with dramatically more flavor than the current market offering. To be clear, MCM cocktails will contain:

All natural ingredients

No artificial colors or flavors

No preservatives

No MSG or corn syrup

Through endless tinkering and rigorous testing, I've perfected the complexity and character of these drinks, and now I want to you to be able to enjoy them, in the comfort of your home.

What MCM Needs...and What You Get

I need $50,000 to bottle my first bulk batch of The Dark Knight, Chamomile Old Fashioned, and Harvest Manhattan.

I will need:

  • Manufacturing space and all necessary licensing
  • This space will be built out as both a commercial kitchen and a bottling line
  • First orders for bottles, labels, spirits, and ingredients
Then I will have the materials I need to get these cocktails on the shelves at liquor, grocery, and convenience stores.
For helping me out, I have great perks available:
Naturally, vouchers will be available for the actual bottled cocktails, priced $50-$200. 
But I am most excited about creating a personalized cocktail for you at the $25 contribution, as well as an original recipe included at the $100/$200 level. These recipes are a direct way for me to empower craft cocktail creation and enjoyment at the grassroots level.
I have been teaching for over a decade. At the $500 & $1000 levels you will get a class, taught by me and featuring some of my favorite cocktails, and a chance to ask a seasoned professional anything you'd like.
There is a reason my Instagram is themobilemixologist—I love to travel. At the $2000 level I will fly to you, and teach you a class in the location of your choosing.

The Impact

MCM is a chance to spread the gospel of a well-made drink to everyone, everywhere, on their own terms. The bottled cocktail market is currently filled with processed, pale imitations of good drinks. MCM looks to fight back with creativity and integrity so that a delightful cocktail is available to everyone.

Bartending and teaching mixology is a time-honored interaction from bartender/teacher to guest/student. I look to extend this tradition by spreading my message throughout the land. I will work tirelessly to spread the good word of a great drink through tastings, classes, videos... however I can reach people. And when I leave, my cocktails shall remain.

Challenges

The ready-to-drink cocktail market is growing. And though young, it is growing all ways at once. Not all of the ways will last, but one avenue that is underrepresented and has potential for long-term growth is the bespoke, high-flavor sector.

California has the perfect licensing system to allow for great bottled cocktails.

I have partnered with Mikha Diaz, owner and operator of Two Sisters Bar & Books. I was her first bartender. We have worked in the trenches since 2012, and have made Two Sisters a destination bar in the San Francisco drink scene. Between the two of us we have forty years of industry experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't the only way to contribute! Do you know someone who loves a good cocktail? Share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, or strangers who love the art of mixed drinks. Thanks in advance, we can't succeed without your help!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sara Dowd-Maldonado and I am the sole creator of the patent-pending product, FlatUSafe.  I am the owner and operator of a successful online business-services company and I am lactose intolerant.  As a young person, controlling when flatulence was released was relatively easy to do; however, I have found in my research that as the body ages that control of expelling gas can falter.   I researched the available solutions out there and believed that I could create a better solution.  It is this drive that caused me to design, test and create my invention, FlatUSafe, which not only serves the purpose of allowing its user to control when he or she expels gas but also absorbs odors associated with flatulence - and it does so in an affordable manner that is easy to apply, easy to remove and easy to dispose of the unit when the day (or the event) is finished.

Along with aging, there are at minimum, 31 different medical conditions that cause a person suffering or diagnosed with any one or more of these conditions to have an increase in their bodies production of and expelling of gas.  My campaign is to raise funds so that a professional working prototype can be created and the idea shopped to potential manufacturers for bringing this product to the market.

Should you decide to help me in funding this venture, you will help to bring a product to market that is sure to help millions of people to feel better about themselves! 

FlatUSafe Flatulence Blocker and Odor Absorbers/Adsorbers/Eliminators
(patent-pending)

I need $2500 for the creation of a professional working prototype which will be used to shop my idea to manufactures who produce existing products in which adding FlatUSafe to their product line would be complimentary yet non-competitory.

In exchange for your donation to my campaign I would like to offer to you a sample package for crowdfunders, exclusively, which will consist of the following:
1) Sample of the product once or prior to brought to market.
2) Personal letter, signed by me the inventor of FlatUSafe, thanking you for your contribution to bringing this product which, I strongly believe, will help millions of people mailed to the address which you provide to me as your mailing address.
3) Exclusive behind-the-scenes access to the journey of bringing this product to market.
4) My eternal gratitude in making my dream of finally becoming a professional inventor a reality.

In the event that my fundraising goal is not reached, the funds will be used to shop this invention to potential buyers.  Doing so without a professional prototype may be obtainable; however, certainly more difficult to accomplish.

The Impact

There are, at minimum, 31 different medical conditions that cause those with these conditions to have an increased amount of flatulence and, by default, causes them to have to deal with the issue of not being able to control completely when flatulence is produced in their bodies.  FlatUSafe does not stop the production of flatulence.  FlatUSafe prevents the expelling of flatulence until the user is ready to release (such as when the user excuses him/herself and goes to the bathroom to release gas).

Clearly, I am new to the world of invention but not new to the world of problem-solving.  I take great pride in creating solutions to everyday and extraordinary problems that make things...life better for other people.

Risks & Challenges

If there were any risks in your helping to fund this invention it would be in the fact that bringing a product to market is a complex and, often difficult thing to accomplish.  It is for this reason that I am not attempting to manufacture the product and bring it to market myself - rather to license or to sell this invention and place these tasks into the hands of those who are more knowledgeable in this area.

I believe that solutions happen.  I want to bring this solution to the market.

Other Ways You Can Help

I fully understand that sometimes some will not be able to help out financially, however, they still believe in what this product can do for people and would like to see it brought to market.  I thank all contributors, financial and otherwise and appreciate any help, funding, suggestions that you can and are willing to offer to me on this journey to bring FlatUSafe to market!
*Fund, if you can!
*Spread the word!
*Contact me, anytime, with suggestions, advice, or other!

Thank you, in advance, for your contributions.

Please note that I will be adding updates, pictures of the product at the stage it's at, at this point in time; and other updates, shortly.

story:
Hi, I’m Hilton, owner of Native Heights Climbing Solutions, a startup with the goal of "Bringing the Mountains Home", or at least traditional climbing. I’m finishing up a degree in Mechanical Engineering with a double major in Physics, and a minor in Math at Virginia Commonwealth University. I will graduate December of this year with a patent for a medical device nearing completion, and 3 years of experience in product development and optimization, with plans to start a Master’s program Spring of 17’ in Product Innovation.

I’ve been climbing for 4 years, and I recently became certified through the Professional Climbing Instructors Association to teach Lead Climbing. I have been setting routes at VCU’s Climbing wall for 3 years, and I met my wife climbing at VCU 3 years ago. As many of you, I made the progression from top-roping to sport climbing, and finally to traditional climbing. Luckily I had the benefit of having two great local climbing gyms to train at as I learned. (Peak Experiences, and VCU Climbing Wall) And while I made the transition from top-roping to sport fairly quickly, progressing to trad became difficult as there were few people qualified to teach it, and even fewer with their own gear, who were proficient at it. The disparity perplexed me, as did the danger of learning on my own or with inexperienced others.

With this problem in mind I begin work on creating a solution. Today I’m proud to tell you the I-TCD (Indoor-Traditional Climbing Device) is that solution. The I-TCD makes it possible to practice and lead on traditional gear in indoor gyms, whereby increasing the safety of the sport while creating an opportunity for experienced traditional climbers to teach others how to become more confident and proficient at the sport. All without gyms having to pay increased costs to adapt their walls for traditional gear placements.

My goal through INDIEGOGO is to fund the patent, manufacture, and UIAA rating of the I-TCD whose function is to create anchor points for Traditional Climbing Gear (Trad Gear) on existing indoor climbing walls. With over a year of leg work and over 200+ hours of CAD testing to prove the design concept is feasible, I have a manufacturer for the base device, a rapid prototyping company ready to create the stones, and a Lab ready to test the product for UIAA certification.

Where you come in is in helping to make this all possible. I’ve invested just over $6000 in the provisional patent, early rapid prototyping, materials and testing, market analysis, and in preparing the patent itself, and I've just purchased the first device for testing. Additionally I’ve gotten a lot of great feedback from climbers from all over the US, and Internationally. To put the costs in perspective; paying for the patent itself is going to cost just over $15,000. Prototypes for UIAA testing and rating will run another $8000, plus the cost of having the devices tested and rated. (note the I-TCD will exceed the current climbing gear standards coming in with a 32kN normal load capability, and a 18kN axial load capability. The current standard is 24kN and 7kN respectively)

The initial launch to production will cost approximately $55,000-65,000, and I’ll be asking for your help in getting the word out to all of the climbing gyms in the nation that are already set up for sport climbing. Or who are just looking to expand the classes they teach to improve climber safety outdoors. Keep in mind that the I-TCD will also reduce the strain on outdoor crags in State and National Parks, and on US Forest Service lands. By training climbers to use Trad Gear in the safety of indoor environments; a skill that will transfer to the outdoors, we will together reduce the need for bolted routes outdoors and therefore our impact on the environment, while increasing the number of areas climbers are permitted to climb in.

With your help getting the patent under way, our next step is to manufacture 3 devices for UIAA testing, and for testing here at Native Heights Climbing Solutions. With a UIAA rating we will introduce the devices at Virginia Commonwealth University and to the local climbing gym here in Richmond VA, to get Traditional Climbing Indoors underway. We also plan to work with the climbing society to create an approved standard for teaching traditional climbing, so that we can get gym instructors certified, and up to speed on teaching traditional climbing.  

From there we hope to establish the first indoor routes by November 17’ and then begin national sales. When the patent is in place we will expand to the international market to bring this device to climbing gyms around the world.

You might be asking yourself, what are the perks of funding this campaign? Well for starters there’s cool gear, small scale 3D printed versions of the device, and for larger donators or gyms, early packages that will include classroom versions of the device so climbing gyms can start teaching climbers and staff while the device is reaching launch stage. The first $25,000 will go toward the patent, the devices for UIAA rating, and toward getting contributors their rad gear.

In conclusion, one of the greatest factors a climber must take into consideration is safety. Native Heights Climbing Solutions plans to bring that home with the I-TCD, by exceeding the current industry standards, ensuring the best quality materials, and by patenting the I-TCD to protect the device from companies that would manufacture with substandard materials to cut costs at the risk of our lives. I plan to be the first to test the device and one of many who stands behind its quality; and I would be honored if you: climber, parent of a climber, friend of a climber, sibling or loved one to a climber, entrepreneur, gym goer, gym owner, trad fanatic, sport enthusiast, or native to life would join me on making climbing safer to learn and therefore more fun to enjoy outdoors.

Even if you can’t contribute yourself, please share this with your friends, family, and local climbing community to get the word out that a device is in the works to bring traditional climbing home.
story_txt: Hi, I’m Hilton, owner of Native Heights Climbing Solutions, a startup with the goal of "Bringing the Mountains Home", or at least traditional climbing. I’m finishing up a degree in Mechanical Engineering with a double major in Physics, and a minor in Math at Virginia Commonwealth University. I will graduate December of this year with a patent for a medical device nearing completion, and 3 years of experience in product development and optimization, with plans to start a Master’s program Spring of 17’ in Product Innovation.I’ve been climbing for 4 years, and I recently became certified through the Professional Climbing Instructors Association to teach Lead Climbing. I have been setting routes at VCU’s Climbing wall for 3 years, and I met my wife climbing at VCU 3 years ago. As many of you, I made the progression from top-roping to sport climbing, and finally to traditional climbing. Luckily I had the benefit of having two great local climbing gyms to train at as I learned. (Peak Experiences, and VCU Climbing Wall) And while I made the transition from top-roping to sport fairly quickly, progressing to trad became difficult as there were few people qualified to teach it, and even fewer with their own gear, who were proficient at it. The disparity perplexed me, as did the danger of learning on my own or with inexperienced others.With this problem in mind I begin work on creating a solution. Today I’m proud to tell you the I-TCD (Indoor-Traditional Climbing Device) is that solution. The I-TCD makes it possible to practice and lead on traditional gear in indoor gyms, whereby increasing the safety of the sport while creating an opportunity for experienced traditional climbers to teach others how to become more confident and proficient at the sport. All without gyms having to pay increased costs to adapt their walls for traditional gear placements.My goal through INDIEGOGO is to fund the patent, manufacture, and UIAA rating of the I-TCD whose function is to create anchor points for Traditional Climbing Gear (Trad Gear) on existing indoor climbing walls. With over a year of leg work and over 200+ hours of CAD testing to prove the design concept is feasible, I have a manufacturer for the base device, a rapid prototyping company ready to create the stones, and a Lab ready to test the product for UIAA certification.Where you come in is in helping to make this all possible. I’ve invested just over $6000 in the provisional patent, early rapid prototyping, materials and testing, market analysis, and in preparing the patent itself, and I've just purchased the first device for testing. Additionally I’ve gotten a lot of great feedback from climbers from all over the US, and Internationally. To put the costs in perspective; paying for the patent itself is going to cost just over $15,000. Prototypes for UIAA testing and rating will run another $8000, plus the cost of having the devices tested and rated. (note the I-TCD will exceed the current climbing gear standards coming in with a 32kN normal load capability, and a 18kN axial load capability. The current standard is 24kN and 7kN respectively)The initial launch to production will cost approximately $55,000-65,000, and I’ll be asking for your help in getting the word out to all of the climbing gyms in the nation that are already set up for sport climbing. Or who are just looking to expand the classes they teach to improve climber safety outdoors. Keep in mind that the I-TCD will also reduce the strain on outdoor crags in State and National Parks, and on US Forest Service lands. By training climbers to use Trad Gear in the safety of indoor environments; a skill that will transfer to the outdoors, we will together reduce the need for bolted routes outdoors and therefore our impact on the environment, while increasing the number of areas climbers are permitted to climb in.With your help getting the patent under way, our next step is to manufacture 3 devices for UIAA testing, and for testing here at Native Heights Climbing Solutions. With a UIAA rating we will introduce the devices at Virginia Commonwealth University and to the local climbing gym here in Richmond VA, to get Traditional Climbing Indoors underway. We also plan to work with the climbing society to create an approved standard for teaching traditional climbing, so that we can get gym instructors certified, and up to speed on teaching traditional climbing.  From there we hope to establish the first indoor routes by November 17’ and then begin national sales. When the patent is in place we will expand to the international market to bring this device to climbing gyms around the world.You might be asking yourself, what are the perks of funding this campaign? Well for starters there’s cool gear, small scale 3D printed versions of the device, and for larger donators or gyms, early packages that will include classroom versions of the device so climbing gyms can start teaching climbers and staff while the device is reaching launch stage. The first $25,000 will go toward the patent, the devices for UIAA rating, and toward getting contributors their rad gear.In conclusion, one of the greatest factors a climber must take into consideration is safety. Native Heights Climbing Solutions plans to bring that home with the I-TCD, by exceeding the current industry standards, ensuring the best quality materials, and by patenting the I-TCD to protect the device from companies that would manufacture with substandard materials to cut costs at the risk of our lives. I plan to be the first to test the device and one of many who stands behind its quality; and I would be honored if you: climber, parent of a climber, friend of a climber, sibling or loved one to a climber, entrepreneur, gym goer, gym owner, trad fanatic, sport enthusiast, or native to life would join me on making climbing safer to learn and therefore more fun to enjoy outdoors.Even if you can’t contribute yourself, please share this with your friends, family, and local climbing community to get the word out that a device is in the works to bring traditional climbing home.

story:
Short Summary

We've developed a novel and elegant solution to help people independently stand and walk where they may have needed help.  We also help the care providers by providing lifting assistance and time management opportunities. 

My business partner and I came up with a new type of assistive device we call the Rise Active Chair.  We've been developing the idea and have made inroads with the medical community to validate the idea and have generated some encouraging support.

We have self funded the initial design, a patent, a business plan, a proof of concept model, a customer discovery campaign and a National Institute of Health Grant application and critique.  We need additional funding to make a compact and usable model for more data generation.

This funding campaign will help us add improvements to the basic design and generate a true model that is automated and has broad user appeal.

Based on the funding and the resulting model, we will commence expert conducted studies to help us generate interest to either go directly into production or to take the idea to industry experts to sponsor the full FDA certification which is beyond the funding levels of this campaign. 

What We Need & What You Get

Perhaps you could personally benefit from this solution in your own life or you know someone who would.  We all are likely to need this  device at some point along the way.

The funding will pay for professional engineering services to assure the design is both functional and aesthetically pleasing. Most of the funding will go to fabrication and sourcing of unique part construction.  The design will consider  future production costs to assure efficient and cost effective manufacturing.

Every $100 to $499 donated will receive a T-Shirt with the Active Body Logo and our Motto:  We Rise by Lifting Others.  Donations between $500 and $9999 will get the T-Shirt plus direct and regular updates on our progress. Donations of $10,000 and more will get the T-Shirt, the regular updates and first access to get an early production model at cost plus the knowledge that you've really aided in bringing life changing technology to help people who really need it.

Should funds come up short, we will scale our efforts to continue the quest but focus on the very basics with more interest on generating data for a next funding effort.

The Impact

Personal care experiences with the elderly, ALS and cancer patients led to the insight to the need for a Rise Active Chair. The impact is to improve both the patients and the care providers lives by:

Providing a sense of autonomy for patients that need help standing and walking, usually provided by another person.

Helping to relieve the care provider of physical back strains from lifting and achieving time management gains by allowing the user to perform more functions on their own.

The Rise Active Chair can also help with bariatric care to stimulate exercise and those recovering from temporary conditions like knee or back problems.

We could likely all benefit from the lift and assist features at one time or another through the full course of life.

Risks & Challenges

We believe the idea and the function of the Rise Active Chair will be life changing for many people in their quest to maintain an active and independent life.  The main business risks are:

The incremental cost will be too high for large scale adoption of the feature.

Insurance subsidies may not be available in the first models which would limit access to lower income users.

Our goal is to work with manufacturers on breakthrough designs to reduce the cost of robotic lift mechanisms in this application.   This will be critical to achieve the lift feature at a cost increment that will appeal to a large segment of wheelchair users.   

Other Ways You Can Help

We believe that the more people who know about the effort, the better our chances of being successful will be, and the more people will benefit with mobility sooner.  So..

Please tell people about this concept and have them contact us with their needs and ideas. 

Share this idea on Facebook and help spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, this is Helen and Justin of Flourish Partners Ltd.  We're a company that work in the medical technology space and we're passionate about facilitating the rapid diagnosis of deadly Lyme Disease.

Our Chief Scientist, Dr. Trebor Lawton has had a career that has lasted over 40 years and he feels that he has the proprietary know how to develop a urine based diagnostic test for Lyme Disease. Also, he has successfully developed other products for other diseases that are extremely difficult to diagnose.

Currently, there are at least 300,000 cases of Lyme diagnosed in the US every year, but the cdc feel that there is at least 10 times that amount that is not diagnosed.  Lyme disease costs the US $3billion per year and the majority of this is chronic stage lyme. It's been reported that there has been a rapid increase in the cases being diagnosed in the UK, Ireland, Holland, Australia, Canada and many other places globally - so we feel with our test we could facilitate an earlier diagnosis, save the health service millions and more importantly save and improve the quality of patient's lives.

So, if you and your family are exposed to a tick bite, essentially you could test your urine and our test would illustrate if the lyme is present - we think we might call it LymeTect and our plan if we can raise the funds is to have these tests available in every pharmacy, supermarket, hospital and GP surgery.  If the test shows as positive, antibiotic therapy would help to inhibit the disease before it becomes chronic Lyme and damage is done.

If you can help us reach our goal we can get on with developing this test and get it to market as soon as we can.  Lyme is deadly, it's debilitating and destroys  peoples' lives.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding is for the test development, there is proprietary know how and a variety of products and lab time that we need.  I can't say too much but we have to look at antibodies and ticks and we also need clinical trials, the quality and regulatory to be in place, FDA approval and CE marking as this is a global problem. We have to do this to  be able to get it to market.

Two members of the team complete consultancy works and plough the monies generated into the Lyme project as we are totally committed to the development and commercialization of this test.

The team are commercial specialists and scientists that have actively made and launched products prior to this, so we're confident we can do this. 

We also have a lot of interest in this test as current tests are so unreliable and a lot of patients have to travel to different countries to get a diagnosis and often then their Lyme Disease has become chronic.

If we don't reach this goal, any funds raised will go towards the project, we are in the process of contacting Angels, VC's, self funding, grant funding you name it, because we are compelled to make this test.

The Impact 

The impact of a diagnostic test, that will be accurate, could save lives and save millions.  Yes we are a profit making company, however we intend to use our profits to keep making products to facilitate other chronic diseases, this is not about a fat pay cheque.

Risks & Challenges

 This is risky, all scientific development is - but with the expertise, experience, drive and determination that this team has we're really confident that we can achieve this.

  Other Ways You Can Help

Share your experiences with Lyme - have you been diagnosed, what was your experience.  Twitter is alive with those stories every day!  Let's try to diagnose Lyme a little earlier and a little better.

story:
I am Alexander Shiva, music producer . All my life is about sound and music and  I have over 10 years in this industry. Probably the most well-known song I co-wrote is  Edward Maya - Stereo love

From the passion of listening and creating music, I started to study the sound in every aspect, trying to understand the connection of sound waves and emotions and this have lead me to greater discoveries. Moreover, I always had the feeling that something is wrong harmonically, but I couldn’t explain to myself why I had this perception in most of the music I listened and created.  The study I am presenting here gave me answers to many questions and I want to share all this with you. 
That’s why I want to create a platform that would help all people, for free, to have access easily and in real time to quality music that is in harmony with Universe.



“ CONVERT MUSIC FOR HEALING “ is a project born from the desire of  bringing healthy sounds to people, to inform them regarding the importance of sound and help them convert the favorite music in a positive way.

Maybe you wonder …” but WHAT IS WRONG WITH MUSIC? WHY WE SHOULD CHANGE SOMETHING?” 

The problem is written in the FREQUENCY. But what do we know about this? Unfortunately, not much.  By changing the frequency of a song, the hearing difference is not very noticeable , but the arranging of the molecules is different.

TODAY,  THE STANDARD PITCH IS 440 Hz scale.

We know that ANCIENTS used, for over hundred of years the 432Hz pitch.  Why is that ?

The history sais that in 1939 Joseph Goebbels (propaganda Minister for Nazi Germany) was the first to push for all music world wide to be played and listened to at A-440Hz. He failed. 

But in 1953 the Elite had a meeting in London to finally IMPOSE the A-440Hz Standard Concert Pitch and Succeeded. 

First of all, the problem with the 440 Hz tuning is there is nothing harmoniously in the Universe related to this number, so why are we using it?

On the other hand, 432 Hz vibrates with the universe’s golden mean PHI and unifies the properties of light, time, space, matter, gravity and magnetism with biology, the DNA code, and consciousness.




We want to create a platform for online conversion of music from 440 Hz to 432 Hz scale. 

The process is very simple – You enter on the website (www.convertmusicforhealing.com), upload the mp3 and  press the   “CONVERT”  button. In just few seconds, you download back the song.  Fast, easy, simple and free.

In this moment, exist some software for music conversion, but most of them are not working completely. 

Why we recommend to use our convertor? Simple :

The website is free for the mp3 format conversion to 432Hz, so anyone can access. 

For professionals that want to convert wav format, will be a very low fee. 



In order to make this project become a reality, we need your help.

Every penny we receive will be used to: 

According to the sum we receive (in case of overcome) we can go further with the development,  by creating a Digital PLAYER that will automatically convert in real time music from 440Hz to 432Hz scale. 




You can support our project by sharing on Facebook / Twitter and help us change the world! 

                                                                         Facebook

                                                                           Twitter

                                                                            Youtube

story:
You are creating PEACE by supporting Yoga Well's expansion.

Yoga Well opened in March 2014 in an intimate space, as an effort to create a home for Yoga that was unique.Yoga Well nurtures the teachers who nurture their students, and the Yoga speaks for itself. We are creating more peace in the world, and we will continue to, with your participation.

Kathleen Ames started teaching at Yoga Well in April 2014 and joined me as a co-owner in June of 2015. We have grown rapidly, as our students can see our passion for teaching, and for creating an amazing practice that goes beyond our mats. Our community is forming faster than ever. Our collaboration has catapulted us into a new studio, larger and more comfortable.

We feel so blessed to know our new space but have already felt like it isn't big enough for our growing classes. Our teachers would be more comfortable with a few changes to the building.

There is a wall that we need to knock down in order to allow for better teaching. We will accommodate at least 5 more students per class when this wall disappears, and the teachers will be more visible to all.

Wall Teardown and clean up:

-Estimated at $1400

There are signs that we need to pay professionals to create and install, that will proudly guide us all to our new home.

Signs Estimated at $600 (minus the $235 earned from our recent Workshop) -$365

I know that you will help us if you can. This is not a plea to give us all of your money, or to invoke any sense of duty or guilt. NO PRESSURE! I do know that you will take more pride in your studio if you are part of its evolutions, and even knowing about our request, is part of that evolution. I do want to include you in this process.  Thank you so much for your support.

-Sarah Bergeron Molaro

http://loveyogawell.com/

story:
Здравейте,

Ние сме екипът на Фондация в обществена полза "Здраве за моята майка"  и проекта Здравей.  Нашата мисия е да направим повече българи здрави и да станем основната причина хиляди деца и възрастни да променят хранителните и двигателните си навици и да заживеят по-качествен живот.

По тази причина, ние решихме да организираме най-големия, забавен, цветен и полезен "Фестивал на Здравето" в България! Чрез този фестивал ние искаме да изпратим послание до всички българи, като не само им кажем как да живеят по-балансирано и да са по- здрави, а ги направим част от всичко, като им дадем възможност да се докоснат и преживеят Здравето и Спорта. Бихме искали да дадем една лесна и достъпна информация за здравословното хранене на малки и големи, като засегнем и темите за наднорменото тегло и диабета в България.  

Събитието очаква да посрещне над  20 000 малки и големи посетители на ден. То ще бъде напълно безплатно и ще даде възможност на посетителите да разгледат множество проекти и фирми свързани с балансирания начин на живот, да опитат различни здравословни неща за хапване, да участват в множество игри, работилнички, спортни занимания, да чуят лекции на най-добрите специалисти в областта на здравето и спорта и да се насладят на танци, музика и пиеси подготвени от децата и техните ръководители, както и от възрастните.

Общата сума, необходима за организирането на Фестивала на Здравето е 120 000 лева. Чрез тази кампания,  ние се надяваме да съберем 25 000 долара, които биха покрили разходите за

- изграждане на необходимите съоръжения - 3 шатри с подова конструкция, сцена, уъркшоп зона

5 лева биха били достатъчни, за да подсигурим част от изграждането на сцената

10 лева ще ни стигнат за една от масите необходими за събитието

100 лева ще покрият разхода за част от изграждането на шатрите

Вашата подкрепа- малка или голяма- ще ни помогне да осъществим нашата мисия. Включете се в най- здравословното събитие, организирано някога в България! :) 

Благодарим ви!

По какъв друг начин можете да се включите? :) Споделете тази мисия, за да разберат повече хора за нея :) Научете повече тук: www.zdravei.org/festival-na-zdraveto

В страницата на Фестивала ще може да проследиш всички събрани средства и за какво се изразходват те! :)
story_txt: Здравейте,Ние сме екипът на Фондация в обществена полза "Здраве за моята майка"  и проекта Здравей.  Нашата мисия е да направим повече българи здрави и да станем основната причина хиляди деца и възрастни да променят хранителните и двигателните си навици и да заживеят по-качествен живот.По тази причина, ние решихме да организираме най-големия, забавен, цветен и полезен "Фестивал на Здравето" в България! Чрез този фестивал ние искаме да изпратим послание до всички българи, като не само им кажем как да живеят по-балансирано и да са по- здрави, а ги направим част от всичко, като им дадем възможност да се докоснат и преживеят Здравето и Спорта. Бихме искали да дадем една лесна и достъпна информация за здравословното хранене на малки и големи, като засегнем и темите за наднорменото тегло и диабета в България.  Събитието очаква да посрещне над  20 000 малки и големи посетители на ден. То ще бъде напълно безплатно и ще даде възможност на посетителите да разгледат множество проекти и фирми свързани с балансирания начин на живот, да опитат различни здравословни неща за хапване, да участват в множество игри, работилнички, спортни занимания, да чуят лекции на най-добрите специалисти в областта на здравето и спорта и да се насладят на танци, музика и пиеси подготвени от децата и техните ръководители, както и от възрастните.Общата сума, необходима за организирането на Фестивала на Здравето е 120 000 лева. Чрез тази кампания,  ние се надяваме да съберем 25 000 долара, които биха покрили разходите за- изграждане на необходимите съоръжения - 3 шатри с подова конструкция, сцена, уъркшоп зона5 лева биха били достатъчни, за да подсигурим част от изграждането на сцената10 лева ще ни стигнат за една от масите необходими за събитието100 лева ще покрият разхода за част от изграждането на шатритеВашата подкрепа- малка или голяма- ще ни помогне да осъществим нашата мисия. Включете се в най- здравословното събитие, организирано някога в България! :) Благодарим ви!По какъв друг начин можете да се включите? :) Споделете тази мисия, за да разберат повече хора за нея :) Научете повече тук: www.zdravei.org/festival-na-zdravetoВ страницата на Фестивала ще може да проследиш всички събрани средства и за какво се изразходват те! :)

story:
I am a Bath-based professional athlete specialising in the 200m sprint and racing to compete at the 2016 Rio Olympics with Team GB. I am aiming to smash my qualifying time this spring and am looking for support and funding to help me achieve my Olympic dream and keep me racing throughout 2016.

I discovered my love for sprinting at the age of 15, and once I started training and never looked back. I have been lucky enough to win scholarships and athletic funding which have allowed me to train with some of the best trainers in the UK and compete in competitions all around the world. However, after my funding got drastically cut last year, I need to make my own way to Rio by raising £15,000 for food, medical supplies, nutrition, travel and full-time training. I will be sharing my journey from Bath to Brazil via updates on social media and hope you can join me, support me, and back me all the way. Let’s see how fast we can get there!

About me:

I grew up with my older brother in foster care, moving between various homes in Bath, Bristol, Gloucestershire and Wolverhampton. When I was 15, I left foster care to move into a halfway house. It was at this time that I discovered sprinting. I was taken through Sprint training and knew straight away this was what I wanted to do. After just one week of training I entered my very first competition and went on to win two gold medals and one silver in the 100m, 200m and Long Jump.

In 2012 I moved to train with my amazing coach, James Hillier, at Bath University and was invited to represent Great Britain in the 100m and the 4x100m at the European Youth Olympics in Trabzon Turkey, where I won two silver medals. Since then I have gone on to represent Great Britain and Northern Ireland a number of times, gained many international medals, and trained with some of the fastest men in history such as Usain Bolt and Yohan Blake.

Since the very start, this sport has given me purpose, drive and ambition. It has completely changed my life for the better and I have not looked back once. I went from playing football down the park to representing Great Britain and Northern Ireland in front of millions of people live on TV. I want to do this for the rest of my life. I want to be the fastest and the best. So, after 5 years in training, I am aiming for the 2016 Rio Olympics with Team GB.

Race to Rio:

Since the very start, this sport has given me purpose, drive and ambition. It has completely changed my life for the better and I have not looked back once. I went from playing football down the park to representing Great Britain and Northern Ireland in front of millions of people live on TV. I want to do this for the rest of my life. I want to be the fastest and the best. So, after 5 years in training, I am aiming for the 2016 Rio Olympics with Team GB.

I was lucky to receive scholarships and support in various forms since starting my career. However, my funding has recently been cut, and without it I will not be able to pay for food, medical supplies, nutrition, travel and full-time training.

That is where you come in.

Please help me fund this once-in-a-lifetime chance to compete against the best sprinters in the world and race to bring home medals for Team GB. Anything you can give will be greatly appreciated, and please share my campaign with your friends and followers on social media.

Many thanks,

Leon.
