story: I am a 6 year breast cancer survivor myself and i have a vision of a place of serenity and hope where cancer fighters and their families can  come free of charge. It will be a 12 acre refuge with cabins and activities such as fishing and horse back riding or just resting on the porch overlooking the pond. We will have group activities for the children along with support sessions for caregivers  and group camp fires . I know personally how cancer can effect the whole family not just the individual and I want to give them a place to just forget the big C for a while and just be with their loved ones. I have the land and the passion to build on ,I just need your passion and desire to help financially to make this place of hope a reality.

story:
Welcome to the ROR!

 

 
     Hello! This is the Renegade Team calling on your help on developing a nationally recognized adaptive obstacle course race (AOCR)! With many obstacle course races taking the nation by storm, we realized there was a gap between the accessibility for all types of persons with disabilities to participate in these races and enjoy the social atmosphere behind this phenomenon. In this, the Renegade Obstacle Course Race (ROR) was born.

     The Renegade Obstacle Race is a unique set of challenges that tests the mental and physical abilities of all participants. The Renegade Obstacle Race will assist persons with disabilities on their path to developing a healthier approach on life, an improved social dynamic and creating the Renegade culture of uplifting individuals in their community. We have created a platform that will allow anyone with a disability or mental ailment the chance to try something new. The race will include a number of obstacles challenging participants as individuals and as teammates.

     By donating to this campaign, you can help us reach our overall goal of empowering not only the disabled community, but everyone who needs the motivation to pursue there goals. This is about showing people that they can do more, they can fight for more and they can rise again when they have fallen.

Meet & Greet

Ricardo Reyes / Co-Founder


 

Bringing joy and connecting with people has always been a passion of mine. Starting out young in theatre, film and live shows as an actor and stuntman, I realized my love for making people feel good extended beyond the stage. Soon, my family and I began to do shows for different charities and leukemia foundations. Looking into a career, I found that personal training helped me pay the bills and most importantly allowed me to help others reach their goals as well. At this time I hold three National certifications in fitness. These allow me to connect with athletes of varying degrees and most recently, with disabled athletes. In creating this race I thought how empowering it would be to see veterans in the armed forces or children who have a physical or mental ailment going through these obstacles together, as a team. Letting them know that life goes on and they are not alone in this.This is the purpose of The Renegade Obstacle Race, to “empower individuals with unique capabilities doing extraordinary things” as our motto states. We hope to not only reach and lift their spirits, but the spirits of anyone going through hardship who can look at this and say “ If they can do it I can do it, if they can push I can push, if they can roar I will roar.”

Stephen Martinez  /  Co-Founder

 As far back as I can remember, I have been able to connect with people on a personal level just by talking to them and lending a hand. It was important to me to have every interaction be genuine and memorable.  I have spent my whole life in the field of Broadcasting from working my first soundboard in second grade to working at NBCUniversal’s Technical Operations Department. What I discovered is that that the secret to life is as simple as the law of attraction. If you believe in something and work towards that goal, you will undoubtedly reach new and unimagined heights. I have propelled myself forward in life by knowing that the only limitations in the world are the ones we place on ourselves. The Renegade Obstacle Race is more than just a race about brawn and bragging rights. It is our way of not only including persons with disabilities, but instead focusing on their true potential and raising awareness. I have participated in a number of races and enjoyed the feelings of pride and enjoyment when I crossed the finish line. It has become a personal goal of mine to share my experiences with everyone in the community and rise above our own expectations. That is my hope for ROR!
 
Mike Danho / Co-Founder

I am the VP of Finance and Marketing within the Renegade Obstacle Race team. I majored in accounting at William Paterson University where I continued my higher education and completed my Master’s in Business Administration, (MBA – with a concentration in Marketing and Management). With  8 years of experience working in the finance and accounting fields, I will share my knowledge and personal experiences with ROR team.

I grew up around sports and believe athletics helps bring communities closer.  Sometimes no words need to be spoken to understand the battles and tribulations individuals need to overcome.  I blew out my knee twice (Tearing my ACL, MCL, Meniscus and fracturing my fibula), all within a three year span.  I felt helpless at times, not being able to get out of bed to go the restroom, or not being able to go to physical therapy.  I felt the urge to quit until speaking to my brother.  The quote I was told, “Don’t worry about the things you can’t do, focus on the things you can control.  Then from there, allow your mind to overcome battles your eyes can’t see yet”.  This is the exact quote which encouraged me to jump on board with the ROR team.  I am privileged to call myself a Renegade and team with ROR as an organization.

 

At this time we are looking to:

  • Raise funds for the construction of more safe and exciting obstacles and for our venue events.We have created obstacles that are not only safe but adhere to ADA guidelines as well.  With the funds we can make sure that no screw is overlooked and no corner is left unchecked.

Here's an example of our accessible monkey bar! Check out our gallery for more videos and photos of the obstacles.

GOODIES!!

What do we have for you?
  • $300 Funding- With this donation you receive,  a choice between three different limited edition ROR paintings by artist Stephanie Del Otero (see her work in our gallery and social media/ @deloteroart) , Racer and Partner Entries to be used in any race, 2 Spectator Entries, ROR T-Shirt's for the team and thank you card. ($800 value)
  • $60 Funding- Receive Racer and Partner Entry and ROR Limited edition shirts. 
  • $20 Funding- With this donation, you receive a ROR T-Shirt and thank you card.

The Impact

At this time, there aren’t sufficient Obstacle Course Races (OCR) that are available to people with a variety of ailments or disabilities; our races are designed to include everyone. OCR's aren't just about sport, they are about camaraderie, fitness and aspiration. There are individuals who were born with amazing odds against them, physically and/or mentally and have persevered.  There are also others who have endured a trauma causing a physical disability and now have to re-learn life from a different perspective.  We feel giving these individuals an Obstacle Course Race will prove to be a new athletic endeavor. This creates an opportunity for the disabled community to showcase strength, empower, to motivate others and also improve their own social dynamic.

Safety

Our main concern is first and foremost safety.It is paramount that the participants and their families feel safe and comfortable while also having a good time. We have taken every precaution to ensure safety . Our construction crews are experienced and certified, and will provide approval of  final obstacles built. Along with safety, we have an extensive background in physical fitness backing us up and organizations that are well established in the disabled community on board to guide us.

    ROR with us!

    If you can’t help with a donation, please SHARE us with your family and friends. Help us spread the word and become a national name in the OCR community. Grab our hand and start uplifting individuals by sharing our vision and encouraging individuals to become RENEGADES. Welcome to The ROR!

    * At this time race date and location is TBD in the Tri-state Area! Keep up to date on our website.

story:
Hey Hey!   I'm Brit, the friendly founder of GRIT Fitness, 50% entrepreneur and 50% party-starter best known for leading FIERCE workouts and treating everyone like FAMILY!

After realizing the ONLY reason I had a gym membership was to take group fitness classes  I thought, "why don't I create a place that offers a variety high-energy, music-driven classes all of the time?!"

I became obsessed with creating innovative fitness classes by taking standard workouts and making them “gritty” with added intensity and motivating playlists.

The idea spun around in my head for over 3 years, but not until 1 year ago did I take the leap of faith and quit my high-profile consulting career to work on GRIT full time.

In the beginning it was just me, teaching free community classes on the weekends and moonlighting as a fitness instructor to get away from my "real job."  Now we've grown to 7 original class formats, 14 instructors (pictured below), 35 classes per week and a family of over 2,500 active members!

But...we are SO MUCH MORE than another fitness concept – we’re a fun, fierce, fabulous fit family!  

  • Monthly social events (e.g. Cardio & Cocktails, Vino & Vinyasa)
  • FREE community classes attracting hundreds of participants
  • Building deep personal relationships  (#GRITFAM for life)
  • Passion and perseverance for long term goals
That’s what GRIT is all about!

Our family approach makes us stand out from the crowd.  Members of the #GRITFAM are more likely to exercise consistently because "it's the most fun they've ever had working out!"

With zero Public Relations or Marketing budget, we’ve received spotlights in the Associated Press, SELF magazine, Dallas Morning News, D Magazine and other highly influential media outlets.

This is ONLY the beginning, we're determined to transform the fitness industry into one what welcoming, hard working and focused on helping you live your best life!  My team and I are continuously innovating fun, fresh classes that guarantee a challenging workout and an engaging experience. Most importantly, I’m hustling to spread the GRIT's good vibes to as many people as possible.  

The next step is building our flagship studio in Dallas, TX.  I've secured an amazing 5,000 square foot location in Dallas' Design District which we are transforming from an art showroom to our flagship studio!  

I've hired architects and contractors to build 2 studio rooms: 1 multipurpose group fitness studio and 1 cycle studio for our newest indoor cycling format, "GRIT Revolution!"  The flagship will also have a locker room with showers, offices, a stretch bar and a lounge area!  This will be the official GRIT headquarters where we innovate new class formats and host instructor certifications, social events and lots of sweaty classes!  

I've raised almost all of the money for the nuts and bolts of the finish out (e.g. demo, construction of new walls, plumbing, flooring, etc.)  BUT we still need funding for class equipment, awesome lighting and killer sound systems for each studio room. 

If you’ve taken one of our free community classes, joined us for a cardio party, worked out to one of my YouTube videos or if you're simply on board with our mission – help us build this FIERCE flagship studio to better serve the #GRITFAM and the world!

We've got a LOT of work to do, but with your help we CAN make this bold, gritty vision come to life.  

Lots of luv, 

Brit


Risks and challenges

This is the first time we've built and operated a facility of this size so we have to ensure our studio operations are ready to handle additional volume. Fortunately, the business acumen I developed from my prior managment consulting career and my Harvard MBA provide me with the leadership and problem solving skills needed to get the job done! Most importantly, our #dreamteam of instructors and business advisors are on board and ready to work together to grow and serve the #GRITFAM

the friendly founder of GRIT Fitness, 50% entrepreneur and 50%
party-starter best known for leading FIERCE workouts and treating everyone like
FAMILY!After realizing the ONLY reason I had a gym membership was to take group fitness classes  I thought, "why don't I create a place that offers a variety high-energy, music-driven
classes all of the time?!"I became obsessed with creating innovative fitness classes by taking standard workouts and making them “gritty” with added intensity and motivating playlists.The idea spun around in my head for over 3 years, but not until 1 year ago did I take the leap of faith and quit my high-profile consulting career to work on GRIT full time.In the beginning it was just me, teaching free community classes on the weekends and moonlighting as a fitness instructor to get away from my "real job."  Now we've grown to 7 original class formats, 14 instructors (pictured below), 35 classes per week and a family of over 2,500 active members!

But...we are SO MUCH MORE than another fitness concept – we’re a fun, fierce, fabulous fit family!  
Monthly social events (e.g. Cardio & Cocktails, Vino & Vinyasa)
FREE community classes attracting hundreds of participants
Building deep personal relationships  (#GRITFAM for life)
Passion and perseverance for long term goals
That’s what GRIT is all about!

Our family approach makes us stand out from the crowd.  Members of the #GRITFAM are more likely to exercise consistently because "it's the most fun they've ever had working out!"



With zero Public Relations or Marketing budget, we’ve
received spotlights in the Associated Press, SELF magazine, Dallas Morning
News, D Magazine and other highly influential media outlets.


This is ONLY the

welcoming, hard working and focused on helping you live your best life!

story:
Hello Friends, 

I'm Pitz Quattrone from Vermont. Since 1993, I've been lucky enough to have the Didgeridoo take me from the Arctic Circle to the Equator sharing my passion for this magical, ancient Australian Aboriginal wind instrument. The time has come to open my own Vermont based Didgeridoo studio and I'm here to raise funds to do just that.

In recent years, I've been sharing the health benefits of listening, playing and absorbing the healing vibrations of the Didgeridoo. My work has included teaching sleep apnea patients how to play Didgeridoo to strengthen lower throat muscles to reduce apnea episodes. I've also been working in sound clinics at the Samara Healing Center in Maryland incorporating the Didgeridoo in vibroacoustic sound-table sessions and performing with the meditation ensemble, Sounds of Spirit. These various forms of helping people with the Didgeridoo have become more and more important to me as I grow older. This is something I'll be doing more of, for the rest of my life.  

In the new studio, I'll be teaching how to play Didgeridoo workshops for sleep apnea sufferers and everyone else interested in learning to play. Most of my work in the new studio I'll be concentrating on offering my "Didgeridoo Vibroacoustic Experience". On a specifically designed vibrating sound-table, folks lie down to hear and feel a mix of specifically produced recorded music, gathered nature sounds and roaming live Didgeridoo. During these sessions, a new unique soundscape will be created during each session giving the participant a deeply relaxing, stress relieving, transformative experience. Folks from Vermont, New England and everywhere else will be attracted to the studio. 

Vibroacoustic therapy is heard and deeply felt healing sound vibrations. Studies show Vibroacoustic therapy offers relief for; insomnia, chronic back and neck pain, arthritis, addiction, headaches, ADD/ADHD, Parkinson's disease, depression, multiple sclerosis (MS), chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia,  post stroke rehabilitation, asthma, and autism. 

To get the studio up and running, I'll need to purchase the necessary equipment, rent the space and cover basic infrastructure expenses that are involved with starting a business. I'm investing $8,000 of my own funds and need this additional $12,000 to launch the studio properly which includes precisely targeted nationwide marketing and promotion. I will be using every penny of every donation towards my dream of opening this studio and successfully operating it. I've been successful in the past raising funds for recordings and international Didgeridoo trips. I realize raising $12,000 is a challenge, but I'm confident that my efforts will be successful this time as well. In exchange for donations, donors will know their funds will go towards helping folks who are hurting. Donors also receive various length Didgeridoo Vibroacoustic sessions at the Vermont studio. There is no time expiration date on these perks, so if you don't visit lovely Vermont soon, no worries, your session will be securely held for you. Donors at the $250 and higher levels also receive Didge lessons in person or via Skype. An additional perk at the "Grand Poo-ba" level, donors receive a Pitz made, handcrafted Didge!

I hope you help me launch this unique "caring for fellow humans" business venture. And also, if you like the sound (pun!) of this project, please share this information with your friends. Let's lie down and feel the sound! Thanks for your time.

Very truly, 

Pitz Quattrone

Fantastic video and photos by James Matthew Gallagher!

story:
Experiment Overview

Hello! I am Michael Yao, and a junior at Dougherty Valley High School. I have a strong interest in the biological sciences, and plan to major in Molecular Biology or Biochemistry in college. I have been working on research projects in the late Dr. Gruenert’s group at the University of California San Francisco (UCSF) since June 2015, and I plan to work on a new project starting this summer with Dr. Shingo Suzuki at UCSF: a bioengineered cure to various neuronal diseases, including Alzheimer’s Disease, schizophrenia, Huntington’s Disease, and depression.

Very recently, molecular biology has advanced greatly in the span of a few short decades, as the array of techniques and tools available to researchers has expanded just as drastically. It is now possible to generate stem cells and “induce pluripotency” from somatic cells, as well as guide their differentiation into other somatic cell types.  In order to achieve the goal of working towards a cure for a wide variety of neuronal diseases, my project involves the editing of specific human genes that are critical to cellular differentiation into neuronal somatic cells, genes such as cdk5, BDNF, ANK3, and Abi2. The gene modification would involve the seamless introduction of foreign DNA into the genome that would cause the co-expression of a certain fluorescence protein and/or resistance to certain drugs that would normally kill unmodified cells. This gene modification has no foreseeable adverse effects on the human genome, and would provide an easy way for researchers to screen cells based on fluorescence protein expression levels or resistance to drug treatment and facilitate the differentiation process of iPSCs into neuronal cells, cells that express the cdk5, BDNF, ANK3, and Abi2 genes at significant levels.

In essence, my project will help researchers develop new therapies and drug treatments for neuronal diseases by making cells glow if they are functionally corrected. 

What We Need

In order to conduct this months-long experiment, I am working towards a goal of raising $3,000 to help cover the costs of scientific research. The money raised will go directly to my lab at UCSF in order to cover laboratory expenses, the use of the laboratory facility, DNA sequencing expenses, constructing DNA sequences, and maintaining cell cultures.

The Impact

Although the science behind this experiment may be complicated, the reasons for it are simple and easy to understand: this project will provide researchers an easy and efficient means of controlling the differentiation of cells into neuronal cells, facilitating the study of neuronal diseases and ultimately leading to possible cures for the wide array of the diseases that affect one in four American adults in any given year, according to the US National Institute of Mental Health. Clearly, the success of this experiment could greatly advance the biological understanding of how the brain works at the cellular level.

I have been working with similar projects and biological experiments for the past year under the guidance of experienced researchers, post-docs, and professionals in the field. Grateful for the help that I receive from them to this very day, I am confident that my developing lab skills and interest in my work will contribute to the success of this project. In addition, working on this project will greatly help me learn and acquire the laboratory techniques and skills for future research down the road. All in all, this experiment is innovative and worthwhile; it will benefit the lives of many people in the world.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks involved in conducting scientific experiments never previously done. That being said, I have already contributed to a similar experiment installing fluorescence genes on the cystic fibrosis transmembrane regulator (CFTR) gene, a project that has already been met with great success. This project would employ similar techniques as the CFTR gene modification project aforementioned, although it targets a different sequence of the genome as well as utilizes a greater variety of reporter systems to use. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to donate? You can still help this fundraiser immensely by getting the word out to friends, family, and coworkers who might be interested in this project. Making sure that everyone knows about this project is a necessary and greatly appreciated part, integral to the success of this scientific work. Be sure to use the Indiegogo sharing tools to spread the word – thank you so much!

story:
We are excited to be featured on BackerClub.co this week! 
They are the top community for people who are very serious about crowdfunding sites and we are really looking forward to the feedback and support from their community of super-backers!

 

 

THE ARCTIC TUBE INTRO

    Arctic Tube is a 28 oz. (828 ml) wearable, freezable, and formable water bottle. As the liquid melts in the tube, you are able to drink from it like any other bottle. The Arctic Tube provides you with a variety of  drinking options of your choice, and remember  it's also freezable! (mmm, slushy), a cold pack on a hot day (reduced heat exhaustion), an ice pack to heal an injury or headache (physiotherapy in a bottle), and even a wearable cooling agent to throw around your neck when outside on a hot day (simply refreshing). You can even toss it in your cooler and keep your food and drinks cold for hours!  Now we know you're interested.....

 

THE USES OF ARCTIC TUBE
The uses of Arctic Tube are almost endless. You can use it for all types of sports such as soccer, golf, football, tennis, basketball, rugby, hockey and the list goes on and on. Whether you're coming off the field or court for a break, all you have to do is put Arctic Tube around your neck and start to feel the cooling sensation.  If you have a neck injury or suffer with headaches, Arctic Tube provides the right icing temperature for hours and the ribbing on the tube gives you therapeutic pressure as well.  Now do you see why we think it's the Superhero of water bottles?!  Nothing ventured, nothing gained… so give it a shot and see how Arctic Tube can enhance your life, your family's life, your team, your clients, or even your business exposure.

 

KEEP COOL WHILE CRUISIN' ON YOUR MOTORCYCLE

 

RIDING YOUR BIKE

 

 
ON THE GOLF COURSE

 

 
EVEN YOUR PETS WILL LOVE IT!

 

 

THE BENEFITS OF THE ARCTIC TUBE

  We have put a lot of time and energy into the design of the Arctic Tube.  Fit, comfort and practicality were the focus for our product.  Delivering a high quality standard with functionality and durability has been most important to us.  After several prototype concepts and designs, we have finally created the one that is ready to be rolled into production! 

Here are some fantastic features of Arctic Tube:

  • Hydrates like a water bottle
  • Comfort Form Fit™ with adjustable strap
  • Can be frozen and thawed repeatedly like a super ice pack
  • Designed to be worn around your neck or other body parts
  • Made in Canada
  • BPA-free and non toxic
  • Capacity is about 28 oz or 828 ml
  • Dishwasher safe (top rack only)
  • Customizable sleeves using sublimation technology
  • Leak proof with protective cap

 

 

YOU CAN CUSTOMIZE YOUR BOTTLE !

 On our website we have about 30 different types of  sleeve variations you can choose from but plan on adding a lot more in the very near future. For a small fee of $20 we can set you up with you own design or business logo.  We also use sublimation printing technology (making ink into a gas form and injecting it into the material) which won't fade, crack or peel.   

 

CREATE YOUR OWN DESIGN OR BUSINESS LOGO

 

 

MANUFACTURING 

 We are proud to have Arctic Tube made in Canada! (Kelowna, British Columbia) This allows us to have much more control over production and shipping since there are only 3 hours between our two cities. We also have a much quicker turnaround time, which allows us to deliver our product to you much faster!  Our molds are ordered , this is our final step , we just need to know how many you want to order!

MANUFACTURED, ASSEMBLED AND PACKAGED IN CANADA

 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Manufacturing and shipping are usually the biggest hurdles for a small company to cope with, especially in the beginning stages. This is one of the main reasons we decided to manufacture right here in Canada, even to the point of driving distance from our office! Keeping the manufacturing close to home allows us to have better control over consistency of quality and shipping. In the early stages of Arctic Tube, we strategized with our production team to make sure we are prepared in every way before we bring it to market. Everything is ready to go!

     We're launching our crowdfunding campaign from a unique position.  Our molds have been ordered and will be ready for production for the end of June.   We will be activating final production in early July and be shipping Arctic Tube to you the same month!  We want to offer the Indiegogo community the opportunity to be first to buy Arctic Tube AND with discounted pricing!

SHIPPING

  Yes we can ship to you anywhere in the world!   Shipping costs will be automatically added after you select the campaign of your choice. Shipping will vary depending where you live, but we tried to make it as easy as possible for pricing , all shipping quotes are in USD. Taxes and duties may be added depending on where on the globe you live (buyer cost).

 

SHARE US WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Legal

 The Arctic Tube is Patent Pending, all Canada, USA and International rights protected.

story:
I’m Graham King, founder or Urban Athletic Club, and since 2000 I've been involved in the DC health and fitness industry from my roots as a personal trainer at a local health club to opening gyms and CrossFit boxes. Over the years, I have advocated for both fitness professionals and local fitness issues. As a fitness entrepreneur, I seek opportunities that bring smart fitness to a wide-range of clients while working with great people.

 

Enter Urban Athletic Club Shaw

Two years ago, I met with several other local fitness professionals to create a gym unlike any in DC. Our concept gym would have two elements:

  1. The look and feel of a pro-level strength and conditioning facility.
  2. Operate as a shared-space, co-working concept like WeWork.  

Along with Jay Morgan (creator of Born to be Fit and winner of DC's Best Personal Trainer), Glenn Seth (founder of F3 Training and Bodywork), and a strategic partnership with Composition ID, we worked with local architect Nahra Design Group to create this concept. 

Together, we've designed a high-end athletic-training facility with space for Speed-Agility-Quickness training, Olympic Lifting, Bodyweight-Gymnastic movements, and a private room for small group and personal training. We believe that the space will motivate clients the instant they walk in.

Through your help, upon opening, Jay, Glenn, and I will coach classes, train clients, and help grow our business.

 

 

Our Campaign: Why it's important

We’re launching this campaign to complete both our build-out and the purchase of equipment to outfit the space. We believe strongly that our unique gym design combined with creating a shared-space for trainers will help shape gyms in the future,

We have 2 objectives at UAC:

  1. Provide a truly unique and inspiring athletic training space for clients of all ages and abilities. Inspiration comes from our signature red 50' turf runway with agility ladders, sleds, and plyo boxes; the Olympic lifting area with barbells, bumper plates, and custom built-in platforms; the private training area with a 20’ glass garage door entrance; the sleek, bright locker rooms. 
  2. Provide clients the best personal trainers and group coaches from which to choose.  We achieve this by creating the environment and culture that attracts professional trainers to grow their business within UAC while fostering creativity, sharing, professionalism, and entrepreneurship. 

 

What you will help us achieve

By supporting Urban Athletic Club Shaw you support the health and wellness of our community. While we are a business seeking customers and growth, all of us here at UAC have a strong desire to help those who may lack the financially ability to be regular customers. We also have carved out time where local kids can get instruction from UAC trainers to learn how to be more athletic and fit. 

As for the fitness professional, our space and business practices will provide them the opportunity to fulfill their life's work. Within our space , trainers can create financial stability in what is typically an unstable profession. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're seeking $50,000 to finish the build-out and purchase equipment.

At this point, through contributions from founding owners, angel investors, and landlord assistance, we’ve raised nearly 90% of the capital required to open. We chose to pursue the Indiegogo route as it provides the framework for our community of followers, friends, and family to support us. 

GO USA! As far as equipment purchasing goes, almost all of it is manufactured in the US. Both our architect and general contractor are local companies. 

We’re offering some great ways to contribute, from tee shirts and hoodies...all the way to a year-long, custom workout, data, and nutrition plan. 

For those who are considering becoming members, your contribution options include  3, 6, and 12 month memberships, each with at least one DEXA Body Composition scan. 

For clients who wish to train with us, we offer a comprehensive class called Urban Athlete. Unlimited membership starts at $298/month. We're offering special rates for those who support us through Indiegogo. 

If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll delay certain equipment purchases, but we will still open!

 

The Impact

All of us at UAC Shaw believe strongly that the fitness industry plays a vital role in the health and wellness of the communities in which they operate. From offering free community classes to small talk in coffee shops, Personal Trainers and Group Coaches are constantly promoting health and fitness amongst their contacts. We educate people how to move, lift, and run properly; we motivate and encourage clients when life and work gets in their way of health and fitness. When you help us, you help make everyone healthier. 

 

Track Record

All of the partners have extensive experience in the fitness world, together totaling 40+ years of industry experience. We've also been involved in the Washington, DC community, from starting non-profits, coaching youth teams, and volunteering countless hours of time to local organizations.  

 

Risks & Challenges

We understand the risk of starting a new concept and business. However, because all of us currently have paying clients and followers, we're able to open Day 1 with revenue. We recognize potential challenges such as finding strong support staff to allow the business to run smoothly. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We're thankful for all contributions. If you're not able to contribute now, please help us by spreading the word amongst your friends and followers! 

Thanks and see you in the gym.

-Graham King and the UAC Team

The look and feel of a pro-level strength and conditioning facility.

story:
Nada Bottle

An Original Design

Nada Bottle is a lightweight, packable, & durable hydration answer for the modern day explorer.

Nada Bottle is an original water bottle solution, born in Crested Butte, Colorado. This innovative bottle has been engineered with a CORDURA® nylon outer shell, a BPA-free plastic lining, and a braided paracord carrying strap connected to the cap. Nada Bottle's innovative, collapsible design makes this tough, customizable bottle the only bottle you will ever need. The cap opening is large enough for ice, but small enough to avoid that pesky wet t-shirt look. The braided paracord, connecting the cap to the stainless-steel grommet, can easily be unattached and unraveled creating a short rope. Military grade paracord has a variety of life-saving uses when adventuring. 

By ordering a Nada Bottle today you’re helping us get our feet on the ground. We need to get our inventory moving and expand our brand! Our minimum goal of $20,000 will fund future water donations, marketing, and additional color & size options. We would really love your help getting our name out there. With your support we can help a highly durable, reusable water bottle reach its potential and continue sending clean water to communities in need! 

The truth about BPA

Most hydration product lines claim to be BPA-free. What they've neglected to inform consumers is that what they've substituted for BPA, most likely BPS, can be just as dangerous.

Plastic alternatives, primarily silicone and metal, have some equally negative side-effects. While silicone has proven to be a steady contender, the complaints I've found on the foul taste it gives your water were enough for me to steer clear. The majority of the research I've found on metal water bottles indicated that various chemicals inevitably leech into you water over-time, making this alternative just as dangerous as plastic. Additionally, I've never seen a metal bottle, stainless steel or otherwise, collapse into your pocket. The only bottle that can truly be free of BPA, BPS, BPF, etc. is a BPA-free glass, but then we're faced with the problem of catering to a more active clientele; a broken glass bottle can be a hassle at best, and dangerous at worst. Bottom line: glass breaks.

After years of diligent research, we found that a BPA-free plastic bottle with a protective shield may very well be the best alternative. Due to Nada Bottle's military grade CORDURA® nylon exterior, your Nada Bottle can be left in the sun, washed in the dishwasher, thrown down a mountain and still be chemical free!      

Our mission to Locate Life

After experiencing first-hand the lack of clean water, Nada Bottle made it a priority to provide water filters to those in need. For every Nada Bottle sold, one person in an impoverished community will be provided with safe drinking water. This will be accomplished by allocating a portion of the funds from Nada Bottle sales to the construction of wells and distribution of Sawyer Water Filters around the world. Every Nada Bottle customer will receive an authentic link between the product they purchased and the location of the safe water they donated. Once you receive you water bottle, simply type the coordinates located on the packaging into our Locate Life page at https://www.nadabottle.com/locate-life/ see where your clean water donation went! 

Let's talk about waste...

-Making bottles to meet America’s demand for bottled water uses more than 17 million barrels of oil annually, enough to fuel 1.3 million cars for a year. 

-The energy we waste using bottled water would be enough to power 190,000 homes. 

-Last year, the average American used 167 disposable water bottles, but only recycled 38.

-Americans used about 50 billion plastic water bottles last year. However, the U.S.’s recycling rate for plastic is only 23 percent, which means 38 billion water bottles – more than $1 billion worth of plastic – are wasted each year. 

-The recommended eight glasses of water a day, at U.S. tap rates equals about $.49 per year; that same amount of bottled water is about $1,400. 

-Antimony, which is found in PET plastic bottles, in small doses can cause dizziness and depression; in larger doses it can cause nausea, vomiting and death.

Source: https://www.banthebottle.net/bottled-water-facts/ 

Customizability

One of our favorite things about Nada Bottle is how customizable it is. Anything from a photograph of your dog to a business logo is be transferred to your bottle for an additional fee.

Due to our current budget, we are only offering custom screen-printing in bulk, but we hope to offer more variety in the future!!

Story

The concept of Nada Bottle came about when a biking enthusiast, an eco-minded backpacker, and a motivated realist came together in the heart of the Rocky Mountains. The first prototype was engineered in an old Crested Butte kitchen using a nylon sheet, super glue, and an iron. The desire for a collapsible water bottle, or a container that was "not a bottle", was devised after many trips abroad allowing for just one backpack and numerous trips into the wilderness with just enough space for a small water bottle and a filter. After going through numerous unreliable plastic water bottles, Nada Bottle became a reality.

About The Owner

Taryn Jacob is an entrepreneur with a cause. She and friends started their business, Nada Bottle, to raise money to bring clean water to people in need. She’s doing that by giving travelers and outdoorspeople an innovative collapsible container to carry water on their ventures.

Taryn, now 27, has itched to travel since she was a Kansas youngster with a huge map of Africa on her wall. So she used her jobs to see the world: via plane as a flight attendant, and by train as a backstage technician for the Ringling Brothers circus. She learned to travel on her own “on the smallest budget possible,” sometimes backpacking internationally for three months at a time. Almost everywhere, she found clean water was an issue. “One of the leading causes of death in the world is bad water,” she said.

Years later in Crested Butte, after her dog had chewed up a fourth Platypus water bottle, she and her boyfriend, engineer Andrew McKee, started imagining the next generation of collapsible water containers. Andrew began working on designs and materials. After some kitchen experiments with nylon sheets and an iron, they came up with a tough (dog-resistant), lightweight prototype. Andrew honed in on a military-grade Cordura nylon exterior and a lid attached by a “survival strap” — a paracord (used in parachuting) that can be unraveled to a long, multi-purpose cord. The nylon cover protects the BPA-free plastic liner from damage by the sun. The nylon also works well for screen-printing designs, team mascots and logos.

Focused on the global need for clean water, Taryn insisted that Nada Bottle be “more of a social mission.” The company committed that for each water bottle sold, it would donate a water filter to a disadvantaged community.

With a product and a mission, the friends tackled fundraising, outreach and preliminary manufacturing research. Via Kickstarter they raised $30,000 and got orders for 1500 water bottles. But the next hurdle loomed huge.

“We were so naïve about the manufacturing,” Taryn said. The type of nylon they wanted wasn’t being made or sewn in the U.S., so they resorted to a Chinese manufacturer. Next they discovered the minimum order for the product they wanted was a whopping 16,000 bottles, which required renewed fundraising and additional debt. Then came communication issues, hassles and delays.

Focused on the global need for clean water, Taryn insisted that Nada Bottle be “more of a social mission.” The company committed that for each water bottle sold, it would donate a water filter to a disadvantaged community.

Even with frustrations and delays in getting a marketable product, Taryn has ambitions for Nada Bottle. Within a few years she hopes the business will be large and solid enough to diversify its containers, offering various designs, sizes and features like water filter attachments. “We’re still in the seed stage, but we’re about to take off,” she said.

It’s been a long path from studying the map of Africa on her wall as a child to knowing she’s helping some people there drink safe, healthy water.

“To keep going, I have to remember why I’m doing this: for clean water,” Taryn said. “To accomplish that, I have to have a good product and a successful business.”

Seasonal Use

Summer

Use Nada Bottle when mountain biking, hiking or climbing. The abrasion resistant nylon material won’t puncture or crack like other plastic water bottles on the market today, and Nada Bottle's grommet is the perfect size for most carabineers to easily latch through.

Winter

Skiing? Ice climbing? Maybe just going out for a winter walk? Nada Bottle's smooth, nylon material makes it easy and comfortable to slide under your coat or down jacket. Your body temperature will keep your bottle from freezing when experiencing cold conditions. When the bottle is empty, simply roll it up and keep it close for later.

Everyday Use

Don't be brought down by bulk. Nada Bottle fits perfectly in your pocket, purse, or briefcase and you can fill it up when you reach your destination. Customize your bottle for a sleek, unique design to show off to friends, co-workers, and family.

Cleaning

Nada Bottle's inner plastic bag is easily removed and dishwasher safe! We do, however, recommend hand-washing the cap. 

Timeline

All of the orders, excluding custom orders, will ship in February! We have the inventory ready to go. Here at Nada Bottle we want to spend 2017 getting our feet on the ground. Fine-tuning our design, producing additional sizes & colors, and donating more water! We already have the inventory, now we just need to sell it and make a name for ourselves!

Contact

At Nada Bottle we promise to give you the highest possible customer service and satisfaction. Please contact us of any questions or comments you may have concerning our products, or our brand. We gladly accept complaints, and compliments via email. You are our top priority. Always feel free to contact nadawaterbottle@gmail.com

Warranty

Our simple warranty is a testament of our confidence in our product and commitment to quality. We strive to achieve the highest level of customer service. We offer a lifetime warranty for our bottles. However, we do recommend regular cleaning using our cleaning tablets and cleaning tool. Our warranty makes it clear that these bottles are made for water only, so putting wine in your Nada Bottle may not be a great idea. For more information contact our friendly customer representatives by filling out a warranty form:

https://www.nadabottle.com/warranty/

Shipping & Delivery

Water bottles are shipped in the USA as well as internationally with an additional shipping fee.

story:
What Inspired the product

As the mother of two little princesses who go to bed perfect and wake up with crazy bed heads, I developed this product initially to make my mornings a less stressful experience for all involved parties!

The Original Baby Brush makes the brushing and styling of this super fine hair possible.  It is for use between the stages of new born hair and the period when it starts to thicken into its more mature state (4 years old approx.).

The goal is to share this invention with parents the world over!

As contributors, you can help us make this possible.

 

It really works!

The removal of tats and tangles from a very small child’s hair can be particularly problematic for a parent who wants to cultivate a cute longer look for their baby.

Existing children’s hair brush designs are excessively coarse, causing discomfort to the child.

This new design features a combing system which is a major departure from this standard model.

A shorter more flexible bristle allows the brush to pass through the hair without scratching the scalp or pulling the hair when it catches a tangle.

The densely packed micro bristles have the ability to detangle this very delicate hair without coming into contact with the child’s scalp in a way that no brush currently on the market is capable of.

Why we need funding

The Original Baby Brush has been prototyped and tested successfully with many focus groups in the UK and Ireland but we need your help to allow full scale manufacturing and distribution to parents in need globally.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funds will go towards the tooling costs which will allow further runs to be exported so that we can get parents across the world excited by getting focus groups further afield involved in the process.

 

The Impact

Any pledge no matter how small will make a massive difference to this campaign!

 

RISK AND CHALLENGES

We've reached this stage after thorough research & development by a team of knowledge partners, polymer engineers and most importantly parents. Years of honing the idea has provided us with successful prototypes Which are ready for the next stage.


Manufacturing companies, which we feel confident will ensure a smooth and professional production process are poised and ready to begin. 

We've spared no effort to ensure we've covered every aspect of the production and delivery process however, despite the best planning, there may always be factors that we cannot control such as transport or supplier delays. 

We will make sure to keep you updated along our journey to deliver the best possible product quickly and make sure that early backers are given priority to receive The Original Baby Brush in time.

This new design features a combing system which is a major departure from this standard model.
A shorter more flexible bristle allows the brush to pass through the hair without scratching the scalp or pulling the hair when it catches a tangle.
The densely packed micro bristles have the ability to detangle this very delicate hair without coming into contact with the child’s scalp in a way that no brush currently on the market is capable of.

Why we need funding
The Original Baby Brush has been prototyped and tested successfully with many focus groups in the UK and Ireland but we need your help to allow full scale manufacturing and distribution to parents in need globally.
If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funds will go towards the tooling costs which will allow further runs to be exported so that we can get parents across the world excited by getting focus groups further afield involved in the process.

 
The Impact
Any pledge no matter how small will make a massive difference to this campaign!
 
RISK AND CHALLENGES
We've reached this stage after thorough research & development by a team of knowledge partners, polymer engineers and most importantly parents. Years of honing the idea has provided us with successful prototypes Which are ready for the next stage.
Manufacturing companies, which we feel confident will ensure a smooth and professional production process are poised and ready to begin. 
We've spared no effort to ensure we've covered every aspect of the production and delivery process however, despite the best planning, there may always be factors that we cannot control such as transport or supplier delays. 
We will make sure to keep you updated along our journey to deliver the best possible product quickly and make sure that early backers are given priority to receive The Original Baby Brush in time.

story:
NEPROFITNA ORGANIZACIJA - OSNIVAČ Poliklinike

Poliklinika za zaštitu djece i mladih nastala je idejom entuzijasta, volontera Psihorehabilitacijskog centra - neprofitne organizacije, čime se svrstava u redove socijalnog poduzetništva. Ova ideja okuplja stručnjake iz područja psihijatrije, psihologije, socijalnog i pedagoškog rada s višegodišnjim iskustvom u radu s djecom i mladima koji imaju različite poremećaje i poteškoće iz područja mentalnog zdravlja, a temelji se na kontinuiranom tretmanskom, psihoterapijskom i savjetodavnom radu. PSIHOREHABILITACIJSKI CENTAR OSIJEK stručnom podrškom do sada je obuhvatio 427 korisnika u svojim programima i aktivnostima. To je bio jedan od pokazatelja potrebe za polikliničkim ustrojem.

Kontekst PROBLEMA i RAZLOZI za osnivanje ustanove

Zbog evidentnog porasta broja prijavljene zlostavljane ili zanemarene djece u slavonskoj regiji, djece s poremećajima ponašanja i različitim psihičkim poteškoćama, koja često odrastaju u disfunkcionalnim obiteljima, prolaze brakorazvod roditelja i druge krizne situacije,  iznimno smo motivirani osigurati stručnu timsku uslugu na najvišoj razini. Slavonska regija, kao područje koje je bilo zahvaćeno ratom se i danas suočava s brojnim poslijeratnim teškoćama i posljedicama, a dodatno je opterećena  i teškom  gospodarskom situacijom u Hrvatskoj, što je rezultiralo egzistencijalnim krahom mnogih obitelji, čestom disfunkcionalnom obiteljskom okruženju i zabrinjavajuće velikom broju brakorazvoda. Ovakvo stanje snažno se reflektiralo na mentalno zdravlje i odrastanje djece i mladih u Slavoniji. Istodobno nedostaju stručne institucije koje objedinjuju različite pristupe i stručne poslove usmjerene zaštiti djece. Jasno je da kao udruga sve teže možemo pokriti stručnu skrb sve većeg broja korisnika. Stoga je osnivanje polikliničkog ustroja bio logičan slijed događaja u našem djelovanju.

ŠTO TREBAMO?

U ovoj fazi najviše nam je potrebna financijska podrška. Kao neprofitni sektor uspjeli smo osigurati i djelomično urediti prostore centra i poliklinike, no sada nam slijedi ono najvažnije; ZAPOŠLJAVANJE STRUČNJAKA kao i samo otvorenje Poliklinike.  Ovom kampanjom želimo osigurati stabilan početak i visoku razinu usluge za korisnike.

Ako ne prikupimo željena sredstva, svejedno IDEMO DALJE DO REALIZACIJE CILJA, ali nešto sporijim tempom. Stoga nam se pridružite i podržite nas na bilo koji Vama prihvatljiv način.

Na tom putu neka Vas - baš kao i NAS - vodi misao vodilja da su u pitanju djeca i mladi kojima je neophodna ovakva stručna pomoć i podrška.

Dobrodošla je i svaka javna podrška našoj misiji i viziji... ;-)

Naglašavamo još jednom kako se radi o kampanji socijalnog poduzetništva, a podrška ovoj kampanji doprinijet će bržoj realizaciji otvorenja poliklinike, zapošljavanju većeg broja stručnjaka i uspostavljanju multidisciplinarne usluge za djecu i mlade sa psihičkim poteškoćama i poremećajima na jednom mjestu. Sredstva iz kampanje osigurala bi nam stabilan početak rada. Vaša podrška izravno doprinosi i destigmatizaciji psihičkih poremećaja te odaje priznanje radu stručnjaka koji već niz godina nesebičnim volonterskim radom pružaju stručnu pomoć djeci i mladima, na promociji mentalnoga zdravlja, pravima i zaštiti djece.

UPOZNAJTE NAŠ VOLONTERSKI TIM/MEET OUR VOLUNTEER TEAM

Centar nema zaposlenih osoba i sve aktivnosti provode se uz potporu volonterskog angažmana stručnjaka i drugih profila volontera.
 
NAŠU KAMPANJU MOŽETE PODRŽATI NA DVA NAČINA:
 
1. FINANCIJSKI - uplatom donacije 
Sredstva možete uplatiti pritiskom na crveno polje "Back it" za bilo koji iznos ili odabirom perka.
2.PROMOTIVNO - dijeljenjem naših sadržaja i objavama kampanje
 
Please scroll down for the English version...                             
                                                                                                        

The idea for the opening of the Child and Youth Protection Polyclinic emerged from the continuous work of volunteers/professionals of the Psychorehabilitation Centre Osijek, a non-profit organisation specialised in preventing and treating mental health problems in children and youth.

The idea brought together experts from fields of psychiatry, psychology, social work, pedagogy, defectology , etc.

We operate in the Slavonia region, the area affected by poverty, low employment prospects, post-war problematics and heavy economic situation. There are many families which are dysfunctional and on the verge of existence. Consequently, there is a rise in the number of children and youth with mental health problems and problems connected to divorce, violence, and maltreatment.

We would like to emphasise that this is a social entrepreneurship campaign and that by supporting our idea, you will contribute to the opening of the Child and Youth Protection Polyclinic in Slavonia, the only institution in our area that will provide such a form of high-quality and continuous diagnostic and treatment of children with mental difficulties.

Psychorehabilitation centre does not have any employees, and all the activities are conducted through the engagement of its experts/volunteers. You will directly contribute by helping to diagnose and treat, but also to de-stigmatize mental health problems in children and youth.

YOU CAN SUPPORT OUR CAMPAIGN:

1.            BY DONATING – see our perks

2.           BY PROMOTING – sharing our campaign on social networks

HVALA VAM!                               THANK YOU!

   http://www.pcdm.hr/

story:
Baby Heads-up: Control infants' head deformity

Our son, Gabriel, has to wear this helmet, known as cranial orthosis for 5 months 23 hours a day to treat his head deformity. This was simply caused by his preference to sleep more on the left side during the 4th month. 

Most parents are not aware that in the first few months babies' head can become relatively quickly misshapen due to babies' sleeping positions. In majority of cases, parents or pediatricians don't notice mild skull deformities especially when it is covered by the hairs. 

A small degree of asymmetry can be quite normal but it could also turn into severe deformity after a couple of months going unnoticed which would require expensive and lengthy therapies. 

We are certain that in most of the cases this can be avoided and reversed by parents if they are aware of this issue and pay attention at an early stage. 

This has motivated us to create a solution together with pediatricians for all parents to regularly check the shape and normal growth of babies head and get it compared with the previous snapshots. Parents can act on the app measurements and warnings to refer to pediatrician or children physiotherapist for in-depth diagnosis, prevention and early treatment of deformational plagiocephaly in your newborn.

Plagiocephaly - misshapen head : Background Information

 

What is plagiocephaly?  

Plagiocephaly (Pronounced: /play-jee-oh-sef-uh-lee/) or Flat Head Syndrome (FHS) is the most common craniofacial problem today. Deformational plagiocephaly, also known as positional plagiocephaly, means a mis-shapen or uneven (asymmetrical) head shape. Plagiocephaly does not affect the development of a baby's brain, but if not treated it may change their physical appearance by causing uneven growth of their face and head. Jaw and ear alignment could be affected, leaving them unable to wear glasses or a bicycle helmet later in life. 80% of skull growth takes place in the first year of life and slows after the first 12 to 18 months. The skull fuses at around 18 to 24 months.

 

Signs and symptoms  

It is common for a newborn baby to have an unusually shaped head. This can be caused by the position of the baby in the uterus during pregnancy, or can happen during birth. Your baby's head should go back to a normal shape within about six weeks after birth. Sometimes a baby's head does not return to a normal shape and the baby may have developed a flattened spot at the back or side of the head. This condition is known as deformational plagiocephaly.

Causes  

The bones of a newborn baby's head are thin and flexible so the head is soft and may change shape easily. Flattening of the head in one area may happen if a baby lies with its head in the same position for a long time.

 

The increased incidence of plagiocephaly is largely due to the “Back to Sleep” campaign, designed to reduce the incidence of “cot death”. Since 1994, many paediatric associations have been recommending back sleeping positioning as a means of avoiding Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS).

 

Treatments

The most common forms of treatment are repositioning and helmet therapy.

Repositioning, also known as counter positioning, means changing or alternating the position of your baby’s head to allow an even weight distribution. This involves parents making sure their infant does not rest on the flat spot by alternating their baby's head position from the back to the sides. Increased tummy time and lying your baby on their side to play can also help. Repositioning is often effective during the first three to four months.

Sometimes when the uneven head shape is more severe or where counter positioning did not work, a cranial remodelling helmet (corrective helmets) may help. Helmets are lightweight and made of a thin hard shell with a foam lining for comfort. The helmet helps the skull re-shaping process by removing the pressure over the flat area and allowing the skull to grow into the space provided. Helmets work best between four and eight months of age.

The helmet must be worn for 23 hours a day and may come off for one hour (i.e. to wash your baby's hair). The helmet shape must be adjusted by the orthotist every one to two weeks and treatment usually takes between five to nine months. The helmet therapy costs around $4000.

 

Deliveries and Timelines 

Business Requirements and Functional Design Specification: Jan 2017 - Completed

App Functional Development for Android and ios: Feb 2017 - Ongoing

Image Filtering and Processing Functionalities: Mar 2017

Alpha Tests - Functionality and Sample data: April 2017

Release of SME Version of Baby Headsup for acquiring  infants' data as well as extra cranial measurements and processing them using Deep Learning methods: May 2017

Beta Tests - Real data validation and acquiring real patients data: May to December 2017

Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning Techniques: June to December 2017

Creating Awareness among local pediatrician, kids physiotherapists and children hospitals: Nov - Dec 2017

Official End User Version Release: Jan 2018

Adding other languages and more contacts: Feb 2018

 

Perks: 

No kids yet or no plans to have kids, no problem. We would still love to have your support and will send you a signed thank you from our team together with some Austrian specialty as indicated on the Perks Plan. 

 

The gift packs filled with genuine Salzburg Mozart balls and Mozart tales will delight your loved ones on every occasion. Every time you enjoy one of these, remember you also helped to control infants' head deformity.

Mirabell is one of the most traditional brands in Austria. The genuine Salzburger Mozartkugeln of Mirabell are still produced according to the origin and tradition in Mozart's homeland Salzburg (Grödig) - 14 work steps and a total of 2 ½ hours of production time are needed for each of these small works of art.  

The production time per Salzburg Mozarttaler covers 11 work steps and lasts about 1.5 hours.

Get the rare plant on your window sill. Just open the can and add water.Unusual gift from the Alps - Edelweiss in a can. The Edelweiss is one of the most famous and symbolic alpine flowers. Edelweiss is also in the logo of the Austrian Alpine Association and other alpine associations. 

The Edelweiss was also used for love charms and as a symbol for demonstration of love and bold daring. Occasionally, abnormally large flowering stars (6 to 12 centimeters in diameter) are found, which appear in the legendary world as "enchanting kings". In Austria the Edelweiß was already as of 1886 under nature protection.

Let yourself be seduced by the most famous Austrian confectionery specialty! Only the genuine tastes like this!  

 

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Q1: How much this app would eventually cost?
The Baby Headsup app remains always free for all the parents all the world.

Q2: Would the app work on my Android Mobile?
Yes, the app would become available for Blackberry, Android, iPad, iPhone and Windows Phones.

Q3: When will the app become available?
The official End-User Version is planned to be released January 2018, though all the backers will be given access to the SME (Subject Matter Expert) Version of Baby Headsup around May 2017. This comes with added functionalities for acquiring infants' data as well as extra craniometer measurements and processing them using Deep Learning methods.

Q4: Will my baby’s photos be transferred to a server for further processing?
No, the photos are users' private property and would not be transferred outside the smartphone. All the measurements to determine any type of deformity is done locally on your mobile device.

Q5: How would I know if I am taking the photos right?
The photos would follow the frames as displayed on the screen with a separate frame for each of the 6 photos from different angels. The images with shaken hand, unclear borders or the images with uneven borders like outstanding hairs would not be accepted or saved. If a photo does not meet the guidelines the user is asked to repeat it.

 

Risks and challenges

In order to validate the correct functionality of the app and raise the precision of the simulated measurements with regards to normal thresholds, extensive verification needs by done by using real data, involving around 1000 deformed and 1000 good cases examined using the craniometer measurement, an international medical standard of measurement used to determine the severity of flat head.

Finding these number of parents who would be willing to take part in this study and come every 2 weeks in the early months after the child's' birth for screening using the app together with craniometer measurement might be a challenge.

We have the support of several pediatricians and children physiotherapists who would participate to promote this valuable study and innovative preventative solution which should be reachable over 8 months allowing extensive data validation for calibrating and training the app.

 

~~~°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°~~~

Thousands of infants with head deformities have to go through expensive and lengthy therapies which is avoidable if noticed early on. 

We truly believe in early intervention in children with orthotic needs and we are passionate about building awareness among parents as well as pediatricians and providing them with an easy app solution to watch for deformities.

Every child deserves not having misshapen head.  

We want to see this benefit your family and families around the world.  

Please support our campaign and our mission. Thank you so much!

We would still love to have your support and will send you a signed thank you from our team together with some Austrian specialty as indicated on the Perks Plan.  The gift packs filled with genuine Salzburg Mozart balls and Mozart tales will delight your loved ones on every occasion. Every time you enjoy one of these, remember you also helped to control infants' head deformity.Mirabell is one of the most traditional brands in Austria. The genuine Salzburger Mozartkugeln of Mirabell are still produced according to the origin and tradition in Mozart's homeland Salzburg (Grödig) - 14 work steps and a total of 2 ½ hours of production time are needed for each of these small works of art.  The production time per Salzburg Mozarttaler covers 11 work steps and lasts about 1.5 hours.Get the rare plant on your window sill. Just open the can and add water.Unusual gift from the Alps - Edelweiss in a can. The Edelweiss is one of the most famous and symbolic alpine flowers. Edelweiss is also in the logo of the Austrian Alpine Association and other alpine associations. The Edelweiss was also used for love charms and as a symbol for demonstration of love and bold daring. Occasionally, abnormally large flowering stars (6 to 12 centimeters in diameter) are found, which appear in the legendary world as "enchanting kings". In Austria the Edelweiß was already as of 1886 under nature protection.Let yourself be seduced by the most famous Austrian confectionery specialty! Only the genuine tastes like this!   Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)Q1: How much this app would eventually cost?The Baby Headsup app remains always free for all the parents all the world.Q2: Would the app work on my Android Mobile?Yes, the app would become available for Blackberry, Android, iPad, iPhone and Windows Phones.Q3: When will the app become available?The official End-User Version is planned to be released January 2018, though all the backers will be given access to the SME (Subject Matter Expert) Version of Baby Headsup around May 2017. This comes with added functionalities for acquiring infants' data as well as extra craniometer measurements and processing them using Deep Learning methods.Q4: Will my baby’s photos be transferred to a server for further processing?No, the photos are users' private property and would not be transferred outside the smartphone. All the measurements to determine any type of deformity is done locally on your mobile device.Q5: How would I know if I am taking the photos right?The photos would follow the frames as displayed on the screen with a separate frame for each of the 6 photos from different angels. The images with shaken hand, unclear borders or the images with uneven borders like outstanding hairs would not be accepted or saved. If a photo does not meet the guidelines the user is asked to repeat it. Risks and challengesIn order to validate the correct functionality of the app and raise the precision of the simulated measurements with regards to normal thresholds, extensive verification needs by done by using real data, involving around 1000 deformed and 1000 good cases examined using the craniometer measurement, an international medical standard of measurement used to determine the severity of flat head.Finding these number of parents who would be willing to take part in this study and come every 2 weeks in the early months after the child's' birth for screening using the app together with craniometer measurement might be a challenge.We have the support of several pediatricians and children physiotherapists who would participate to promote this valuable study and innovative preventative solution which should be reachable over 8 months allowing extensive data validation for calibrating and training the app. ~~~°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°°~~~Thousands of infants with head deformities have to go through expensive and lengthy therapies which is avoidable if noticed early on. We truly believe in early intervention in children with orthotic needs and we are passionate about building awareness among parents as well as pediatricians and providing them with an easy app solution to watch for deformities.Every child deserves not having misshapen head.  We want to see this benefit your family and families around the world.  Please support our campaign and our mission. Thank you so much!

story:
Who are we?

Powerhouse Juice is small batch, cold pressed juice company. It is owned and operated by husband and wife duo Heather and Robert DeBerio.    We have sold our juice in over 18 farmers markets around Massachusetts. Our Juice has been featured in Boston Globe Magazine as having "The Best Green Juice." 

 

Why Cold Pressed Juice?

Cold pressed juice is the most beneficial juicing option available in today's market.  Raw juices have natural enzymes, vitamins and minerals that you cant get from whole or cooked fruits and vegetables.  Most people don't maintain a balanced diet, juicing is a great option as an alternative way to get your daily fruit and vegetable requirements.  Our juices pack a full 4-6lbs of fruits and vegetables in each bottle.  The amazing health benefits of juicing has been around for centuries, the ancient Greeks were juicing pomegranates for the many nutritional benefits it provides them.

Why Should you Give?

Pledges to this campaign will help us bring our small family business to the next level.  We work hard to make fresh pressed juice every morning and we want to be able to expand and utilize our time and efforts in the most productive ways possible.  Growing our production space, making more juices daily, offering juice in a wider variety of towns and venues will help us reach more consumers

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $12,000  to help cover plumbing costs, pathogen and shelf life studies, Indiegogo fees, labels, packaging, and permitting at wholesale level.

Plumbing $5,000- We moved into our new space in September and have yet to get the plumbing done due to unexpected costs.  The plumbing is estimated to cost $7,000, this includes running piping, digging up the concrete floors, pulling permits, and labor costs.   We have all the fixtures, such as: a three bay sink, walk in refrigeration and work tables, all ready to be installed.  Without the proper plumbing we will not be able to get the kitchen inspected by the health department. 

Pathogen and shelf life testing $3,500- We need to get our 4 main juices and 1 nut milk juice tested for pathogens, and bacteria which will determine the shelf life and expiration date of each juice.  These tests cost an average of $600-$800 each juice.

Indeigogo Fees $1,000- Indiegogo fees as well as credit card processing fees.

Labels and Packaging 1,500-  We only have 1 label that is used for all of our juices.  We will need to have a different label with ingredients and nutritional facts for each individual juice we produce.

Permittting and Becoming an LLC $1000- Right now Powerhouse Juice is a sole proprietor.  We want to protect ourselves and our business, becoming an LLC is the best way for us to do that.  We will also need Permits for wholesale.

What you get- We have amazing perks for all our backers such as, daily fresh pressed juices, t-shirts, 1 day cleanses, 3 day cleanses, 5 day cleanses, and catered breakfasts.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.

We have the most amazing customers and have produced more than 13,000 bottles of juice in the 1.5 years we have been in business.  We have been asked numerous times "Are you in stores?" and "Do you sell wholesale?" and our answer is always "We will be soon".  As a new company we have always invested all of our profits back into the business for necessities such as, a new commercial cold pressed juicer, refrigeration, tables, etc.  We have purchased all the big ticket items we need to push our production to double what we have been doing. 

I know we can do it!  With the support of our amazing customers, family, friends, and the people on indiegogo for believing in our dream .  Our dream is to do something bigger than we thought imaginable.  We tell our kids to work hard and pursue their dreams in life, we are trying to lead by example. We work hard everyday to produce the freshest, most nutritious juice on the market.  We strive to create the best products for our customers and hope that they can taste that.

Risks & Challenges

If We Can't Reach Our Goal

We are working with an amazing graphic designer right now to create new and improved labels. We are building our HAACP (Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points) plan as well as talking to plumbers and local businesses to get our juice in stores near you. 

If we do not reach our goal we will continue to move ahead with the plumbing first.  This is the most important thing for us to do right away.  We have been leasing our space for months, and have been unable to use it to produce our juice.  We are currently still renting our original space for producing juice in addition to the new space. We would love to be able to produce in our new space as soon as possible in order to stop paying rent on two spaces. The plumbing would give us the opportunity to get the kitchen inspected by our local health department, and give the opportunity to our customers to pick up their juice directly from our shop. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't still help us.  Promote our campaign by sharing it on Social Media, pass it along to friends, family, or anyone who can relate to the cause.

story:
Say goodbye to your old, bulky and bacteria-filled toothbrush holder. 

What makes the Cubecoid different from every other toothbrush holder in the market right now? 

Nano-Suction.

 

Do you travel a lot? 

If you hate putting your toothbrush in a ziplock bag or on the sink counter-top while travelling, the Cubecoid is perfect for you. The Cubecoid is both portable and functional. 

 
 


The Problem.

Most families store their toothbrushes in a single toothbrush holder or on a counter-top. According to an article on Huffington Post, bacteria can spread from one to the other if the heads are touching. This bacteria that can cause oral infections such as gingivitis as well as serious gum diseases.

The bottom of a traditional toothbrush holder is a playground for bacteria growth and nasty water buildup which is unattractive and unhygienic.

 

The Solution.

According to BreathMD, a good toothbrush holder is one that holds the toothbrush upright, has good ventilation, and is made so other toothbrushes do not touch each other as to prevent cross contamination.

Introducing The Cubecoid.

 

Cubecoid's Nano-Suction Strip.

The Cubecoid sticks to most flat and smooth non-porous surfaces such as mirrors, dry wall, tiles etc. and can be re-used over and over again without losing its grip!

 

Revolving view of the Cubecoid.

 

Cleaning is super easy.

 
The Cubecoid can be used over and over again. Simply use some tape or water to clean the Nano-Suction strip and it will work like new!
 
 

Will it fit?

The Cubecoid has a large enough opening to fit most large razors and toothbrushes. The opening is approximately 0.9 inches in length and width.

 

Rewards

Stretch Goals

Stretch goals are unlocked at $6,000!

Media Kit

 Please click on the following link to access our Media Kit: http://bit.ly/2aw1f3p

Contact Info

 Feel free to get in contact with us: info@cubecoid.com

FAQs

Why is funding in USD?

Given the current situation of the exchange rate, we are choosing to raise funds in USD mainly because our manufacturers invoice us in USD. 

Why isn't Canadian Shipping Free?

Those living in Canada know how expensive shipping is within Canada. Shipping in Canada can be almost three times as expensive as shipping to United States and Internationally and that is why we have to charge shipping within Canada.
