The Impact


Funds given to this project will go directly to finishing the construction of the sports field as well as providing equipment and coaching for the children. Please remember, even a couple dollars donated could help buy a brand new soccer ball for a child who rarely gets to have fun.
This project is both unique and powerful. Many of you are no doubt living in developed countries such as the United States in which we rarely see children on the streets. Therefore not much attention is brought to child poverty and homelessness. This project not only does this but gives a concrete solution to the problem. Additionally, by contributing, you could make a huge difference in a child's life. Maybe the money you provide helps a child take refuge in sports and exit the destructive cycle of poverty of his or her parents. Maybe your money will simply provide happiness to a child who desperately needs it. Any donation is appreciated.
Besides the help you are giving the children, knowing that you have improved the life in someone in need has a positive impact on you too. The motto of Manav Sadhna is "Love all, serve all." Don't view your donation as simply giving away charity but rather as an opportunity to make an impact on a community in need as well as yourself.


    

Other Ways You Can Help
If you do not wish to contribute funds to the project, please help by sharing this project with your friends and family and spreading the word. Even just telling one person about the sports field can have an impact. Also, please help support Manav Sadhna through a donation at a later time or just bringing attention to them and their other projects. Please find it in your heart to help improve the lives of underprivileged children in any way you can. “It's the action, not the fruit of the action, that's important. You have to do the right thing. It may not be in your power, may not be in your time, that there'll be any fruit. But that doesn't mean you stop doing the right thing. You may never know what results come from your action. But if you do nothing, there will be no result.” -Mahatma Gandhi

story:
Description:

My name is Iancu and I am ready to reach my goal in the first half of this year, which is to achieve a worldwide ITF ranking. I am currently ranked #46 in Canada (Men, Open rankings - http://tc.tournamentsoftware.com/ranking/category.aspx?rid=127&category=1262&C1262FOG=&p=2&ps=25) and #29 in Canada for double rankings (http://tc.tournamentsoftware.com/ranking/category.aspx?rid=127&category=1264&C1264FOG=&p=2&ps=25). Last year I participated to many Canadian ITF tournaments and I got in the main draw a few times - passing all the 3 qualifiers.  I am only one WIN away from getting a world ranking to start my professional career. Once I win a game in the main draw for singles I would get world ranking. You can see my stats here (http://www.tennislive.net/atp/iancu-lustinian-ghinda/)

To make my goal a reality, I will travel to Europe to play between 10-15 international tournaments over a span of 4 months.

I already purchased the plane tickets, which cost about $1500. I would need your help to raise funding to cover for this cost as well as accommodations and equipment (about $1000 per month). Many thanks for your support!

Note: This campaign is run by Iancu's sister and tennis coach, Inia. Below you will find more information about Iancu's track record and story.

 

History

Iancu,  19 yrs-old,  is ready to take up the challenge of his life: play professional.

His story starts in 2003 when Mr. Ovidiu Constantin  Popovici, Romanian Davis Cup  player, and former doubles-partner of Romanian star Ilie Nastase (# 1 ATP 1973 - 1974) , discovers Iancu, who than 7 yrs of age was watching Popovici coach from outside the fence and the coach invited him in. When hitting with excellent technique for the first time Iancu took the raquet in his hand, Popovici was impressed and told our parents that Iancu has to play tennis, as he has a particular talent for the sport. Several months later Iancu's family moved to Canada.
Iancu had to start at 0, with no money and  not knowing how he can train for tennis in Canada. Without possibility to pay for tennis racquets and lessons Iancu knew that the only way for him of having any chance to play his sport was to fight harder than the rest. He did it, since the age of 7, when he was playing with old second-hand tennis racquets, and was training with his brothers and sisters, not having money to pay for private lessons­. He would go for 6-7 hours training a day regardless of the conditions of the racquets, balls, weather or fatigue.
At age 12, when he won the Quebec Championships he started to get sponsorship with Wilson for the racquets.  He was named “Torpedo” by national coaches, because he was known for his capacity  to reverse and win matches in which he was down 0-5. Finishing 3rd in Canada in 16 yrs and younger, Iancu continued his training, and now at age 19 is ready to play at the international professional level. He won the Roman Cup at 12, 14 , 16 and 18 yrs old, and he won almost all the Open tournaments in  Ottawa. Last year he participated to 8 ITF tournaments in Canada and won the first round for doubles in Winnipeg. In singles he got in the main draw on 18.08.14 at the Canada F8.

Ready to play professional, Iancu works ha­rd everyday on the court and outside the court. He trains intensively  at Ottawa Atheltic Club in Ottawa, ­and is motivated to enter the international elite. He has 38 days left for his dream to become reality: the moment he has been waited for so long, to play against the best players around the world and get his ranking.

Be part of Iancu’s journey, and help him make it reality!

What We Need & What You Get

This journey has been planned to have 12 international ITF  tournaments in 3 countries. 5000$ is the amount needed for travel and housing in this journey for international tennis ranking.  

The Impact
My goal is to demonstrate to young athletes that it is possible if you really want something you can achieve it. If Iancu makes it professional it would be thanks to you, who help him at this important stage, when all the work has been done and the motivation is there, the last piece of the puzzle left being the ranking.
There are a few perks available. After the tour, Iancu will do his best to post pictures and videos with the experience  to be made available to the contributors. Upon request, contributors over $100 may play a demonstrative game with Iancu in Ottawa in summer of 2015.

story:
The Tanzania Project

Engineers Without Borders USA supports community-driven development programs worldwide by collaborating with local partners to design and implement sustainable engineering projects. Here at the Santa Barbara Ventura Professional Chapter of Engineers Without Borders, we've found an opportunity to serve a community of Maasai in Tanzania - and we need your help. 

The Maasai 

The Maasai are an ethnic community native to southern Kenya and northern Tanzania.  The village of Elerai-Olmoti in Tanzania is home to 600 Maasai and the nearest source of clean water was historically 6-10 miles away until recently whena  new access point was added just 3 miles away.   The women of the village, some of them nearly 70 years old, walk this distance to the closest water source and carry over 40 pounds of water on their back.  These constant trips cause neck and back issues and diminishes the productivity of the women in their home.  In addition, children in the community are susceptible to illness by drinking water from nearby open pit wells and by decreased hygiene from lack of sufficient water.  

The Solution 

The Magadini Makiwaru Water Supply (MMWS) is a Tanzanian NGO that manages a reliable water source in the adjacent Hai District.  MMWS was founded by the German government and therefore adheres to strict standards of water quality and construction. The MMWS continues to function as originally founded and is maintained by professionally trained staff of technicians and engineers.  
To bring clean water directly to the 600 Maasai of Elerai-Olmoti, the engineers from EWB SBV have designed a 3 mile pipeline to convey clean water to the Maasai.  The pipeline will include six public taps and three storage tanks.  The pipeline will provide 26 liters per person per day of clean, reliable water to each Maasai. We have traveled to Tanzania to establish a trusting relationship with the Maasai and their leaders.  We have identified the most practical path for the pipeline and we have obtained formal consent from the Maasai to build the pipeline.  The Maasai villagers also donated over $1,500 USD in cash, cows, and goats to the project!  They told us that they are "eager" to begin the project immediately.  Once the pipeline is constructed, the new pipeline and storage tanks will be maintained by the highly trained MMWS staff and community members. 
We now need your help to build the pipeline, tanks, and taps.  

How You Can Help

The cost to build and install the water pipeline and storage system is around $1.50 per foot of pipe, so we need $20,000 to complete our task.  Through our social media outlets (www.facebook.com/ewbsbvchapter), we will provide constant updates on our progress.

Our engineers have provided the professional expertise, and our volunteers will travel to Tanzania in May and June of 2015 to assist in the construction of the pipeline, tanks and taps.  All donations are first and foremost used to cover the costs of the materials - concrete, piping, rebar, tools, etc.  Any remaining funds will be used to help our engineers cover their travel costs. 

Since EWB-USA is a 501 (c)(3) organization, your donation is tax-deductible.  You will receive a donation slip via email within a week after you donate. 

For more information on Engineers Without Borders USA organization and our Santa Barbara Ventura Professional Chapter, visit us at:

www.ewb-sbv.org

www.facebook.com/ewbsbvchapter

twitter @ewbsbv 

instagram @ewbsbv

story:
Trying To Survive the Journey of :

Multiple Myeloma

 My name is Marian Palucci, I'm 60 years old and I have  Multiple Myeloma. Writing about myself is a first for me. With the collected funds, I plan on paying my doctors, who keep me alive, and trying to fix my old car so I can get to the doctor's. 

What is Multiple Myeloma?

  According to the NIH,  multiple myeloma is a condition that is a type of blood cancer, which does not have a cure. It begins in the bone marrow and spreads.

 NO CURE?

 There is NO CURE at this time for this disease, some drugs are being studied to see if they can slow down or prevent disease progression.

I found myself fighting an uphill battle against a disease without a cure and with little money for basic necessities and none left over for basic healthcare. I applied for disability and received a minimal amount, which is, below poverty standards , along with partial medicare coverage. Now, if you want to eat, have a car and live on your own, YOU CAN'T. Very little money is left to truly exist. This, is why I'm on here...The medical bills continue to mount, and more medicine and treatment... until a cure is found.

There is always HOPE, we must believe and ask many questions and become knowledgeable about the disease. 

There are days when this disease becomes harder because of neuropathy in my legs and sheer fatigue. I, also, have a severely compromised immune system, I need to stay away from just about everything...so it's like living in a bubble.

My faith in God keeps me going. The transformation of my life with this disease has made me more positive than ever, as well as, truly humbling me. I may not be in charge of this disease's path, but my attitude can change many things. Any help will be greatly appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Kinetic Precision is a company that specializes in performance training. In short, we provide an athlete development program that makes major strides in a athlete's strength, speed, agility and conditioning.  We cater to youth, high school and professional athletes in the Southern California area. We are providing a series of free camps to high school and college athletes in the area, giving them the experience of a professional performance enhancement training program. All athletes from all sports are welcome. These camps will show athletes how to train and prepare their body to perform at its best. 

Having gone through high school athletics programs ourselves we understand how athletes may sometimes have the drive to get better but not always the "know-how". Sometimes the coach isn't equipped with the knowledge to be able to construct such a strength and conditioning program for them. We are looking to give every athlete the opportunity to be the best that they can be. 

Our coaches have the education and experience needed to prove up to date information on performance training. They will learn proper workout structure, injury prevention routines, and nutritional guidance. These are things that most athletes don't typically hear about until college. We plan on exposing our young athletes to a high level, high class and high caliber style of training in order to give them a head start in their athletic careers. We build strong men and women and lead by example in our expectations. 


What We Need

In order to make this happen we need to hit our landmark of $10,000. 

We are putting on a series of FREE strength and conditioning camps for High School and College athletes in the greater Los Angeles area. Your help today goes towards covering costs of:

- Field Reservation
- Camp Insurance
- Camp Equipment
- Camps Sports Drinks 
- Camp Apparel 
- Coaching Gear
- Camp Marketing and Promotion

Your donation gives two young men the kick start they need to achieve they're dreams! Our founders, Junior Amazan and Anthony Pines have worked diligently on the design of a strong training philosophy. One that makes the athlete stronger and allows them to work longer. Their combined vision is to build a place for all athletes in Southern California to call home. 

If our full goal is not met, we will put the funds towards camp needs and continue to fundraise and gain support. 


The Impact

Not all athletes will play professional sports but if you ask anyone who ever has, they will tell you that the principles and discipline that you gain playing a sport carries on throughout your entire life. We want to give every athlete the feeling and experience of going though a professional system of training that is used at the Olympic and professional levels of all sports. By educating our athletes now we prepare them for the future. 

Our coaches have coached wrestling, lacrosse, track & field, and football teams in the greater LA area and on the east coast. They have had great performance results with all athletes by building a culture of accountability. By uniting these athletes we can create a community bond between them that will help them build motivation and drive.

Challenges

Our situation is timeline sensitive. We need to have a deposit for our field space reservation ASAP (first come first serve). We also need to get this camp insured before we operate. The problem is that running a free camp isn't "free". Hitting our goal would solve all our problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate to our cause today you can still help! Make some noise and spread the word! Send this link to friends/family/co-workers/etc. Help us achieve a dream! Use the share tools to help share this link on social media.

story:
Natural Message: A private, anonymous email replacement

Natural Message is an easy-to-use, encrypted email system that allows you to send messages over two "transports:" old-school email (SMTP) or the more anonymous Natural Message transport.

This was our first campaign (February, 2015), which is now over--we might have a similar campaign in the future, so check http://naturalmessage.com for the latest information.  After we started the campaign, it became clear that that people wanted to see the system in action before committing to the project, so we focussed on preparing the Mac OS X client and a simple client that can run on Windows and UNIX-like systems.  Right now (March, 2015) the simple client is a command-line client, but a future version will have a GUI interface.  We are starting to upload to github and will start testing the Mac OS X full client and the simple client soon.

You can review our original Indiegogo page here to get an idea of what we are doing.

"Old school" email compared to Natural Message

Natural Message: Details

You can verify that third parties are not reading your messages because the actual content of your message is stored on independently operated servers that will delete the messages as soon as they are read (burn-on-read).  You can send test messages, and if the messages are burned before you read them, you know that your line is being tapped.  If you use the optional shared secret, no server will have the information to reassemble your message.

You will be able to send secure messages to your existing email contacts without asking them to sign up for a new account and without establishing a shared secret (recipients will be able to use the free, simple client to read or write messages on Mac OS X, Windows, Linux, and maybe more).  You can enjoy greater anonymity (and privacy of your social network) by sending messages over the Natural Message network.

The client application helps you to do the right thing and avoid security mistakes.

Natural Message does not have the single-point-of-failure flaw like the so-called “secure” systems that run java script in your browser.

The client program splits your encrypted message into pieces (shards) and stores them on a distributed network with the keys held by independent custodians.  When using the Natural Message client, the thing that is "mailed" is small file (the shared metadata file) that allows the recipient to reassemble the message. When using the old-school email transport, the thing that is "mailed" is an encoded link to the the shard metadata--click the link to open the reader.  With either transport, the person or business that handles the message does not have possession or control over the shards (and can not legally retrieve them).

If you use the old-school email transport, email providers like Google, Yahoo, and GMX will not know where your message is located or how big it is (all they have is a specially-encoded link and a legal notice saying that the content is private).

You can use an optional shared secret, in which case everything is encrypted again, and the shard metadata is encrypted so that the Natural Message directory server (the main server) will not know where your message is located (because the list of URLs that point to shards is encrypted with the shared secret that is known only by the sender and recipient). 

When you use the Natural Message transport, the system does not track IP, location (GPS), time sent, or user information--not even a user nickname.

Spam will be relegated to the history books.

Natural Message is as easy to use as an old-school email client other than the long addresses and once-per-year housekeeping.

We have a working server and a working client that need tuning.

Project Goals

Our first goal is to tune the existing server software and release it under a GNU public license, then release the Mac OS X client (requires the latest OS X release) with a GNU public licensed library. If we meet that goal during this campaign, then our next “stretch goal” would be to release a simple client for Windows and Linux (open source running in Python 3 with a simple GUI and basic features along with a command line version for programmers). This campaign is the first step toward implementing full-functionality clients for all the major platforms.

Here is a table that illustrates our goal and stretch goals if we exceed our fundraising goals in this campaign.

Notes:

  1. Deploy servers worldwide to achieve security objectives and allow for public testing and evaluation.
  2. Release server endpoint API’s, data structures & security methods into public knowledge for evaluation by security/software development experts.
  3. Deploy a modern Apple Mac client beyond the proof of concept along with the first version of the Objective-C open source library. This same API may also allow development of iOS based clients.
  4. A client with simple GUI (Python) for Windows & Linux plus a command line version for programmers. While it will take us a while to deliver on this, getting to this level enables major desktop platforms.
  5. Deploy Apple iPhone/iPod mobile client with a refined Objective-C open source library which contains any iPhone/iPod dependencies.
  6. Deploy an Apple iPad mobile client with a completed Objective-C open source version 1.0 library containing any iPad dependencies.
  7. The apps built under 4-7 for Microsoft, Linux and Apple platforms will be more refined applications with better UI/UX. Security audit as well.
Our long-term roadmap includes releasing full functionality applications along with open source libraries that are tuned to run on other operating systems (Windows, Android, Linux, etc.), localizing applications to other languages, and developing a version that would meet the needs of large businesses. The enterprise version would add features that would be useful for businesses that want more control over in-house messaging or want to be able secure messages on their own servers even if the message is sent outside the firewall. This chart depicts that future roadmap.

You can verify that third parties are not reading your messages

Natural Message is a set of client software, server software, protocols, and procedures for sending verifiably private messages over one of two transports: old-school email (SMTP) or the more secure Natural Message transport. The majority of this page is about the fully secure system that operates over the the Natural Message transport layer, but users who want the increased convenience (and loss of anonymity) of old-school email can route encrypted messages over old-school email. If you use the old-school email transport, you will lack anonymity, meaning that the following things might be tracked: your real identity linked to an extended social network, your IP address, the time and location of the originating message, and perhaps more—plus you are rewarding those who have disregard for your privacy.

The essential feature of Natural Message is the distribution of encrypted shards (pieces) of your message with the keys to those shards protected with a second layer of encryption before they are sliced into pieces and stored in a network of shard servers that will be independently operated by known, trusted custodians of your messages. The shard servers hold pieces of your encrypted file that are stored under randomly generated, 128-bit names on servers that will be located around the world. The encrypted keys to unlock your message are sent directly from the client's computer to shard servers. All servers currently require TLS 1.2 security, and the shards are burn-on-read, meaning that when you read your messages, all traces of them are removed from the Internet.

Watch the video to get an idea of what happens in the background:


It would be exceedingly difficult for any hacker to find the pieces of your message (a brute force attack would require guessing approximately nine 128-bit shard IDs within 5 days). If you do not read an incoming message, it is expired and deleted in about 5-6 days. Advertisers can't read your messages, server operators can't read your messages, and governments can't read your messages. You can send test messages and verify that no shards are unexpectedly burned. If a shard is burned before you read it, then you would know that somebody, somehow has invaded your privacy.

When using the Natural Message transport, the system does not track IP, location (GPS), time sent, or user information.

Natural Message servers do not collect or save information about users, and no single computer has information about the contents of your original message, so the contents of your messages are not tracked. The shard servers have no information about where the other shards are stored. Natural Message servers have no place to store your name, IP address, physical address, GPS coordinates, credit card information, or even a nickname.

If you purchase a subscription for our service after the Indiegogo campaign, it might be through the Apple App Store. The client application will confirm with Apple that your subscription is current but will not send any information to the Natural Message server about your identity or Apple account ID. The client application will send a generic code that indicates that your subscription is current without identifying who you are. We have other anonymous payment methods planned for the Simple Client (for those who want the ability to load large shards onto a fully supported network).

The client application helps you to do the right thing and avoid security mistakes.

One thing that the full functionality client application does for you is isolate your identities. You might have one identity that you use with your friends from work and one that you use for your political activism. The contact list and box ID (akin to an email address) for your work identity would be separate from the box ID and contact list for your school identity. You would not accidentally send your political essay to a person from work because your work contacts are not visible from your political identity. Also, the Natural Message servers would have no information in the database that would link the two identities (under a warrant, a server operator might be forced to trace your IP, so use the Natural Message Mix Network when it is ready [not a deliverable under this campaign, but on the drawing board and relatively easy to implement if people are willing to run the servers]).

Here is a screenshot of the OS X proof of concept application depicting identity isolation:


The client application allows you to associate nicknames with the box IDs in your contact list, but those nicknames are never sent to the server. When you generate a new box ID, the client application creates a random code for you so that you do not accidentally leak personal information in the box ID.

Messages will be automatically encrypted by the client computer, and the keys will be held by independent, trusted custodians.

Your message will be compressed and encrypted with an automatically generate one-time password which will then be encrypted by a second password, called a key encryption key. The first, encrypted password will be fragmented and distributed across burn-on-read servers operated by known, independent custodians who have made a commitment to privacy. The key encryption key goes to the Natural Message directory server (the main Natural Message server). If the user applies the optional shared secret, the shard metadata file is encrypted again so that the server operator can not read it (only sender and receiver will have the key to unlock everything).

For the server to read your message without your knowledge, it would have to conspire with enough server operators to get all the pieces that form your original message plus all the key shards--and further conspire with them to not burn the messages after they are read.

If you really don't trust the server operator, you can run your own “little shard” server to hold your key shards, or use the shard server of a person or organization whom you trust. You would need to store only a tiny shard of information to lock a potentially large message, so this seems feasible even if you have a slow Internet connection.

Here are two diagrams of the classic "Alice sends a message to Bob" frequently cited in technical discussions of encryption. They depict the high-level functionality of what happens to your messages when sent over the Natural Message network.


There is no need to exchange passwords, but if you use the ultimate security option, the main messaging server will not even know where your message is.

When you use the optional shared secret, the directory server (the main Natural Message machine) would receive a tiny file that contains the destination box ID (the code for the destination address), a legal notice, and an encrypted block of data that can be read only by sender and recipient. The block of code contains links to the shards that comprise the message, along with the key encryption key that is needed to decrypt the original encryption key. Without the shared secret, the server can see the list of URLs that point to the message shard, but it would be a crime for the server operator to access those URLs.  You you can test if the server is corrupt by sending test messages to see if your shards are unexpectedly burned.


Service providers who use the GNU public licensed server software will never have possession, custody, or control over the ultimate content of your message

The phrase “possession, custody, or control” comes directly from the U.S. Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure and the U.S. Federal Rules of Civil Procedure. They say that a party may be compelled to produce any evidence that is in their possession, custody, or control. In other words, if something is not in the possession, custody or control of a server operator, then the server operator does not need to produce it (and it also implies that it would be a crime for the server operator to steal it for the purpose of producing it).
The rules used by U.S. courts provide objective criteria for evaluating the privacy of the Natural Message network. Because no individual, no computer, and no organization involved in a Natural Message network will ever have possession, custody or control over the things needed to reconstruct your message, they can not legally obtain the contents of the message and therefore can not stockpile your messages in a way that would leave them vulnerable to a future hacker. The actual message shards will be stored on randomly selected nodes of a distributed network that spans multiple legal jurisdictions, and each shard server operator lacks information about the message itself (there is no message ID, recipient ID, sender ID, subject line, or other information that is accessible by the shard server operators).

Spam will be relegated to the history books.

Spam on the Natural Message network will be relegated to the history books, so server operators have fewer excuses to demand personal information in exchange for an email account, and governments will have no excuse for ludicrous regulations on free speech (e.g., a $10 million fine for closing an email account 59 days after sending a perfectly legal commercial message: see Canada Anti-Spam Law [CASL] sections 6[3] and 20[4]).

The Natural Message system fights Spam in several ways:

  • Each Natural Message box ID (akin to an email address) includes an expiration date.  After that date, servers will not forward messages to that inbox.  You can generate new box IDs with quick expiration dates if you are going to post your ID in a public place. After a month or so, the box ID expires, and servers will no longer send anything to that ID. The temporary IDs route messages to your normal inbox.

  • Box IDs (akin to email addresses) are based on long, random strings that can not be guessed. This avoids one of the techniques of Spammers, which is to send thousands of messages to random email addresses and see which ones do not come back with an error (random box IDs also mean that users can not leak information about their identities).

  • At the end of every year, users will create new box IDs and exchange contact info with friends (obviously you would not send your new contact info to somebody who has been sending you Spam). Yes, this takes some time---you can open new accounts in October, and the old ones will be good until January 31. The deadline is January of each year, but aim to finish the conversion by December. The full-functionality client appliations will eventually facilitate this process to make it easy.

  • Because box IDs expire each year, people will not accumulate decades worth of Spam, and it will be less profitable to deal in the sale of box IDs for Spamming purposes.

  • The free version of our Natural Message service will have a proof of work system. If Spam (or denial of service) becomes a problem, the proof of work requirement will be increased.

Natural Message does not have the single-point-of-failure flaw like the so-called “secure” systems that run java script in your browser

Applications that encrypt messages in your web browser and store the key online (encrypted with your password) are convenient, but they offer a false sense of security. A hacker, a dishonest server operator, or a government agent who gains access to the server can make a small change to the java script to leave the password unencrypted. This is known as a single point of failure because a hacker or government agent can make the change in one place, and the malware will be automatically distributed to users who load that web page.

It would be relatively easy for people to use the command line client (assuming that our fundraising goal is reached) to send data from a web form to a Natural Message box ID, and some users might want to do this. If users add such a form to their own web server, at least the risk is not spread to other users.

Limitations

There are some features that might or might not be implemented depending on review from the security and privacy community (e.g., alternative redundancy protocols, delivery to multiple recipients). Our ability to obtain outside security audits will depend on the success of our campaign. Better results on the campaign mean more thorough security audits.

The quality of the network will depend upon the number of collaborators who agree to host free shard servers that hold tiny pieces of files (currently 127 bytes of payload plus some overhead). If you or your organization is interested in hosting a shard server, contact us using the current information on our contact page. Remember that you can protect the privacy of potentially large files by hosting tiny shards of data.

The current test version of the client version allows sending to only one user at a time. We have a mechanism for allowing multiple recipients, but it needs technical review before we implement it.

The Simple Natural Message Client will be functional, but will not have all the features of the Mac OS X client or the planned iOS client. We hope to have the funding to build full-featured clients for all major platforms, but the simple client is the best way that we can make the system available to the widest audience in a short period of time. The Simple Natural Message Client will have a simple GUI interface and a command line interface (for programmers).

You can not communicate between a Natural Message box ID and an old-school email address (because the anonymity of the Natural Message system would lead to uncontrollable Spam being sent to old-school email). You can send old-school to old-school or Natural Message to Natural Message, but you can not mix and match.

If you want to use the old-school email transport, the best functionality will require that you have an email client already configured to use a regular email account. The old-school email transport works something like this: your Natural Message client application prepares the shards and shard metadata, and then puts a single link into your old-school email client (or you manually paste the link into a web client). The recipient clicks on the link, which will hopefully cause Natural Message client to open and read the message. We plan to register a MIME type so that your computer will recognize the URL and know that it should be opened with a Natural Message client application (we do not have a timeline for when an official MIME type might be registered).

If you use the old-school email transport, the likes of Yahoo, Google, GMX, AOL, and others can not legally discover where your Natural Message is, even under warrant, but if they (or hackers) intercept the old-school email and access your messages, you can know this because your real messages or test messages will be burned. None of the big email providers will be able to routinely read your messages without such practices being known to the global community, in which case, upgrade to the Natural Message transport.

 Some features might require proof of work (running a little program to solve math problems) to avoid abuse. Any proof of work will be performed by the client application.

Because one of our methods of supporting privacy is anonymity, we have no information about who uses an account (for the Natural Message transport). This means that we would have no way to stop people from using fake reply-to addresses when using the Natural Message transport. Users can minimize any threat of forged identity by (a) using many public box IDs (perhaps one ID per contact--all routing to the same inbox), (b) exchanging a shared secret, or (c) asking questions to verify the identity of other users. This is really no different than receiving an email from an old friend--you can not be 100% that it is really your friend unless you ask questions or take other precautions. We have a complicated challenge-response procedure that allows verification of a person without leaking any of the answers unless the person knows all the answers, but it is not practical for normal communications.

The server currently runs on CentOS 7 (there were difficulties with implementing the elliptic curve signing key in CentOS 6). Our focus will be on the one server platform until we have a moment to breathe and test other platforms. If you are good with Linux, you can probably install the server on Debian or other such operating systems.
story_txt:
Natural
Message: A private, anonymous email replacement


Natural Message is an easy-to-use, encrypted email system that allows you to send messages over two "transports:" old-school email (SMTP) or the more anonymous Natural Message transport.
This was our first campaign (February, 2015), which is now over--we might have a similar campaign in the future, so check http://naturalmessage.com for the latest information.  After we started the campaign, it became clear that that people wanted to see the system in action before committing to the project, so we focussed on preparing the Mac OS X client and a simple client that can run on Windows and UNIX-like systems.  Right now (March, 2015) the simple client is a command-line client, but a future version will have a GUI interface.  We are starting to upload to github and will start testing the Mac OS X full client and the simple client soon.
You can review our original Indiegogo page here to get an idea of what we are doing.
"Old school" email compared to Natural Message





Natural Message: Details
You can verify that third parties are not reading your messages because the actual content of your message is stored on independently operated servers that will delete the messages as soon as they are read (burn-on-read).  You can send test messages, and if the messages are burned before you read them, you know that your line is being tapped.  If you use the optional shared secret, no server will have the information to reassemble your message.
You will be able to send secure messages to your existing email contacts without asking them to sign up for a new account and without establishing a shared secret (recipients will be able to use the free, simple client to read or write messages on Mac OS X, Windows, Linux, and maybe more).  You can enjoy greater anonymity (and privacy of your social network) by sending messages over the Natural Message network.
The client application helps you to do the right thing and avoid security mistakes.

Natural Message does not have the single-point-of-failure 
flaw like the so-called “secure” systems that run java script in your 
browser.
The client program splits your encrypted message into pieces (shards) and stores them on a distributed network with the keys held by independent custodians.  When using the Natural Message client, the thing that is "mailed" is small file (the shared metadata file) that allows the recipient to reassemble the message. When using the old-school email transport, the thing that is "mailed" is an encoded link to the the shard metadata--click the link to open the reader.  With either transport, the person or business that handles the message does not have possession or control over the shards (and can not legally retrieve them).
If you use the old-school email transport, email providers like Google, Yahoo, and GMX will not know where your message is located or how big it is (all they have is a specially-encoded link and a legal notice saying that the content is private).
You can use an optional shared secret, in which case everything is encrypted again, and the shard metadata is encrypted so that the Natural Message directory server (the main server) will not know where your message is located (because the list of URLs that point to shards is encrypted with the shared secret that is known only by the sender and recipient).  
When you use the Natural Message transport, the system does not track IP, location (GPS), time sent, or user information--not even a user nickname.Spam will be relegated to the history books.Natural Message is as easy to use as an old-school email client other than the long addresses and once-per-year housekeeping.We have a working server and a working client that need tuning.
Project Goals
Our
first goal is to tune the existing server software and release it
under a GNU public license, then release the Mac
OS X client (requires the
latest OS X release) with a GNU public licensed library. 
If we meet that goal during this campaign, then our next “stretch
goal” would be to release a simple client for Windows and Linux
(open source running in Python 3 with a simple GUI and basic features
along with a command line version for programmers). This campaign is
the first step toward implementing full-functionality clients for all
the major platforms.Here is a table that illustrates our goal and stretch goals if we exceed our fundraising goals in this campaign.




Notes:



Deploy servers worldwide to achieve security objectives and allow for public testing and evaluation.


Release server endpoint API’s, data structures & security methods into public knowledge for evaluation by security/software development experts.


Deploy a modern Apple Mac client beyond the proof of concept along with the first version of the Objective-C open source library. This same API may also allow development of iOS based clients.


A client with simple GUI (Python) for Windows & Linux plus a command line version for programmers. While it will take us a while to deliver on this, getting to this level enables major desktop platforms.


Deploy Apple iPhone/iPod mobile client with a refined Objective-C open source library which contains any iPhone/iPod dependencies.


Deploy an Apple iPad mobile client with a completed Objective-C open source version 1.0 library containing any iPad dependencies.


The apps built under 4-7 for Microsoft, Linux and Apple platforms will be more refined applications with better UI/UX. Security audit as well.



Our long-term roadmap includes releasing full functionality applications along with open source libraries that are tuned to run on other operating systems (Windows, Android, Linux, etc.), localizing applications to other languages, and developing a version that would meet the needs of large businesses. you want to use the old-school email transport, the best
functionality will require that you have an email client already
configured to use a regular email account.  The old-school email
transport works something like this: your Natural Message client
application prepares the shards and shard metadata, and then puts a
single link into your old-school email client (or you manually paste
the link into a web client).  The recipient clicks on the link, which
will hopefully cause Natural Message client to open and read the
message.  We plan to register a MIME type so that your computer will
recognize the URL and know that it should be opened with a Natural
Message client application (we do not have a timeline for when an official MIME type might be registered).


If
you use the old-school email transport, the likes of Yahoo, Google,
GMX, AOL, and others can not legally discover where your Natural
Message is, even under warrant, but if they (or hackers) intercept
the old-school email and access your messages, you can know this
because your real messages or test messages will be burned.  None of
the big email providers will be able to routinely read your messages
without such practices being known to the global community, in which
case, upgrade to the Natural Message transport. 
 Some features might require proof of work (running a little program 
to solve math problems) to avoid abuse.  Any proof of work will be 
performed by the client application.


Because
one of our methods of supporting privacy is anonymity, we have no
information about who uses an account (for the Natural Message transport).  This means that we would have
no way to stop people from using fake reply-to addresses when using
the Natural Message transport.  Users can minimize any threat of
forged identity by (a) using many public box IDs (perhaps one ID per
contact--all routing to the same inbox), (b) exchanging a shared
secret, or (c) asking questions to verify the identity of other
users.  This is really no different than receiving an email from an
old friend--you can not be 100% that it is really your friend unless
you ask questions or take other precautions.  We have a complicated
challenge-response procedure that allows verification of a person
without leaking any of the answers unless the person knows all the
answers, but it is not practical for normal communications.


The
server currently runs on CentOS 7 (there were difficulties with
implementing the elliptic curve signing key in CentOS 6).  Our focus
will be on the one server platform until we have a moment to breathe
and test other platforms.  If you are good with Linux, you can
probably install the server on Debian or other such operating
systems.

story:
Cool off faster, perform better with the Xtractiv Cooling System.

Instant and effective relief from the heat. Especially useful during exercise, where heat becomes a limitation for your performance.


It doesn't matter if you're working hard in the gym, playing tennis in the summer Sun, or competing in a venue with broken air conditioning, you just can't perform with your full potential when you're overheating. Your muscles struggle to keep up at the metabolic level, sweating takes over, and then it's too late; your body's new priority is to remove body heat, so you can forget about performing your best.

Until now, training and overheating, even slightly, has been something we just got used to. If your body could cool off faster to stay in the optimal temperature ranges, how much better do you think you could perform?  

Note: This isn't just 'feeling' colder with no benefit to performance. 

What kind of performance enhancement can you expect? Here are a few independent experiments. More information on these can be found on our website.

 Long-term Effects (20-100% improvements in volume)


The above test is what happened long-term while using Xtractiv with two similar athletes (trained). In all workouts, athletes were allowed three sets with a near-maximal amount of reps for every set.

Short-term Effects (50-300% increase in next-set performance)


Above was our first experiment with interval training. We thought that such a small cooling interval (15 seconds) wouldn't have much effect on performance. We were gladly surprised.

Of course, results vary depending on what you do and then environment you're in. With our experiments, we've been recording 20% to 300% performance boosts when compared to the same training without Xtractiv.

Generally, the more intense your workouts are (i.e. heat generating), the more you can benefit from Xtractiv. By removing heat as a limitation, you can reach a whole other level of training that your physiology previously wouldn't allow.

How does it work?

The human body has evolved to regulate its temperature. You can't just touch something cold to any part of your body to get a truly significant effect, let alone a boost in performance.

By targeting specific surfaces on your palms or feet, and applying a combination of negative pressure (suction) and cool (or chilled water), Xtractiv amplifies your body's natural radiators to effectively extract heat from your body.

What goes on inside:


Xtractiv keeps your blood vessels dilated and maximizes cooling with both conduction and convection currents.

Touching something cold doesn't work in the same way at all, which makes that strategy completely ineffective. The blood vessels that transport warm and cooled blood constrict naturally, severely limiting heat loss from those specific areas. Other products that claim to cool you fast that don't bypass these mechanisms simply make you feel cooler, and nothing more.

Check out more information about the science behind it and cooling.

For all Disclaimers, click here.

When and how do I use Xtractiv?

During your normal rest times, whenever that may be. Any time you're waiting to get back in action is a good time to cool off. Whether you're training to be a fitness machine or need it for that final push, Xtractiv can help you.

Here are some examples:


Since the effects are immediate, Xtractiv can also be used during competition days where recovery time is at a premium.

Note: Xtractiv can increase the training stimulus of a session. Adequate recovery practices are still required during your non-training time. Always ensure proper nutrition and sleep, along with any other appropriate measures.

Here's a short video on how to set-up the Xtractiv Cooling System


It's as easy as adding water, placing your hand and activating the cooling system. You don't have to add water every time you use it. Just dump the water when the cooling system is to be stored.

An ice cube is recommended for over 45 minutes of cooling. This will be addressed in the full Xtractiv Kit.

Features

Right now it doesn't look sexy, we know, but it preforms perfectly. We'll be making it look cool with plastic injection molded parts.

  • Simple controls, easily and quickly used with one hand.

  • Super easy setup.

  • Only needs ~100ml of water (can be cold tap water or add an ice cube).

  • Interchangeable seals for more versatility, including use on the foot and different sizes.

  • Long battery life, over 180 uses (of 2 minutes) per charge. That's over a month's worth.

  • Low maintenance, easy cleanup. 

  • Compact size, fits in your gym bag.


Note: The Xtractiv Cooling System's future look is currently being re-imagined. We will update you as soon as it's ready!  

The various components:

Where we are, and where we're going

We've built prototypes to test the essential functionality, usefulness, practicality, and results. We're extremely pleased with what we've got, but we can't get to the next step without a larger investment.

 The evolution of the XCS:

The seals are easily interchangeable in all versions, and will remain that way to accommodate different sizes and types of seals. Every step of the development has improved on the convenience for the optimal results. The next steps are, for example, a negative pressure gauge that is small, rather than a relief valve with no indicator. Or temperature controls, rather than using an ice cube or cold water. In the end, we just want to deliver a practical and effective cooling system.

We're well aware of feature bloat, and we're doing everything possible to get you your cooling system as soon as humanly (and logistically) possible.

We're also doing more research on different methods and conditions to use the device. Both formal research on the general topic of core body cooling and our informal research can be found at our research page.

Just in case you're wondering, our next experiments are on German Volume Training, Escalating Density Training, and various types of explosive movements.


Perks

For $179 - FIRST ACCESS - Special Warranty

You get the Xtractiv Cooling System, a protective case, a shirt, and a sticker. More importantly, you get to be one of the first to own this device. This means many training cycles before your competition gets their hand on one. We'd like to keep in touch and get some critical feedback from you along the way.

For $189 - Second Production Run

You get the Xtractiv Cooling System, a protective case, a shirt, and a sticker. This version will become available once everything is set. The only reason for the wait is to optimize both the device and the methods used to make them. In the end, we want to deliver the best device possible.

We're anticipating 3-6 months later deliver with this perk.

For $999 - Team Package

You get the 5 Xtractiv Cooling Systems for your team or club. This includes Xtractiv's experts helping out with the perfect implementation into your programs. This tool can most likely augment all of your team's training. We're talking major competitive edge.

 Here are our t-shirts.


Stretch Goals

Getting to these milestones won't necessarily improve the performance of the XCS, but it will definitely help in making them.

$60 000 - Plastic Injection Molding for the highest quality and durability.

$100 000 - Upgraded cases and extra goodies.

Plan and funding

We're ready to go in nearly all facets of fabrication. All of the prototypes have been boxy so far, but we'll be able to change that with more funding. We're currently evaluating potential final designs to accommodate all necessary functions. We'll update you when this process reaches the next step.

Parts are being acquired from both domestic and oversea sources for testing and fitting. We haven't had any issues with the dozen pumps we've considered. As far as we know, the supply side can provide us with exactly what we need.

They're being assembled locally in Canada, and we're attempting to use as many North American parts as possible.

Some of the major things we need funds for include plastic injection molding, and potentially upgrading component pieces, such as the pumps and switches. 


Our Impact

Xtractiv wants to revolutionize the sporting world. We're talking about a whole tier shift; to raise everyone's baseline capacity. At the same time, we need to approach this daunting task one athlete at a time. If we could have it our way, we'd be working out with you every time you use it, but of course, this wouldn't be easy.
Fitness is not going away. The consciousness of the athletic community is shifting towards being smarter with time spent, and we're getting better at understanding where the effort needs to be.
We're here to improve your performance. Period. We'll do everything we can to make that possible.

Help us spread the word!

Indiegogo has some great sharing tools. Please spend a few seconds to click and share our campaign! Thank you!
